loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon C. was born in 1954. He is not married. 

He decided to join GHAPE and took his first loan of $30; since then, he has borrowed and repaid loans six times, using the money to invest in pig farming and cassava and yam cultivation. This business helps his community because he provides them with pork and other foods. The manure from the pigs also helps in the cultivation of vegetables and other foodstuffs.

With this loan he plans to buy piglets, feed, medication, and yam seeds; he also plans to set aside some money for medical services for his pigs.

loans.use: Purchase piglets and yam seeds

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose N. is married and has 6 dependants. She has received no formal education. Rose sells a special type of local doughnut which is popularly known as 'bofrot'. She uses flour, margarine and other ingredients to prepare the doughnuts at Kotokoraba in Cape Coast, which she has done since 1995. Rose uses her income to help her husband pay for school fees and other family expenses. Rose will use the loan to purchase more flour and other ingredients to increase production. With the new profits from her expanded business, Rose plans to help her husband with their children's education.

loans.use: Rose will use the loan to purchase more flour and other ingredients to increase production.

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.ru: Файзуллаева Зухро проживает в городе Вахдат, в одном из отдаленном кишлаке. Работает учителем средней школе №33. Кроме этого уже 3 года занимается земледелием. Замужем и имеет одного ребенка. Кредит планирует использовать на сельское хозяйство. Закупить семена пшеницы. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Zuhro F. lives in one of the distant villages of Vahdat. She works as a teacher at the secondary school number 33. Besides teaching, she has been practicing agriculture for 3 years. Zuhro is married and has a child. She plans to use this loan to purchase wheat seeds for her agricultural business. She will be able to repay the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wheat seeds

loans.name: Hayedar

texts.en:
Hayedar is a 37-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, in southern Lebanon. He sells cassettes, accessories, perfumes, and CDs in his shop. He has been in this business for ten years. Hayedar is aksing for a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his shop. Hayedar has been a microcredit client for five years now, and has always paid on time.
Previous loans helped him improve his professional and financial situation. Hayedar has succeeded by offering quality goods at  competitive prices.

loans.use: To purchase cassettes and CDs for resale.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena O., a 34-year-old mother of four children, is a rice grower. She lives in Bunawan Agusan Del Sur, a town known for rice farming where 35,757 people live.  Lorena started her business with a small parcel of land. Now she has acquired her own 1-hectare farm, which she and her husband till to support the needs of their children.

She is asking a loan from CEVI of Php 12,000 to purchase pesticides to increase farm productivity. She also will use the loan to buy a gallon of mega-yield and five sacks of fertilizer to have a better yield.

She wants to buy more rice field land in the future. In this way, she believes she will have a good future to give to her children. She is happy about being part of the CEVI program. Now, she enjoys the credit assistance, training and insurance coverage services they give to their clients.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is maintaining a village store in their village.  She came up with this kind of business so she can assist her husband in meeting the growing needs of their family.  To further improve her business, she would like to borrow a loan amounting to PHP 7,000.00 that she will use to purchase additional merchandise for her store.  She aims that somehow, she will able to develop her store into a bigger one for them to have a stable source of income and support their needs.  She knows that they should work hard and preserve to achieve their dreams to have a progressive life in their village.  

Rowena is 29 years old and married to Nicasio, a truck driver.  She and her husband are blessed with five children: Mirriam – 8 years old, grade two; Prince – 7 years old, grade one; John – 3 years old; Winimay – 2 years old and the newly born, Jaden. The couple was thankful that they were able to provide the needs of their family through their income.

loans.use: Additional Merchandise for her store

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria sells palm oil retail to his customers. She hopes for a loan amount of N60,000 to purchase more palm oil to sell.

She is 45 years old and married with five children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil to sell.

loans.name: Martha Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Martha Elizabeth H. L. tiene 40 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Madre, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de la Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio secundaria completa, tiene 2 hijos que dependen económicamente de ella.
Martha es costurera, se dedica a confeccionar prendas de vestir para damas y niños; manifiesta que a pesar de ser madre soltera se esfuerza en velar por el bienestar de sus hijos, y hacer crecer su negocio para que así obtenga mayores ingresos para el hogar; su negocio lo desarrolla en su domicilio.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles, que recibió de su Banco Comunal “Santa Lucia II”, lo invitó en la compra de materiales de costura y el arreglo de su máquina de coser.
Con el crédito de 600 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses,  lo invertirá en su negocio, la compra de una vitrina, hijos Y todos lo enseres necesarios para su negocio de costura.
Martha, tiene como sueño comprarse una remalladota industrial, para incrementar su producción y dar una mejor condición de vida  para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Martha Elizabeth H. L. is 40 years old and she lies in the Madre district of the province of Trujillo, in the department of la Liberdad, Peru. She completed high school and she has two children that depend on her financially. Martha is a seamstress and she works in the making of articles of clothing for women and children; despite being a single mother she strives to ensure the welfare of her children, and has expanded her business in order to obtain better income for her household; her business is located in her home. With her first loan of 300 soles, which she received from her Communal Bank called "Santa Lucia II", she invested in the purchase of sewing materials and the repair of her sewing machine. With this loan of 600 soles, which will be paid back in 4 months, she will invest in her business, buying a glass case and other necessary equipment for her sewing business. Martha dreams of buying an industrial sewing machine to increase her production and to improve the quality of life of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Donna Yates, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her business by buying a glass case and other things needed for sewing

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
Mr. Domingo T. is 54 years old and lives at San Vicente, Oroquieta City. He is married and has 3 children. His wife is a farm caretaker and all his children are schooling. His source of income is driving a tricycle.

He became a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in February 2009. He became interested in the programs and services that the cooperative offers. Mr. T. decided to apply for a loan of PHP 5,000 to repair his motorcycle vehicle that was damaged. He will not be able to generate daily income if his motorcycle is not repaired. He hopes that someday he will be able to buy another motorcycle for hire.

loans.use: To repair his motorcycle

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes E. works as a trader selling foodstuffs at Ankwanda near Elmina.  She is single with three children and has received an education through Junior High School. She is responsible for paying for her children’s school fees and her family’s housekeeping money. Her loan will be used to purchase additional oil, tomatoes, charcoal, and kenkey. She hopes to use her profit invest in her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase additional oil, tomatoes, charcoal, and kenkey.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine F., a 35-year-old woman married to a businessman, sells tea  on Juba's main street and requests a loan in order to stock more milk and sugar for her business. Christine has three children, two of whom attend school at Malakia Primary school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to build a rental house.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as  measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more sugar and milk for her business.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es: El señor Ramón Cortez, reside en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, tiene 44 años de edad, casado, su esposa le tiene  tres hijos de 14,17 y 19 años de edad, los tres estudian, su esposa es costurera con sus ingresos apoya  a su familia. El señor Ramon es guarda de seguridad desde hace dos años. Este es el tercer ciclo en Afodenic el cual va invertir en infraestructura en la compra de materiales de construcción para levantar un poco mas la casa y reparar el techo, para que quede en mejores condiciones y seguridad ya que tiene parte de las paredes de tabla y están en mal estado. Sus planes es poder apoyar a sus hijos para que se preparen profesionalmente
texts.en:
Señor Ramón Cortez lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood and is 44 and married. He and his wife have 3 children who are 14, 17, and 19. His children go to school, and his wife works as a seamstress. She uses her income to support their family. Ramón has worked as a security guard for 2 years. This is his third loan with Afodenic. He will use it to invest in construction materials to raise his house a little more and to repair the roof so it will be in better condition and provide more safety. Part of the wooden walls are in bad shape. His plans are to be able so support his children so they can become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to make repairs to his home

loans.name: Tuy

texts.en: Tuy S., 35, is married and lives with her two young children in the Kampong Cham province.  She is a local teacher, making $1.50 each day.  Her husband (pictured) is a construction worker who also raises pigs.  He typically makes $4 each day. Tuy is asking for a loan to raise pigs and to buy their feed.

loans.use: Raise pigs and purchase feed.

loans.name: Enma Consuelo

texts.es: La Señora Enma Rodríquez  cuenta con 54 años de edad, es Casada de oficios en el Servicios,  “Venta de Alimentos”, habita junto  a su Esposo, ella lleva 6 años en el Servicio  su residencia que se encuentra ubicado en el 2da Calle, 2-22 Zona 7, San Cristóbal Municipio de Totonicapán y departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ella pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar más materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas,  y tener mejores condiciones de vida
texts.en:
Mrs. Enma Rodríquez is 54 years old, married, and lives with her husband in San Cristóbal in the municipality of Totonicapán, in the state of Totonicapán, Guatemala. She works selling food which she has done for the last six years.

The demand of her customers have grown, but she is not in the economic position to increase her capital, so she turned to the ASDIR Association to apply for a loan, with the intention of buying more raw materials in order to increase her sales and have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing Raw Materiels

loans.name: Upendo North Group

texts.en:
Siwazuri is a member of the Upendo North borrower group in Kinyanambo, Iringa. She is a 23-year-old woman, is single, and is the mother of one child aged 2 years.

Siwazuri started her own business selling vegetables three years ago. She works twelve hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 240,000 Tanzania Shillings.

This is Siwazuri’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more vegetables. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Siwazuri hopes to save money and expand her business. 

Jenisia, another member of the Upendo North borrower group, has requested 250,000 Tsh in order to support her own food business.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is 45 years old she is married and mother six children. Currently all her children are schooling. She is sells smoked fishes and started her fish sales ten years ago at community market where she lives. She buys stock of fish from Yeji in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana and sells them on top of a table. She prepares and serves her customers with very tasty and good quality fish and because of that many customers buy from her stand. She buys stocks of fishes from the fish mongers. She has a high customer base that (customers) travels from the other part of the surrounding communities to buy her fish. She requests the loan to upgrade her stock of fishes. She dreams to give her children quality education through the proceeds from the business. She would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy more stock of smoked fishes and dried fish.

loans.name: Eliazar

texts.es: Eliazar M. R. tiene 46 años. Es una hombre casado, tiene 2 hijos que estaña su cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es compra y venta de ganado. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Anteriormente laboraba en una fábrica, pero debido a un recorte de personal tuvieron que despedirlo, por lo que el necesitaba una fuente de ingresos para su familia por lo que tenía que sustentar su hogar, por lo que le pidió ayuda a su Papa que el enseño lo necesario, y así decide dedicarse a este negocio. Así recurre a Fundación León 2000 para la compra de vacas. El deseo de Eliazar es aumentar su negocio para proporcionarle a su hijos estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Eliazar M. R. is 46 years old, married, and has 2 dependent children. He has been buying and selling livestock for more than 5 years. He previously worked at a factory, but was laid off because of a reduction in staff. Eliazar needed to find a source of income in order to support his family, so he asked his father for advice on how to start this business. From that point, he has continued to move forward.

Eliazar has returned to Fundación León 2000 to request a loan in order to buy cattle. He hopes to expand his business so that he can pay for his children’s college education.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Dalal

texts.en:
Dalal is a young Palestinian woman who is married with four children. Her business is the main source of income for the family since her husband was a daily worker in Israel, but when Israel build the separation wall, he became unable to enter. So, currently he helps his wife to manage the shop.

Dalal sells home equipment like glasses, pans, cups and kitchenware. In addition, she sells clothes since there is a high demand for clothes during the coming months: Eid al Fitr (a Muslim holiday), Eid Al Adha (a Muslim holiday), Christmas and back to school season.

Dalal requested a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to expand her shop in order to have a better income for the family since her husband no longer works. Dalal Appear at her shop in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase new products for her shop

loans.name: Kawugu C Asimwe Christine Group

texts.en: A. Christine is the group secretary, she is thirty-two years old, married with four children of whom three are schooling and she has two more people that she is caring for in her home and they are also schooling. She operates a retail shop since the year 2005. She is requesting for the loan to purchase retail item such as salt, sugar, soap, bread, etc increasing on the stocking. She is a hardworking business lady whose dream is to prosper and widen on her business.

loans.use: To purchase retail item such as salt, sugar, soap, bread, etc increasing on the stocking.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina D. is from the town of Masabud, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old, is married, and has three infant children. Gina owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Gina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan 6,000 from GDMPC. Gina is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her fifth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad A. is from the village of Orang, Cabgan, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 60 years old, is married, and has five adult children. Trinidad owns and operates a business raising fish for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Trinidad joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase baby fish to raise and sell. Trinidad is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Emilienne

texts.fr: O. Emilienne est née le 19 Septembre 1977 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Emilienne est mariée à GBEGAN Constant, un militaire. Le couple a deux enfants en charge, dont un est leur propre enfant et est scolarisé. Il y a trois ans déjà que Emilienne vit à Kouhounou, un quartier de Cotonou, avec son conjoint et ses enfants. Seul Constant supporte les charges de la famille. Emilienne a fréquenté l'école jusqu'au secondaire. Depuis cinq ans, Emilienne vend divers articles (savons, omo, conserves, sardines, lait, petit pois, tomate, piment, riz, huile végétale, sucre, etc.) à son domicile. Emilienne s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Emilienne a déjà obtenu une fois de crédit à ALIDé et a bien remboursé la crédit. C'est pour accroître davantage son activité et la diversifier que Emilienne sollicite un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
O. Emilienne was born on September 19, 1977 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  She is married to GBEGAN Constant, a soldier.  The couple has two children to support.  One of them is theirs and in school. For three years already, she has lived in Kouhounou, a district of Cotonou, with her husband and children.  Her husband Constant is the only one financially responsible for the family.  Emilienne attended school through the secondary level.  For five years in her home, she has been selling a variety of items (soaps, Omo, canned foods, sardines, milk, peas, tomatoes, chili peppers, rice, vegetable oil, sugar, etc.)  She stocks up at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin.  She once had an ALIDé loan, which she repaid.  To grow her business more and to diversify it, she's requesting another loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods (canned foods, sugar, vegetable oil, rice)

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen has a stall where she sells groceries and drinks at retail prices to her customers. She is 56 years old and is married with five children.

Helen is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. Helen hopes for a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

Helen hopes to own a supermarket in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Saom

texts.en: Saom C., 50, is a married mother who is blessed with two school-aged kids – a boy and a girl – who assist her in her business when they are not studying. To generate a daily revenue, she built a small shop in front of her own family home where she sells meats and soft drinks, mostly to her neighbors. Another source of family income comes from her husband, who is a recycling seller. Rice will command its lowest price in this coming season, so Saom C. thinks that it is an opportune time to generate additional income by buying rice in bulk from farmers, which she will resell.  It is for this purpose that she is requesting a loan.

loans.use: to buy rice for resale

loans.name: Maricyle

texts.en: Maricyle G.'s main source of income comes from buying and selling coconut (locally known as copras) in her community. She is a 23-year-old single woman from the village of Guinsiliban, Camiguin province. Maricyle is just starting this business. In 2009, Maricyle joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Maricyle is requesting a loan of 4,000 Philippine pesos which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Heng C. is a fish seller who has been experienced in this sector for years. She is 49 years old and is a married mother, caring for two kids who are working in the garment industry. Another one of her children is married and lives away from home. Her husband is a construction foreman. Heng C. has a single son who wants to have a wife and needs to have a wedding party, but Heng C. doesn’t have money yet to have a party. Therefore, she has requested a loan of $700 in order to perform a party, if possible.

loans.use: To perform a wedding party

loans.name: Sros

texts.en: Mrs. Sros S. is 30 years old and lives in Si Sla village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Bol Koch, are farmers who own a 1-hectare field where they cultivate rice. Mrs. Sros S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide to assist during the dry farming season. Mr. Bol Koch also works as a laborer, driving a cultivator, in the local village. He makes a small income to support his family. Mr. Bol Koch has a child who is too young to study or work. Her husband and child are shown with her in the photo.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Abies

texts.en:
Abies owns a cosmetics shop where she sells items like powder, body creams, bathing soap, olive oil and more. She also sells beads which are used to beautify oneself after being dressed for an occasion or a normal outing, especially for the ladies in this part of the country.

Due to high patronage, Abies wants to stock her shop with more goods as this attracts more customers and increases sales. She hopes for loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more cosmetics and beads to sell.

Abies is 38 years old and is married with four children; they live in Benin City, Nigeria. Her youngest child is 3 years old and she is in school. Abies’ dream is to give her husband all the financial support that he needs to educate the children to the university level. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics and beads to sell

loans.name: Domingo José

texts.es:
El señor Domingo José R. D., es trabajador de la escuela Frank Cortez, se desempaña como profesor de educación física des desde hace 5 años, es soltero pero tiene dos hijos en edad escolar.

El señor Domingo José R. D. tiene un vehículo Volkswagen que actualmente lo tiene en el taller pero no contaba con fondos para comprar repuestos de dicho vehículo, por esta razón el señor R. solicito financiamiento a ceprodel.
texts.en:
Domingo works in at the Frank Cortez School. He has been teaching physical education for the past five years. He is single but has five school-aged children. He has a Volkswagen, which is currently in the repair shop, but he did not have the money to buy the replacement parts he needed, so he has requested financing through Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo R., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Spare parts to repair his car

loans.name: Chor

texts.en:
Chor S., 29 years old, is married and resides with her husband (pictured above) and two children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She stays at home to look after the children and do household chores while her husband works as a mechanic, earning an income of 10.60 USD per day to help cover the family expenses.

The family’s standard of living has improved since Chor’s husband has been in business. Chor is requesting a loan of 1200 USD to purchase mechanic's supplies to expand her husband current business. This is her second loan from CREDIT, which is partnered with Kiva.

loans.use: To buy mechanic's supplies to expand her husband's business

loans.name: Vorn's Group

texts.en: Four people who are villagers in Pou Ta Pang village in Kandal province make up this group loan. Mrs. Vorn C. is the group leader, selected by all the members. They will use the loan for different purposes. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to grow vegetables to sell to support her family. She now faces a problem because her field has infertile soil. Thus, in order to improve production of vegetables, Mrs. Vorn C. decided to seek a loan to buy fertilizer, gasoline, and pesticide. She is a widow with two children, one of whom is a seamstress in the garment factory and the other is a laborer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, gasoline, and pesticide

loans.name: Gladis Karina

texts.es:
Gladis C. de 32 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín (lugar muy humilde, con casas de caña, caminos montañosos y calles de tierra) de Guayaquil. Su casa es mixta de cemento y caña solo cuenta con agua y luz como servicio básico.  Esta separada de su esposo y tiene que mantener a sus dos hijas de 15 y 9 años de edad.

Gladis tenia hace 11 años atrás un puesto de comidas en el mercado “Pedro Pablo Gómez” (lugar donde hay muchos comerciantes informales) de Guayaquil. Pero por políticas del Gobierno la echaron de ese lugar y tuvo que readecuar su casa para ubicar su pequeño puesto de víveres en la parte delantera de su casa.

Por esa buena decisión ahora tiene una tienda surtida con legumbres, pañales, arroz etc. Su horario de trabajo es desde las 05:30 am hasta el anochecer. La tienda es el único ingreso económico que tiene ella y sus hijas por eso quiere surtir más su tienda. Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, bebidas y recargas para un nuevo servicio de celulares.

En el futuro quiere mejorar mejor su casa y que sus hijas terminen todos sus estudios.
texts.en:
Gladis is 32 years old, and lives in El Fortín, a humble place, with houses of cane, mountainous roads and dirt streets, on the outskirts of Guayaquil. Her house is a mixture of concrete and cane and has only water and lights as basic services. She is separated from her husband and has to maintain her 2 daughters, aged 15 and 9. Eleven years ago, Gladis had a stall selling meals in Guayaquil's Pedro Pablo Gómez Market, a location with many informal merchants. But due to changes in government policy, they were thrown out and she had to modify her house to include her small provisions store in the back. Due to this good decision now she has a store supplied with vegetables, diapers, rice, etc. Her work schedule is from 5:30 am until dark. The store is the only source of income for Gladis and her girls, and for that reason, she wants to expand her merchandise. With this loan she intends to buy rice, drinks, and rechargers for a new cellular service. In the future, she wishes to improve her house and assure that her daughters finish all their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING RICE, DRINKS, AND TELEPHONE RECHARGERS FOR HER STORE

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga sells clothing at the central market in Novomoskovsk town. Her monthly profit is 2,000 UAH. Olga has been in this business for 10 years. She has learned that to be successful, she needs to have a large variety of items and very good service. Olga feels this is something she can do well. 

Olga would like to borrow 3,300 UAH to increase her inventory. Olga is not married and does not have children.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria I. is from the town of Banga. She is 40 years old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Gloria grows rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over 17 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

Gloria joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria is requesting a loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure and other farming supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Gloria from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and improve the living conditions of her family. 

About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure and other farming supplies

loans.name: Tanto Kuru Group

texts.en:
The leader of this group is Fatu C.. Fatu is age 45. She was born in Makolo village near Magburaka. Now she lives in Magburaka with her husband and two children. Her husband is a teacher and one of her children is attending primary school. For nine years now, Fatu has been selling cooked rice, fish, meat and vegetables. Fatu will use this loan to buy fish and rice wholesale. 

In the photo are members of the “Tanto-Kuru” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fish and rice wholesale

loans.name: Narmandah

texts.en:
Narmandah L. is 46 years old and lives with her husband and son in Uvurhangai province in central Mongolia. Her son is a student in a university, while her husband is retired but helps with her business. 

Narmandah operates a consumer goods and clothing mobile business in her town. She purchases and imports her products in Ereen, a border city of China. By managing and conducting her business successfully, she has been able to achieve stable operations in a short time. 

Her husband Dashzeveg is a very talented person who makes horse-head fiddles and trains children as fiddle players. He has used the success of his business to greatly improve his quality of life and has made at least 50 to 60 horse-head fiddles. For the future, the couple hope to improve the quality of the musical instrument and their business earnings. 

Narmandah hopes her business profit will enable her to pay her son's university tuition fee. She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to buy more clothes and consumer goods in Ereen, China.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and consumer goods to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is blessed with a three-year-old child.  She operates a salon to earn a living.  As a single mother, she works hard in her business in order to earn enough income to raise her child.  She opened her salon six years ago, and has managed to expand her business in Faulu, Kenya.  This was possible because of a previous loan of 20,000 KES taken out by her. Mary now wants to buy beauty products, hair braids and hair oil. Hence she is requesting a loan of 40,000 KES.  She hopes to expand her business further and open a hair dressing college in the future.

loans.use: To buy beauty products, hair braids and hair oil

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita E., age 50, and her husband, Fernando, are working hard to cover their daily expenses and pay for their child's education.  Anita runs a grocery store in Silang, Cavite, which she hopes one day to expand.  

Anita would like to replenish her grocery store stock with the help of a PHP 49,000 loan, which she will use to purchase soft drinks, condiments, and snacks.  She hopes that the additional inventory will increase her revenue and provide her with stability in her business.  

Anita has been a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) since 2005 and has consistently attended weekly fellowship meetings.*  She hopes to fully fund her child's education and to have a peaceful, happy, and stable life.  

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to be incorporated into her current product inventory

loans.name: Teressa

texts.en:
Teressa C. is from the city of Gango, Ozamiz City. She is 42 years old. Teressa is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Teressa owns & operates a business selling foods like "salad" in the local community. Teressa has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Teressa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teressa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. Teressa is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Teressa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Gracelda

texts.en:
Gracelda M. is from the village of West Poblacion, in Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 37 years old, married, and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Gracelda owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling personal products, such as lotions and shampoos from different suppliers, in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Gracelda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional products to sell. She is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & as working capital. This will be Gracelda’s 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Sem

texts.en: Mrs. Sem P. was born in 1966 and she lives in Pongro village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Roeun Pheng, are farmers who own a 1-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice on to sell to support their family. Her husband is also a farm laborer. Her problem is that her field has infertile soil, but she does not have enough money to amend it. So, to improve her rice production, Mrs. Sem P. is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide. With any remainder of the loan, she will hire someone to plow her field. She is a mother of three children, two of whom are attending school, while the youngest one is three years old. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide and hire someone to plow

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is married with one son. She sells clothing and shoes at the local market. Maria has been in this business for 10 years. Her monthly income is about 5,000 Grivnas. Maria enjoys her business and would like to develop it further. She is requesting a loan of 6,000 Grivnas to expand her seasonal inventory. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To expand seasonal inventory

loans.name: Rosa Hilda

texts.es:
Rosa de 55 años, la servicios de lavado para las ropas y vende productos Yambal (empresa que ofrece a mujeres emprendedoras comenzar con sus ventas independientes). Con su esposo y siete hijos viven en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil (zona urbana, llamada las orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas). 

Desde que se caso con su esposo ella lo ayudo económicamente para que pueda mantener a su familia, inicio lavando la ropa de sus vecinos en su lavadora poco a poco obtuvo capital para comprar productos de uso personal a Yambal como perfumes, cremas, desodorantes. En la actualidad tiene las dos actividades trabaja desde las 07h30 hasta las 20h00pm todos los días. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar una lavadora y cremas, perfumes para que sus ingresos mejoren. En el futuro quiere tener un local para su lavandería.
texts.en:
Rosa is 55 years old.  She runs a clothes laundering service and sells Yambal products (a company that offers women entrepreneurs the possibility to begin selling independently).  She lives with her husband and seven children in Orquídeas de Guayaquil (urban area called orchids because there were many orchid flowers when it was founded).

From the time she married her husband she has helped him economically to provide for the family.  She began washing her neighbors’ clothes in her washing machine.  Little by little she earned capital to purchase Yambal personal care products such as perfumes, creams and deodorants.  She is currently working both jobs from 7:30 a.m. until 8:00 p.m. every day.

She would like to buy a washing machine and creams and perfumes with the loan so that her income improves.  She would like to have her own  place for her laundering service in the future.

loans.use: Washing machines, perfumes and creams

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor es un joven de 25 años de edad, muy emprendedor ayuda a su madre con los gastos del hogar, se dedica a la venta de medicina de forma ambulante, vive con sus padres es soltero y no tiene hijos, todos trabajan en la familia para cubrir las necesidades que a diario enfrentan, ellos residen en San Rafael Oriente, departamento de San Miguel.
El tiene el negocio de medicinas que lo aprendió en su primer trabajo después él quiso tener su propio negocio y fue así como dio inicio a su propia venta;  él ya cuenta con clientela y la visita seguido ofreciéndole medicamentos, pero por el momento Víctor necesita invertir en el negocio para ofrecer mayor cantidad de productos  y diversificar la venta, esta inversión la hará solamente a través de un préstamo, permitiéndole crecer y estabilizarse.
Él quiere convertirse en un vendedor mayoritario, tener un negocio prospero, y darle una mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Victor is 25 years old.  An enterprising young man who helps his mother with the household expenses, Victor works selling various natural medicines and health products.   He lives with his parents and is still single and without children.   They live in an area called San Rafael Oriente in San Migeul, and the entire family works to cover their daily expenses.  Victor learned about his current work in his first job, after which he decided to start his own business.   He now counts on regular customers.  He would like to invest in his business and be able to offer a greater number of products to his customers.   He can only make this investment with a loan, which would permit him to to grow and establish his business even more.   Victor has become a good salesman, he has a prosperous business and he's been able to help contribute to his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase more of the natural medicines he sells in his business.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Vida Nueva Group

texts.es: VIDA NUEVA. Es un banco de emprendimiento formado en la zona sur de la ciudad de La Paz, en la población de chijipata, por se una zona muy alejada no cuenta con servicio de movilidad constante tan solo ingresa a la zona una línea de minibuses los cuales son en muchos casos fuentes de trabajo para esa zona, esta compuesto por 8 socias las cuales en su mayoría se dedican al comercio, como la Sra. Alicia	 que es la presidenta del banco fue elegida por sus compañeras por su solidaridad y su responsabilidad, la Sra. Alicia vende pescado por muchas Zonas de la ciudad de La paz, ella tiene dos hijos quienes aun están en época escolar, también vive con el esposo quien se dedica al trabajo de albañil, ambos apoyan con el gasto del hogar ambos sueñan con tener su casita propia ya que en la actualidad viven como cuidadores en la misma zona, el préstamo será usado en el incremento de su capital, comprando Pescado por lata ya que tiene muchos pedidos ya que tiene muchos clientes en la Zona y tendrá muchos mas ingresos y de esta manera poder mejorar la condición de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
VIDA NUEVA (New Life) is a communal bank located in the south of La Paz in an area called Chijipata.  Because it’s a distant area it doesn’t have reliable public transportation services.  There is only one minibus company that comes into the area and in many cases it’s the source of employment in the area.  It has 8 members who for the most part are merchants.

Alicia, group President, was elected by her fellow members because of her solidarity and responsibility.  Alicia sells fish in several sections of the city of La Paz.  She has two school age children and also lives with her husband who is a bricklayer.  Both contribute to household expenses and dream with having their own little house because they currently live as caretakers in the same area.

The loan will be used to increase working capital to buy canned fish because she has several pending orders and many customers in the area and she’ll have more income to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy canned fish in quantity.

loans.name: Moses Tenik

texts.en:
Moses Tenik is 30 years old and sells quarry stones in Ngurunga, a very busy but remote area in Kitengela. He is a single man. Moses was introduced to KADET by the credit officer in charge of the Kitengela office.

Moses has been selling quarry stones for a period of three years and his monthly profit is KES 15,000. This loan of KES 20,000 is his second loan with KADET, his previous loan having been repaid with no problems. He plans to use the loan to buy quarry stones for sale. If the loan boosts his business, he will purchase livestock for trade. Moses describes himself as hardworking. He dreams that he will become a prominent businessman in the future.

loans.use: to buy quarry stones

loans.name: Avaz

texts.ru: Алматов Аваз проживает в районе Шахритус. Ему 50 лет. Он женат. Имеет четверых детей. Образование среднее. Зарабатывает он путем разведения крупно-рогатого скота. У него имеется не большой коровник. Аваз покупает молодых бычков, откармливает и продает на рынке по более выгодной цене. Это помогает обеспечивать семью. Целью кредита является закуп крупно-рогатого скота. Именно сейчас покупка крупно-рогатого скота может быть выгодна, так как зимою животные исхудавшие, продаются по низким ценам. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже 15 лет.
texts.en: A. Avas lives in the Shahrituz region. He's fifty years old, married and has four children. He has a high school level of education and has made a living for the past fifteen years by breeding livestock. He buys young bulls, fattens them and then sells them at the market for profit. This helps feed the family. He even has a small barn. He's asking for a loan to buy some more cattle, because this is one of the most profitable times to do so: in the winter, animals are very thin and tend to be a lot cheaper.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Elisa Audelina

texts.es:
ELISA AUDELINA O. T.
Elisa tiene 56 años, es casada, tiene cuatro hijos, su negocio es una tienda y tortillería desde hace seis años,  es una mujer muy trabajadora y con la ayuda de su esposo han podido mantener el negocio que está situado en la misma casa,  sus hijos  están casados y ella todavía tiene sueños y metas, uno de ellos  es poder ayudar a sus nietos y brindarles una mejor vida, una de sus hijas le ayuda en la tortillería y  se han dado cuenta que necesitan más inversión para brindarles un mejor servicio a los clientes y poder generar más ganancias por eso piden a FAPE y KIVA poder otorgarles un préstamo para su negocio.
Donde invertirán Productos comestibles y maiz
texts.en:
ELISA AUDELINA O. T.
Elisa is 56, married and has four children. Her business is a store and tortilla store which she has had for six years. She is a very hard-working woman who has been able to maintain her business with the help of her husband. Her business is in their own home. Her children are married and she still has dreams and goals, one of which is to be able to help her grandchildren and offer them a better life. One of her daughters helps her in the tortilla store and they have noticed that they need to invest more in order to offer a better service to their customers and generate more income. For this reason, they are requesting a loan from FAPE and Kiva for their business. They will invest in edible products and corn.

loans.use: to purchase edible products and corn

loans.name: Imelda Akiru

texts.en:
Imelda Akiru M. is a thirty-four-year-old married woman who has three children. Her husband is a business man in Lodwar.

Imelda has two businesess in Lodwar,  a salon which also has a boutique inside it. She has been in these business for ten years and earns a monthly income of thirteen thousand shillings.

With her loan from KADET LTD, Imelda plans to buy more clothes for the boutique so that she can sell them to customers who come to her salon. 

She plans to use her income to increase her clothing inventory. In the future, she would like to be finacially stable so that she can support her family comfortably.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos G. Vda. S. M.  de 60 años de edad, es madre soltera de un pequeño de 11 años de edad, junto a quien vive en Santa Tecla, en el  departamento de La Libertad. Santos posee una tienda en la cual vende productos de primera necesidad para el hogar y para las personas tales como: jabón, shampoo, pan, leche, golosinas, y otros productos más los cuales son básicos en este tipo de negocios. Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos y amigos, ya que posee 20 años de contar con la tienda, lo que la hace muy conocida en la zona. Santos solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda surtir su negocio con todo lo necesario para aumentar su inventario y de esta manera ofrecer más productos a sus clientes y así mejorar sus ganancias y poder salir adelante junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Santos G. Vda. S. M. is 60 years old and a single mother of an eleven year old child. They live together in Santa Tecla, which is in the Department of La Libertad. Santos has a store where she sells basic household and personal products such as soap, shampoo, bread, milk, candy, and other items that are essential to this type of business. She has very good references from her neighbors and friends. Santos has been managing her store for twenty years and is well known in the area.

She is requesting a loan so that she can restock her business with everything she needs to increaS. her inventory and offer more products to her customers. This will allow her to improve her earnings so that she and her family can get ahead.

loans.use: Purchase basic necessity products

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Nazareth Group

texts.en:
Shaibu K. (the only man pictured, in the back of the picture) is a married man in his late fifties. He and his wife have grownup children. To earn a living, for the past two years he has been running a local bar. On a daily basis, he works from midday to 10:00 pm. By doing so, he is able to make a nice monthly profit.

This is the third loan Shaibu has requested through Tujijenge Tanzania Ltd. He used the previous loans, which he successfully repaid, to increase his working capital. With this loan, he is hoping to increase his inventory. His dream is to someday secure an individual loan to purchase his own retail shop.

Shaibu would share this loan with his loan group, Nazareth, which has a total of 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: To expand and improve his business by purchasing additional inventory

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es: El Sr Gracia  labora como Agente de seguridad  es casado, tiene tres  persona a su cargo,  es el primer  del crédito que CEPRODEL le otorga, agradece el apoyo  a esta institución con  este  desembolso para  terminar de pagar un terreno  y así  poder construir su vivienda porque donde vivi estan posado.
texts.en: Sr. G. works as a security guard. He is married and supports three people on his wages. This is the first loan he is seeking from Kiva partner Ceprodel, and he is grateful for the support. With the money he will finish paying for a piece of land he is buying; he will then be able to build a home on it as where he used to live is being repossessed.

loans.use: purchase land on which to build a home

loans.name: Oscar Nelson

texts.es:
El señor Oscar de 51 años de edad es zapatero y está casado con la señora Lourdes de 41 años de edad, tienen  un  hijo de 5 años de edad.
La pareja se dedica a la zapatería desde hace más de 10 años, el señor Oscar había heredado el oficio de sus padres, actualmente es profesional y ya cuenta con su propia Marca de calzados "IVAN", el cual lo fue logrando con mucho esfuerzo y con la ayuda de su cónyuge.
Realiza calzados finos para damas, caballeros y para escolares.
Solicita ayuda crediticia a Fundación Paraguaya para la compra de todo tipo de insumos básicos de zapatería como cuero, cuerina, pegamentos, caucho, goma cortada, diluyente y otros. Obteniendo todos estos insumos agilizaría la producción y estaría cumpliendo con todos sus clientes.
El mismo al retirarse agradeció la ayuda a la Fundación Paraguaya y a Kiva.
texts.en:
Sr. Oscar is 51 years old and works as a shoemaker. He is married to Sra. Lourdes, age 41, and they have a five year old son.

The couple has been managing a shoe store for more than ten years. Sr. Oscar learned this trade from his parents. He is now a professional shoemaker and produces his own brand of shoes called “IVAN”, which was launched with great effort and with the help of his wife. Oscar produces high-end shoes for women, men, and school children.

He is requesting a loan from Fundación Paraguaya in order to buy all types of basic supplies for making shoes such as genuine leather, imitation leather, adhesives, rubber, solvents, and other items. Acquiring these supplies would speed up production and help him meet the demands of all his customers.

Oscar expresses his appreciation for the support from Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase leather, adhesives, rubber, solvents, and other supplies for making shoes.

loans.name: Segundo Carlos

texts.es:
SEGUNDO CARLOS V. S., tiene 58 años de edad, es casado, vive con la esposa y con los hijos solteros son 7, vive en San Miguel  en el Recinto Tangara perteneciente a la Provincia de Bolívar.

Esta Ventanillas se llama CAMPECINOS UNIDOS  esta ubicada en el recinto Tangara y se encuentra a unos 15 minutos del Cantón San Miguel, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura y al comercio.

Segundo se dedica al trabajo de campo en la agricultura en especial al siembra de maíz para vender en grano seco.
Comprar sus productos en San Miguel y los vende en la Feria del mismo Cantón.

El crédito lo solicita para la comprar de abono y urea, el crédito apoyado en el negocio familiar ya que produce mas y se tiene que trabajar para pagar la deuda. Su sueño es comprar un carro para transportar los productos a San Miguel que es donde vende.

Le gusta salir a ver como hacer deposte.
texts.en:
SEGUNDO CARLOS V. S., 58, is married.  There are 7 in his house, including his wife and unmarried children.  They live in Recinto Tangara in the Ecuadorean province of Bolivar.

Segundo belongs to the CAMPESINOS UNIDOS community bank in Recinto Tangara, some 15 minutes from San Miguel.  The bank's members are farmers and merchants.  

Segundo, a farmer, plants maize which he sells off the stalk.  He buys the supplies that he needs for the farm in San Miguel and sells what he grows at local market fairs.  

Segundo is applying for a loan to buy supplies of manure and fertilizer for his farming business.  The loan will help him increase his crop yields and, in turn, earn the income he needs to support his family and repay the loan.  He ultimately wants to buy a "carro" (not sure--car or cart) so that he can more easily carry his crop to the market in San Miguel.

Segundo enjoys watching sports.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer for farming business

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David K. G. is 54 years old. He is married to Edith Njoki and they have three children together. He runs a mini petro station and has been in this business for the last five years.

This marks David’s first loan from KADET, and he plans to purchase more diesel to put into his business. The income that will be generated from the business will be directed into the expansion of the business.

His dream is to venture into the transport sector.

loans.use: purchase more diesel for his petro station

loans.name: Garama

texts.en:
Garama is a married man with three school-going children. They live at a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

He has operated a dairy farming business for the past three years; he sells milk from home and at the market to his neighbours and passersby. Garama faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. During hot summer season the availability of milk for sale is minimal. He dreams of becoming a reliable supplier of milk in his area in the future. 

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) he is requesting he wants to purchase a cow for his dairy business. He decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for his dairy business.

loans.name: Ilia

texts.en:
Ilia is a 49-year-old farmer from the village of Ghaniri. He is married and lives with his wife Maya and two sons (19 and 12 years old). His older son serves in the Georgian Army and the younger son goes to school. 

The only source of income for the family is agriculture. In particular, they have three milk cows. The milk is used for cheese production. Approximately 80 kg of traditional Georgian cheese is sold per month. Also, they own 2 ha of land, where maize is grown; four tons of maize is harvested annually, 0.5 tons of which is sold on the market. The rest of the corn is used in the family. Along with the above-mentioned, Ilia and Maya grow strawberries on a plot with an area of 400 sq. meters. Approximately 300 kg of strawberries are sold during the season. 

500 Laris from the requested credit will be used for tilling and fertilizing the land. After the above-mentioned processes, Ilia and Maya will get more and better quality harvest and sell it for a higher price. That will positively impact the income of the family. With the remaining 700 Laris Ilia and Maya will purchase a new refrigerator for their house. 

The received profit will be used for expansion of the dairy farm. Ilia plans to purchase additional cows.

loans.use: to purchase fuel for tractor, fertilizers and a refrigerator.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “KANCHARY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Jaime; el tiene 34 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de transporte, el es chofer y hace servicio de taxi en las diferentes calles de la ciudad de Cusco, el socio trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este trabajo el socio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere mejorar el negocio de servicio de taxi. El  socio solicita el préstamo para mantenimiento de su carro.      
                                                  
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "KANCHARY", which is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

Mr. Jaime, 34, has a common-law partner and two children.  He alternates his daily activities with his transportation business.  He provides taxi service in the city of Cusco from 6:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m.  This business provides him with an income to support his children.  He wants to improve his taxi service and has requested a loan to pay for automobile maintenance.

He is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To pay for automobile maintenance.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna is married and works hard to support her five children. She runs a tailoring business in the Philippines and is applying for a loan for PHP 1,800 from NWTF to buy a new stove that will make more efficient use of the firewood she uses for her cooking. The new stove will also help the environment and reduce health hazards and other risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a new stove.

loans.name: Susanbar

texts.en: Susanbar is from the village of Saratak in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She is married with four children – two daughters (twenty-nine and thirty-seven years old) and two sons (thirty-three and thirty-five years old).  Susanbar has a high school education and has been working in agriculture for thirty-nine years.  She supports her family with the proceeds of the family farm.  She dreams of saving enough money to help her grandchildren attend university.  Susanbar is looking for a loan to purchase potato seeds and fertilizer.  She expects her investment to increase the family income by twenty-five percent.  Susanbar enjoys living in Saratak as she is close to her children and grandchildren.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 29 years old and is married with two children between the ages of one and four years old. He owns a business of transporting people.  Emmanuel has been in this business for about one year and his business is open from 7 am until 10 pm every day. 

Emmanuel has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase another motorcycle to help him in the business. With any profits, he  will reinvest in his business and save for his family's future.

loans.use: To purchase another motorcycle to help him.

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
Esther tiene 44 años de edad, vive con sus 3 hijos en una comunidad pequeña y rural del distrito de Tambogrande, en Piura.

Esther se dedica a la crianza y  venta de ganado ovino. Actualmente cuenta con 20 animales. Ella tiene 7 años de experiencia en su negocio, lo que le ha permitido ganar una clientela fija, a pesar de la gran competencia con la que cuenta.

Esther solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar alimento balanceado a sus ovejas y hacer mejoras en el corral donde las cría. Esto le permitirá mejorar su negocio, pues sus ovinos tendrán una mejor crianza y los podrá vender a mejores precios.

Esther es una clienta conocida de nuestra entidad y goza de buenas referencias crediticias.
texts.en:
Esther is 44 years old and lives with her 3 children in a small, rural community in the Tambogrande district in Piura.  

Esther raises and sells sheep for a living.  Currently, she has 20 animals.  Her 7 years of experience in this business has allowed her to earn a steady clientele in spite of the enormous competition.  

Esther is requesting a loan of 1000 nuevos soles through Edpyme Alternativa to purchase balanced feed for her sheep and to make improvements to the pen where she raises them.  This will allow her to improve her business as she will be able to better raise her sheep and sell them for better prices. 

Esther is a returning customer to our institution and enjoys good credit references.

loans.use: purchase balanced feed for her sheep and improve their pen.

loans.name: Libia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MARIA ELENA MOYANO”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Libia, la socia tiene 66 años de edad, la socia tiene 3 hijos de 42, 40, 36 años de edad; la socia es casada y ella se dedica desde hace 40 años a la compra y venta de autopartes es un negocio hereditario, sus padres y los padres de estos formaron el negocio que con las generaciones que se vinieron se hizo un negocio familiar;  La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de repuestos de autopartes que la socia hace pedidos para implementar su tienda de venta de autopartes. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar repuestos (autopartes) e implementar su negocio.

 La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the “MARIA ELENA MOYANO” communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Huanchac, province of Cusco, in the Department of Cusco.

Her name is Libia, and she is 66 years old. She has 3 children, aged 42, 40, and 36. She is married, and for the past 40 years, she has worked buying and selling auto parts. It is an inherited family business; her parents and their parents befO. them built up the business, and over the generations it became a family business. The borrower is requesting the loan to invest in ordering additional auto parts to stock her auto parts business. She needs the loan to buy spare parts (auto parts) and stock her business. 

The borrower is grateful for the support provided to her, and accordingly she is committed to fulfilling her payment schedule in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy auto parts and stock her business.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: This is 41-year-old Mohamed. He is married and has 5 children aged 21, 17, 14, 9 and 4 years. He has 1 additional dependent, his niece, who lives with him. In 1993, Mohamed established his clothing business. He started his business because he believed this could earn him enough income to provide for his family. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,050,000 every month. He would like a loan of Le 5,000,000. Mohamed has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans and now requires a new loan to buy additional clothing for his business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000. In the future, Mohamed plans to improve his business and to educate his children to university level. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for additional clothing materials for his business

loans.name: Grimaldo

texts.es:
Grimaldo nació en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú) y tiene 50 años de edad, él está casado y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos. Actualmente, él vive en la misma  ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades, él se dedica a la venta de fruta como por ejemplo naranjas, piñas, papayas y otras frutas más. Ya son 15 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. El sueño de Grimaldo es abrir una tienda de frutas en el centro de la ciudad. 

Grimaldo requiere el préstamo para comprar mas fruta como por ejemplo naranjas, piñas y papayas. 

El Banco Comunal “Siempre Adelante” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Grimaldo was born in the city of Cusco (Perú) and is 50 years old.  He’s married and has three children.  He currently lives in the same city where he was born and where he carries out his activities.  He sells fruit like oranges, pineapples, papayas and other fruit, for example.  He’s been in business for fifteen years now and does very well thanks to the effort he puts into his work.  Grimaldo’s dream is to open a fruit market in the center of town.  Grimaldo needs the loan to buy more fruit like, for example, oranges, pineapples and papayas.

The “Siempre Adelante” (Always Forward) communal bank meets every thirty days in the city of Cusco (Perú). Cusco is known for tourism, commerce, for its traditional “Inti Raymi” festival and because one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu, is located here.

loans.use: to buy more fruit like oranges, pineapples and papayas.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 46 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosita is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosita has been raising pigs for two years and also earns an additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Kroch's Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan with four members that is located in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. Mrs. Krouch was chosen to be a team leader. Presently, she has been generating a kind of business as a cake seller in one market near her village. According to her good relationship to all clients, it is easy way for her to sell well every day. From this business sector; she is able to get a profit approximately 3 USD daily. Mrs. Krouch is 60 years old and a married woman. She is a hardworking person for covering her family's expenses. 

Mrs. Krouch is seeking for a loan in amount of $200USD in the purpose to additional her capital to produce more cakes to satisfy her clients at the market. This will be her second loan cycle with the Kiva partner HKL. Mrs. Krouch hopes that this loan will support her family meet her financial needs and improve the quality of her business. Mrs. Krouch describes herself as an easygoing woman who is honorable and very responsible. In the future, she wishes to have a bigger house.

loans.use: to produce more cakes.

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
Genalyn is 27 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. 
Genalyn runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 17,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. She has borrowed and paid back six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for a year and also earns an income from pig fattening.
Genalyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Dennis Sammy

texts.en:
Dennis, age 26 and unmarried, describes himself as God-fearing and obedient. He operates a pub where he sells soft drinks, wines, and spirits. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a shopping center. He describes his biggest business challenge to be financial constraints. 

He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to increase his stock of sodas. His business goal is to relocate his business to the town center within five years. He hopes in the future to diversify his business into a general store and open a soft drinks depot.

loans.use: to increase his stock of sodas

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is divorced and has four children. She sells provisions and is also a hair dresser in Takoradi, which she has done for three years. She wishes to buy hair products to stock her shop so that she can use them on her customers' hair. The loan she is hoping to receive will be used to procure these hair products.

loans.use: to procure hair products.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en: Joel is 53 years, married, has two children and earns a living by raising livestock. He has been in this line of work for 15 years and earns an income of KES 10,000 a month which he uses to support his family. He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after having been introduced to our organization by an existing customer. Joel will use the loan to buy animal feed and a young cow. He hopes to use the increased profit he earns as a result of this loan to improve his family's living standards and start putting money aside to open a retail store in the future.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and a young cow.

loans.name: Maria Ninfa

texts.es: La señora María Ninfa en su finca ubicada en el municipio de Marinilla al oriente de Antioquia, se dedica junto con su esposo a la producción de leche y cultivos de frijol, cilantro y papas. La señora María Ninfa trabaja incansablemente para salir adelante con su pequeño hijo de cuatro años quien a su corta edad sufre de varias enfermedades que requieren de tratamientos muy costosos. Para poder tener más ingresos la señora María Ninfa desea comprar una vaca y abono para su cultivo de cilantro con el fin de poder generar mayores ingresos que le permitan tener la capacidad económica para sostener a su familia y los tratamientos de su hijo a quien sueña verlo estudiando y con una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Ninfa and her husband are dairy farmers and grow beans, coriander and potatoes on their farm located in the town of Marinilla in east Antioquia.  María Ninfa works tirelessly to get ahead with her little, four-year-old son who at his short age suffers from several illnesses which require very costly treatments.  

In order to earn more income, María Ninfa wants to buy a cow and manure for her coriander crops to generate higher income that will give her the economic capacity to support her family and her son’s treatments.  She dreams with seeing him going to school and having a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a cow and manure for her coriander crops.

loans.name: Haychatou

texts.fr:
Haychétou  est une jeune marchande  âgée de 28 ans  et célibataire. Elle  s’active dans la vente de denrées alimentaire depuis 4 ans déjà 
Avec le prêt, elle veut renforcer son activé  en augmentant ses marchandises et en même temps acheter un mouton pour les fêtes de la Tabaski
Haychatou vit chez  ses parents et n’a aucune charge ce qui fait que ses bénéfices  sont reversés dans  son capital.
texts.en: Haychatou is a young, single, 28-year-old merchant. She has been actively selling food for four years already. With the loan, she wants to strengthen her business by increasing her merchandise and also buy a sheep for the Tabaski celebrations. Haychatou lives with her parents and doesn't need to look after anyone which means that her profits are put back into her capital.

loans.use: to buy food and a sheep for Tabaski.

loans.name: Roxana Cristel

texts.es:
Roxana, vive con su esposo y dos hijos; ella se dedica a tender una pequeña granja su esposo el agricultor siembra maíz y frijol, lleva cuatro años dedicándose a estas actividades y le han permitido hasta el momento poder sobrellevar las obligaciones del lugar.
Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar pollos pequeños y aumentar la granja, además invertirá en insumos agrícolas como abona y herbicidas para los cultivos de su esposo; teniendo todo lo anterior podrá continuar en sus actividades cotidianas, oportunidad de mejorar sus ingresos a futuro.
Ella quiere mantenerse en el negocio por eso a través de préstamos espera crecer y fortalecer su hogar mejor disposición económica.
texts.en: Roxana lives with her husband and two children.  She runs a small farm for a living.  Her husband is a farmer and plants corn and beans.  She has been doing this for four years.  Until now this has allowed her to survive their obligations.  She is requesting a loan to buy young chickens and increase her business.  She will also invest in agricultural supplies such as fertilizer and herbicides for her husband's crops.  Having all of this will allow her to continue with her daily activities and give her the opportunity to improve her future earnings.  She wants to maintain her business through loans.  She hopes to grow and strengthen her household's financial situation.

loans.use: purchase young chickens.

loans.name: Gnonnamahouton Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GNONNAMAHOUTON  est formé de trois  personnes qui appartiennent à un même groupe d'artisans. Le représentant de ce groupe, nommé Sèdohouè Etienne, est celui dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier d’ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Sèdohouè Etienne est marié à une marchande du nom de Félicienne. Le couple a cinq enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. En dehors de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à leur charge. Sèdohouè Etienne vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec sa femme, les diverses charges de la famille. Sèdohouè Etienne a arrêté l'école au cours primaire et a appris la maçonnerie, activité qu'il exerce depuis une dizaine d'année. Dans la quête d'une meilleure satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son revenu, Sèdohouè Etienne désire acquérir des moules métalliques. Pour ce faire, Sèdohouè Etienne sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GNONNAMAHOUTON, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The group Gnonnamahouton is made up of three people who all come from the same group of artisans.  The representative of the group, Sèdohouè Etienne, is the one with his hand raised in the photo.  This is the third time that the group has applied for financial support from ALIDé in order to raise their level of business.  Sèdohouè Etienne is married to a merchant whose name is Félicienne.  The couple has five children, all of whom are in school and in the care of their parents.  Besides their own children, the couple has another child in their care.
