Sèdohouè Etienne lives together with his wife and children, and provides for the diverse needs of his family along with his wife.  Sèdohouè Etienne left school at the primary level and learned masonry,  an occupation he has held for some twelve years.  With the goals of a more highly satisfied customer base and revenue growth, Sèdohouè Etienne would like to acquire metal molds.  To do this, Sèdohouè Etienne is requesting, along with the other members of the Gnonnamahouton group, a third loan from ALIDé.  The first two loans were paid back in full.

loans.use: To purchase metal molds.

loans.name: Maria Elvira

texts.es: A sus 32 años, Maria Elvira es una madre cabeza de familia donde tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Debido a la separación con su esposo, Maria Elvira se vio en la necesidad de recurrir al trabajo para poder cargar con los gastos del hogar. Inició en un puesto de legumbrería donde con su trabajo logró aprender lo necesario y luego con sus ahorros montó su propio puesto de legumbres en el parque principal de Támesis, al Suroeste de Antioquia. Desde entonces ha venido trabajando fuertemente con el ánimo de sacar sus hijos adelante y poderles brindar la educación que requieren. Sueña con poder incrementar sus ventas, que su negocio crezca y dejarles un legado a sus hijos donde puedan trabajar y donde puedan encontrar una estabilidad económica. Quiere que en un futuro sus hijos puedan comprar sus propias casas con su trabajo y para eso mantiene la búsqueda inalcanzable del crecimiento de su negocio; es por esto que requiere de la compra de legumbres para incrementar el surtido de su legumbrería y hacerla más atractiva para sus clientes, de modo que incremente sus ventas y pueda lograr mejorarle la calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en: Maria Elvira, 32, is a mother and head of household with 2 children in her care.  Because she separated from her husband, Maria Elvira saw the need to return to work so that she could take on the burden of the household expenses.  She started out working in a sales post selling vegetables where she managed to learn what she needed about this type of work, and later with her savings she established her own post selling vegetables in the main park of  Támesis, to the southeast of Antioquia.  Since then, she has been working hard with the aim of providing for her children, and providing them with the education that they need.  She dreams of being able to increase her sales, of growing her business so that she can leave a legacy to her children where they can work and have economic stability.  In the future she wants her children to be able to buy their own homes with their work, and so for this reason she sustains a relentless pursuit of business growth.  To do this, she needs to buy vegetables to increase the inventory of her sales post and make it more attractive to customers, so that she can increase her sales and achieve a better quality of life for her children.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to increase the inventory of her business

loans.name: Gladys Cecilia

texts.es: Gladys  desde muy joven veía a su madre coser y de ella aprendió mucho de lo que hoy sabe hacer, porque ella mediante estudio perfeccionó su arte específicamente en calado y bordado y actualmente definió su línea de confecciones en el plano infantil. Su mayor riqueza es su creatividad con la que diseña y trabaja los vestidos de niñas especialmente. Con su negocio ha logrado apoyar el bienestar de su hogar, conformado por su esposo y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 30 a 33 años. Su meta es seguir progresando y llegar a estructurar una unidad de negocios mas formalizada y con tecnología que genere empleo. Mientras esto ocurre trabaja diariamente con gran esfuerzo, dinamismo y alegría, obteniendo una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menor del 38,5%, sus inventarios rotan cada 30 días y sus   cuentas por cobrar cada 12 días. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer financiamiento a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con la cual comprará una fileteadora y materias primas e insumos de confección, para responde a su exigente clientela con el delicado acabado que solo ella puede ofrecer en su mercado.
texts.en:
From a very young age Gladys watched her mother sew and learned much of what she knows how to do today because through courses she perfected her art especially in openwork and embroidery.  She has defined her line specifically in infant ware.  Her greatest gift is her creativity with which she designs and manufactures dresses for little girls, especially.

With her business she has managed to support her home’s wellbeing; it is composed of her husband and three children whose ages range between 30 and 33.  Her goal is to continue making progress to reach a more formalized business structure with technology that will create jobs.  While this happens, however, she works daily with much effort, dynamism and joy obtaining a profit margin of no less than 38.5% and a 30-day stock turnover rate; her accounts receivable are 12 days.

She is currently applying for her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she’ll use to buy a serger sewing machine, raw materials and sewing supplies to respond to her demanding clientele with the delicate finishing touches that only she provides in her market.

loans.use: to buy serger sewing machine, raw materials and supplies.

loans.name: Nara

texts.en:
Nara (in the photo) now sells meat balls and boiled duck eggs at home and she sells fish that her husband catches in her local market. Her husband is a fisherman. In the past, Nara used to be a garment worker. The couple has been married since 1993 and they have two children
who are in school. They live in a village approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

The walls of Nara’s are old and break, she wants to make the repairs. Hence, Nara is applying for a loan in the amount of $1,000.

loans.use: To repair the walls of her house.

loans.name: San Ramon Group

texts.es:
18 son las mujeres que integran este grupo, están trabajando de manera unida y se ayudan las unas a las otras, también están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde Miguela, una de las integrantes es una persona es muy luchadora.
Ella se dedica a la venta de prendas variadas que vende de manera ambulante, y con lo cual mantiene y ayuda a su familia. Es muy sacrificada ya que no quiere que sus seres queridos pasen por necesidades.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas variadas para la venta, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir con su trabajo luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en:
There are 18 women who form this group. They are working in a unified way and they help each other, one for the other. They also are part of the poverty elimination program, where Miguela, one of the members, is a tough fighter.

She sells a variety of garments through traveling sales. With this, she takes care of her family. She is very sacrificing because she doesn't want her loved ones to forego any necessities.

She is requesting this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of a variety of clothes to sell. In this way, she will be able to continue her work, fighting to improve her living conditions and those of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of garments to sell.

loans.name: Edith A.

texts.fr: Edith A. âgée de 38 ans, a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Edith A. est mariée à un vitrier du nom de Antoine. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Edith A. vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont supportée par le couple. Pour cette raison, Edith A. vend depuis huit ans à son domicile et par la méthode de distribution, des tissus et des bijoux comme activité principale. Parallèlement à cette activité, Edith A. vend des conserves et des sucres. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Edith A. achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Edith A. sollicite pour une première fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des tissus et des bijoux

loans.name: Annet-

texts.en: Annet- is a hardworking woman with five children living in Bundibugyo Uganda. Her business is mainly buying and selling oils on top of cocoa growing for supplementary income.  She has a great desire of accumulating more capital and becoming a prominent business woman in her area, although she complains of the difficulty of high transport costs, unpredictable weather changes and limited capital. She is in need of a loan to buy cocoa to sale to her increasing number of customers.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle .

loans.name: Sarvan

texts.en: Sarvan is 23 years old. He lives in Salyan region Yenikand village. He has been engaged in this business for 2 years. He has his own store. This single man applies for a loan $650 to buy the perfumery, to open other perfumer\'s shop.

loans.use: to buy perfumery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Teleyio Turere would like to buy different varieties of beads materials for her business.

loans.name: Tiarawati

texts.en: Tiarawati  is 29 years old, and is married with one boy. To supplement her husband’s income, Tiarawati sells various snacks and instant noodles in front of her house at her small store. In a day Tiarawati can earn  of $2 and eventually she can earn around $38 in a month. She needs a loan of $75 and with this loan, she can buy more goods to sell and thus more or less double her income, therefore she can have a better life.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Quy

texts.en: Quy and his wife sell fish and work as day laborers to support their family. Their 3 younger children are in school. Two older children stay home to help their parents. They tend 200 green dragon plants (for fruit). Their average income is $12 per month per person. They want to borrow $50 to increase the available capital for their fish-selling micro-business. They plan to pay it back over the space of 5 months.

loans.use: increase available capital for fish selling

loans.name: In

texts.en: Mrs. In H. is 45 years old and lives with her 60-year-old husband in the Kampong Cham district of Cambodia. Mrs. In H. is a farmer, whilst her husband works as a teacher in the local school, which earns H. only $1.60 day. They have three children, one of whom is married; the other two work at a garment factory, earning $2.40 a day. In H. intends to use this loan to buy a sewing machine for her husband to set up a tailoring business to run when he has spare time from his job as a schoolmaster.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia worked as a nurse for 15 years, but she began to have arthritis in her hands and knees from the work and had to quit the job. As a single mother, she still had to take care of her three children and provide for their education, so she started selling used clothing and toys in January 1987. She had some sales experience because previously she had sold cosmetics in her free time. Back then, she needed to sell many items to able to cover her expenses, so she went to the outskirts of local markets (she couldn't afford to pay for a post inside). With a lot of hard work she was able to set up outposts in all the open markets in the region and a larger space to sell her goods.

With Christmas time fast approaching, Alicia wants to offer a wider variety of the toys children want. She is requesting a loan of $850, which she plans to repay within six months, to purchase more supplies for her customers. With your help Alicia can grow her small business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Alicia trabajó 15 años como enfermera pero comenzó a enfermarse de reumas en las manos y en las rodillas por el esfuerzo que hacía en el trabajo y tuvo que dejar de trabajar, pero como es madre soltera de tres hijos, y tenía que mantenerlos y darles estudio, comenzó a dedicarse a la venta de ropa usada y de juguetes. En Enero de1987, Alicia tenía cierta experiencia en ventas ya que antes se había dedicado a la venta de cosméticos en sus ratos libres, pero ese año por necesidad tuvo que vender más cosas para poder completar para sus gastos, y así que comenzó a vender en las orillas de los mercados ambulantes porque las personas que ya tenían tiempo la corrían ya que no pagaba las cuotas que ellos exigían, y así con mucho esfuerzo fue agarrando su lugar en todos los mercados ambulantes de la región y un espacio más grande donde poner su puesto.

Sin embargo la temporada navideña le exige tener más variedad para vender los juguetes que tantos niños quieren. Por lo tanto está solicitando un crédito de US $850 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con ese dinero Alicia podrá comprar más mercancía para que sus clientes puedan tener de dónde escoger. Con tu ayuda lograrás que Alicia pueda crecer su pequeño negocio.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for Christmas season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy parts for his shop

loans.name: Mayra's Group

texts.en:
Marya and Nancy have been associates of the community bank “Alborada” for four months. Mayra is 23 years old and single, while Nancy is 31 and married with one 13-year-old daughter. For the past five years Mayra has had a store selling grocery items such as rice, sugar, tuna fish, soft drinks, sweets, beer, potatoes, and wheat which she buys in the nearby district of Quinua.

Nancy has been selling cosmetics from a catalogue for four years. She sells the items from her house and shares the profits with her sister.

Their loans are for 200 and 800 soles respectively (3 soles = $1) which they will invest in buying groceries, exchanging goods in the regional market of Cejelambras, buying corn, and wheat, expanding Nancy's supply of cosmetics, and fixing Nancy's husband’s car.

They plan to use their savings to further develop their businesses, and to buy healthy food for Nancy's daughter. Mayra and Nancy say that in their community bank they have learned values, responsibility, how to have friends, how to run a business, and how to work with other people.

Their dreams are to become professionals. Nancy is studying education, to be a responsible mother and daughter, and hopes to save for her daughter’s future. She hopes that her husband will not have to stop studying physical education, and she would like to have a bigger house.

loans.use: Their loans are for 200 and 800 soles respectively (3 soles = $1) which they will invest in buying groceries, exchanging goods in the regional market of Cejelambras, buying corn and wheat, expanding their supply of cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Nkechi

texts.en: Nkechi A. is 40 years old, married with 4 children and hails from Iba Area of Lagos State Nigeria. She sells building materials including sand, rod and granite. She needs the loan in the amount of $775 to buy more building materials for sale.

loans.use: To buy more building materials for sale

loans.name: Pervane

texts.en: Pervane A. is an Internally Displaced Person from Fuzuli region of Azerbaijan. She has lived in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijin since 1993 with her family. She is 34 years-old, married and has three children. She has raised chickens in her yard and sold them in Beylagan city bazaar for more than seven years. She applied to Normicro Beylagan Branch for a loan of $250 for developing her business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Sylvia's Mikanjuni Group

texts.en:
Sylvia is 24 years old and is single with 1 child, age 6. Sylvia owns a small shop, and she is a charcoal seller, which she started doing in 2007. Every day she works from 8:00 AM to 10:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Tonaji, who has a business dealing in a salon and cloth sales.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Maybel Maxcen

texts.es:
Senora Maybel works at your business of selling lime and sand. Her business is located in a room of her house and has been working out of it for the past 5 years. She began this business because her her husband's income was not enough to cover the needs of the house and she needed to better the the conditions of her life and her children's (who are of school age.)

Actually, Senora Mayble is already known in her area and has various clients. She sells her products to small and large truck drivers who then import them to their destinations.It should be emphasized that Ceprodel (the city) has been a solid place of business. In the past, she has received loans to commercialize her products. Today she requests a loan to buy more lime, sand and for construction.

This story has been translated from Spanish to English by Nikita Ramchandani, KIVA Volunteer.

La señora Maybel se dedica al negocio de la venta de cal y arena en su casa de habitación dedicándose a este negocio desde hace cinco años el cual incursionó a este negocio por el hecho de que los ingresos de su cónyuge no cubrían con las necesidades de su hogar y para ello necesitaba mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y sus hijos en edad escolar.

Actualmente la señora Maybel es muy reconocida en el municipio ya que tiene varios clientes que llegan a comprar los productos en camiones o camionetas para llevarlos a destinos específicos donde se construye con esto productos. Es de necesidad destacar que Ceprodel ha sido un fundamento sólido para el negocio por haber dado créditos que le han permitido adquirir estos productos para la comercialización. Hoy en día una vez mas solicita los créditos confiando en que al ser aprobados le servirán de mucha ayuda para la compra de la cal y arena para la construccion.

loans.use: To buy lime.

loans.name: Solehjon

texts.ru:
Solehjon N. is a teacher. He graduated from Tajik Pedagogical Institute. He does not work in his profession, but works in retail. He has a store at the market where he sells building materials. It is now the season when people fix their homes and begin building, which is why it is necessary for Solehjon to increase his sales and variety of goods. This will help raise his profits, which his family needs very much. Solehjon is married and has 5 children. This is why he does not have any personal savings, and receiving a loan would help him improve financial situation of the family. He plans to repay the loan within 18 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Нарзуллоев Солехджон педагог.Закончил Таджикский педагогический институт. По специальности не работает. А занимается торговлей. Имеет магазин на рынке, где продает строительные материалы. Сейчас сезон, когда люди делают ремонт и начинают стройки , поэтому ему необходимо увеличить товарооборот и ассортимент товара. Это поможет ему увеличить прибыль, которая так необходима его семье. Солехджон женат и имеет 5 детей. Поэтому своих сбережений он не имеет, а получение кредита очень помогло бы ему улучшить финансовое положение семьи. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 18 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase variety of goods

loans.name: Seynabou

texts.fr:
Seynabou G., 43, is married and the mother of 7 children with 2 other children in her care. She has been a member of the village bank of Khodoba in Thiès for 7 years. Her business is buying and selling seasonal fruit (mangoes, oranges, mandarins, etc.) Her income permits her to improve the living conditions and health of her family and pay school fees for her children. The loan that she is requesting will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Seynabou G., 43 ans mariée, mère de 07 enfants avec 02 autres enfants à sa charge est membre du banc villageois de Khodoba à Thiès depuis 7 ans. Elle achète les fruits de saison (mangues, oranges, mandarine etc) et revend pour poursuivre son commerce de fruits. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie, de santé et de scolarité de ses enfants. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use:
buying and selling seasonal fruit

commerce de fruits de saison

loans.name: Adesuwa

texts.en:
Adesuwa I. is lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is 37 years old and is married with 5 children. She runs a clothing business. She has been in this business since 2004. She learned this business from her mother. 

Adesuwa needs the loan for $775 to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi: Chị Lá năm nay 44 tuổi. Chồng chị không may mất sớm nên kinh tế gia đình chị đã khó khăn lại càng khó khăn hơn.. Năm 1997 chị xin tham gia Quỹ tình thương và  vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn gà. Ngoài công việc chăn nuôi hàng ngày chị Lá còn đi làm thuê cho các gia đình, các doanh nghiệp  tại địa phương. Đến nay qua 10 năm tham gia Quỹ, bằng sự cố gẵng nỗ lực của bản thân chị đã nuôi được các con trưởng thành, cuộc sống của hai mẹ con chị cũng đã dần ổn định hơn. Hiện nay thu nhập của gia đình chị 1,5 triệu đồng /tháng. Chị muốn vay thêm 6.000.000đ để  sang chuồng trại và mua giống lợn về nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lá is 44 years old. As she lost her husband early, it worsened her family's economy, which was already in a difficult situation. In 1997, she joined the Fund and asked a loan to invest into breed pigs and poultry breeding. Besides her main occupation of daily breeding, Mrs. Lá also works as a daily worker for various businesses in the region. After 10 years with the Fund, and through her own efforts, she managed to grow up her child and their conditions of life have also gradually stabilized. Today, her family's income is 1.500.000đ per month. She would like to borrow an additional 6.000.000đ in order to set up a breeding facility and purchase pigs for raising.

Translated from Vietnamese by Minh Bui, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Faleseu

texts.en:
Faleseu R., 45, is married with eight children. She has many years of experience in the sewing business. She sells to the village people and public six days per week. 

She has six previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~$208 USD). SPBD loans are Faleseu's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

Part of the loan will be used to finance what is needed for home renovation and school fees for her kids. Her husband does the farming.

loans.use: Purchase another sewing machine, needles, pins, thread, rolls of material and cement, timber and school fees

loans.name: Mujeres Solidarias Group

texts.en:
"Mujeres Solidarias" is a big group of 37 people. Right now 15 members of this group would like a loan. For some members, this is their first loan. They hope it is their first step towards a better life. For other members, this is their 3rd or 4th loan, which they will use to continue growing their businesses.

Yoselin is the group representative and group leader. She is a very hard working mother of 3 young children who are all under the age of 10. She has a small business selling under garments. Yoselin said she is excited about continuing to grow her business.

Yoselin has dreams of being able to have her own house where she can provide her children a comfortable life. She hopes to have enough money to send her children to college and allow them to have a different life.

This whole group has stories of how hard life has been, but they are all ready to do something about it, They are very excited about this opportunity.

On behalf of Yoselin, the group, and Esperanza International----- Thank you for your support!!!

loans.use: Buy additional underwear and night wear for sale

loans.name: Mr. Sovan Mee Village Bank Group

texts.en: This group loan is being requested by fourteen people who live in Kampong Svay Village in Kandal Province. Mr. Sovan M. has been chosen group leader by the members. He is a motorbike taxi driver who is not able to earn enough income to support his family. This is the case even though he also farms a small piece of land on which he grows rice. On this farm, the main problem he faces is poor quality land which needs fertilizer. That is why Mr. Sovan M. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and make his land more productive. His wife, Mrs. Eng Rotha, is a housewife who takes good care of their family and is an excellent cook. Mr. Sovan M. and his wife have six children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory. Three attend a local school while the remaining two are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Zein

texts.en: Zein is a 37-year-old married man with three children living in Deir Kifa, in southern Lebanon. A car mechanic, he opened his own workshop in 1988. Zein started renovating his garage and he is asking for a loan of $1,200 to buy an automatic car lift for faster and better customer service.

loans.use: To buy a car lift for a garage

loans.name: Oem

texts.en: Mrs. Oem K. is a villager in Tuol Tro village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, she faces a problem because she does not have enough money to purchase fertilizer and a pump machine to make her crops more productive. Thus, Mrs. Oem K. decided to ask for a loan. Her husband, Mr. Oeun Samnang, is a fisherman. Mrs. Oem K. is 25 years old and the mother of of three children, all of whom are too young to wok or study. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: for fertilizer and a irrigation pump machine to make her crops more productive.

loans.name: Secondary School, Fadugu Group

texts.en:
These prospective borrowers are teachers at an Agricultural Secondary School in Fadugu.  It was founded in 2003. Today, it has a total of 580 pupils (both female and male) with a staff of sixteen teachers. This Agricultural Secondary School is the only secondary school in the whole Kasonko Chiefdom. Once pupils graduate from the school (which is a Junior Secondary School – JSS), they then move to a senior secondary school in Kabala (twenty-five miles from Fadugu), which is the nearest  big town to Fadugu. Others go to other bigger towns like Makeni, Bo, Kenema, or Freetown. The school teaches mainly agriculture which is the primary occupation of the people of Fadugu. 

Since it is the only secondary school in the chiefdom, accommodating the pupils has become a problem for the school. The school lacks enough buildings to house the growing number of pupils within and around the whole chiefdom. Staffing too is another problem facing the school; almost all of the teachers in the school are unqualified. In addition to these problems, the library lacks the required textbooks.


Notwithstanding these constraints facing the school, this secondary school prides itself on producing 100% passes at the Basic Education Examination (BECE) for the academic years of 2005 – 2007. Though the school may lack trained and qualified teachers (since it is in a small town,; the few qualified and trained teachers in the country prefer teaching in bigger towns), it has determined, dedicated and willing teachers who are willing and ready to assist the children to make the grade. 

Patrick M. T. (left) is the Principal of the school. He has been in the teaching profession for thirty-one years.  He is fifty years of age, married with six children, all of whom are still in school. Patrick M. T. will use part of his share of the loan to buy building materials in order to start building his first house and part to pay his children’s school fees.

loans.use: to buy building materials and children's school fees

loans.name: Kwadwo

texts.en:
Kwadwo O. is divorced and the father of one child. He is a thirty-five-year-old businessman. He owns a boutique shop and sells men’s wear such as suits, shirts and trousers, shoes, belts and caps. He has been in business for the past fifteen years.

O. says he purchases his stock from major wholesale outlets in Accra and sometimes travels to China. He wants to inject more working capital into his trade to enable to him purchase bulk quantities during his trips. With the loan, he believes he would be more resourced to purchase good quality stock to satisfy his customers. He hopes that he can increase his profit margin substantially to enable him to support his family, especially to pay for the education of his kids.

O. is in a group called Strong Trust Bank in his community. The members in the group guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loan and provide support and assistance to one another in handling repayment.

loans.use: To procure men’s wear for re-sale

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es: Felicia tiene 55 años D. vida, es viuda desD. hace 12 años y tiene 10 hijos, todo ellos ya viven fuera D. casa. En vida, su esposo no le permitía que trabajara con él en el campo, entonces se dedicaba al cuidado D. sus animales. DesD. que enviudó retomó la agricultura pero le pareció muy duro ya que no tiene ayuda para producir grandes cantidades. Entonces comenzó a sembrar en pequeñas cantidades con el apoyo D. algunos vecinos, y cuando tiene oportunidad D. viajar a la ciudad, lleva algunos sacos D. papa para comercializar en el mercado. D. esta forma pueD. generarse ingresos para su sustento diario. Felicia está satisfecha con la agricultura, ya que le permitió darles educación a sus hijos. Felicia es D. carácter sumiso, y aunque no desempeña ningún cargo en su banco comunal, es muy puntual es sus pagos. Este es su 8vo crédito con MFP, por lo que también está muy agradecida por la oportunidad y confianza brindada. El dinero que ahora está solicitando es para la compra D. fertilizantes para sus chacras D. papa.
texts.en:
Felicia is 55 years old and has been a widow for 12 years. She has 10 children, none of whom live with her. While her husband was alive, he would not let her to work with him in the field, so she took care of the animals. Since becoming a widow, she has taken up agriculture again, but it is very difficult since she doesn't have the help to produce large quantities. Therefore, she began planting small amounts with the help of some neighbors.

When she had the opportunity to travel to the city, she brought with her some sacks of potatoes to sell in the market. In this way she was able to generate income to cover her daily needs. Felicia is satisfied with agriculture, as it has allowed her to give her children educations.

Felicia has an obedient disposition, and though she isn't an officer in her community bank, she is very punctual with payments. This is her 8th loan with MFP. For this she is very grateful- and for the opportunity and confidence it has brought. The loan she is requesting this time will be used to purchase fertilizer for her potato crop.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Morey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Lutfi

texts.ru: Лутфи женщина, которая кредитуется третий год.Она всё это время без проблем погашает свои займы.За три года у неё увеличился товарооборот.Она занимается шитьём европейской одежды.следующий займ хочет потратить для закупа новых материй.Её цех расположен в центре города Худжанда, поэтому наплыв клиентов очень большой.Она благодарна KIVA за финансирование и поддержку.
texts.en:
This is Lutfi’s third year as a borrower. She has been paying back her loans during all this time without a problem. In the three years her turnover has increased. Lutfi sews European clothing and would like to use her next loan to purchase new fabrics. Her shop is located in the center of Khujand and because of this she has a large flow of customers. Lutfi is grateful to KIVA for the financing and support.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabrics

loans.name: Yamilet Del Rosario

texts.es: Yamilet del Rosario P. Rodríguez tiene la edad de 29 años, su estado civil es casada. Esta Joven tiene 2 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio. Yamilet es una joven luchadora y trabajadora y es por eso que sus motivos son de mantener su negocio activo. Yamilet ha modificado su vivienda ya que sus productos no alcanzan y no posee una bodega para guardarlos. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para comprar productos como arroz, azúcar, aceite, golosinas, jabón, detergentes y gaseosas. El deseo de Yamilet es que sus hijos puedan continuar con este negocio para y además logren finalizar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Yamilet del Rosario P. Rodríguez is 29 years old and married. She is young and has 2 school-aged children. She has had a small convenience store for more than 3 years. Yamilet is a hard-working young woman and she wants to maintain her business. Yamilet has modified her home as her products don’t last and doesn’t have a place to store them. She seeks financing for working capital to buy products such as rice, sugar, oil, candy, soap, detergent and soda pop. Yamilet hopes her children can continue with this business and also finish their schooling.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to buy items for her store

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr: Komi T. est conducteur de moto à Wome. Agé de 33 ans, il est marié et père d’un enfant. pour imiter les dépenses causées par les pannes régulières et épargner pour la survie de sa famille, Komi espère avec ce crédit acheter une nouvelle moto. il compte sur cette chance pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Komi T. is a moto driver in Wome. He is 33 years old, married, and the father of one child. To limit the costs from regular breakdowns and to save money, so that his family may survive, he hopes to use this loan to buy a new moto He’s counting on this chance to improve his family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Las Maravillas Group

texts.es: El banco Comunal “Las Maravillas” esta representado por la señora Marlene y conformado por 16 miembros en su mayoría mujeres dedicadas al comercio de productos como empanadas, comida, abarrotes en tiendas de barrio y como ayudantes en fábricas conocidas. Dentro del ámbito comercial existe mucha competencia pero las socias no se preocupan por ello debido a que confían en los productos que comercializan, pero les queda el deseo de incrementar su negocio, es por esta razón que acudieron al apoyo económico de la Fundación Agrocapital que les brinda un fondo que ayudara al crecimiento de sus pequeños negocios así como al mejoramiento de la calidad de vida de sus familias. En general las socias cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios a pesar de ser su primer ciclo con la institución pero cuentan con experiencia del manejo de fondos por entidades financieras similares y saben como responder a sus obligaciones puntualmente.
texts.en:
The community bank “Las Maravillas” is represented by Marlene and composed of 16 members, who are mostly women engaged in the selling of products such as empanadas, food, neighborhood grocery stores, and as assistants in well-known factories. Within the commercial sector, there is a lot of competition, but the members don't worry about it, owing to their confidence in the products they sell. But there remains the desire to increase their business, and for this reason they came to economic support of Fundación Agrocapital, which offers them a fund that will help the growth of their small businesses and therefore improve the quality of life of their families. In general, the members have experience in group loans; despite being their first cycle with the institution, they count on their experience managing funds for similar financial entities, and they know how to respond to their obligations on time.

Translated from Spanish by Cara Gutterman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational Capital

loans.name: Zulaiho

texts.ru: Зулайхо Хакимова 1970 года рождения ,замужем имеет 2 детей. Имеет среднее образование, На рынке торгует детской одеждой более 10 лет. Раньше сидела дома, после того как закончила школу помогала матери торговать  семечками и жвачкой. После того как вышла замуж также сидела дома. Со временем когда дети подросли , потребность также увеличивалась. Для этого вышла на рынок продавать вещи. Со временем  получила  кредит на расширение товара.  Благодаря КИВА улучшила свой ассортимент товара и благодарна за поддержку.
texts.en:
Zulaiho Khakomova was born in 1970, is married and has two children. She has secondary education. She sells children's clothing on the market for more than ten years. She used to stay at home, after she finished school she was helping her mother sell seeds and gum. After she got married she was also staying at home. With time as the children grew up their demands also increased. So she has started selling clothes on the market. With time she received a loan to increase merchandise. Thanks to Kiva she improved the assortment of her merchandise and is grateful for the support.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing for the summer season

loans.name: Raciel Baernardo

texts.es: Raciel Bernardo R. G. tiene la edad de 30 años. es un hombre muy resposable con su fmailia. su actividad economica es brindar el servicio de transporte. hace mas de 7 años que se dedica a brindar este servicio. sus inicios son porque el no encontraba trabajo. y fue por medio de su Papa que aprendio este oficio que le ayudo a salir adelante. el detino del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de repuestos del vehiculo. su mayor sueño es obtener un carro para trabajarlo como taxi.
texts.en:
Raciel Bernardo R. G. is 30 years old. He is very responsible when it comes to his family. He has been working in transportation for more than seven years. He started this business because he couldn't find another job, so his father taught him to be a driver, a job that has helped him get ahead in life. He plans to use this loan to buy replacement vehicle parts. His greatest dream is to buy a car that he can use as a taxi.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy replacement vehicle parts

loans.name: Кундуз

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan

Кундузой- женщина, которая занимается откормом и продажей скота. Ей 44 года, замужем имеет троих детей. Муж на заработках в Алма-ате. Кундузой вместе с сыном  имеет хороший доход с этого бизнеса. Прибыль Кундузой тратит на расходы семьи, а деньги , которые присылает её муж она использует на строительство своего дома. Кундузой на полученный хочет закупить несколько молоденьких барашков и корм для них.

loans.use: откорм и продажа скота

loans.name: El Bebe Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes del grupo El Bebe son Graciela María F. M., Daysi Arelys L. B., Astelia Nonhemi M. y Paubla de la Concepcion F. M.; Mujeres provenientes de La Comarca Campuzano, ubicada en la Ciudad de Nindiri.
Doña Graciela F. M. de 38 años de edad, es la coordinadora del grupo El Bebe, una mujer emprendedora que inicio su negocio a raíz de que su suegro le dio la idea de que pusiera una pulpería en su casa. Lo que la motivo para salirse de su trabajo en la Zona Franca de Tipitapa donde ganaba muy poco e inicio la venta de granos básicos en su hogar. Doña Graciela afirma que le va muy bien, y pretende invertir su dinero en la compra de cosméticos y ropa para ampliar su pulpería.

Éste es su segundo Ciclo de Crédito y a pesar de que ha enfrentado situaciones difíciles como un robo que le hicieron a su negocio, afirma que nunca ha quedado mal y va a sobrepasar todo con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo.

Las otras miembras del grupo Doña Astelia M. tiene 35 años de edad y vende comidas por las noches (Las famosas Fritangas Nicaragüenses), Doña Daysi L. de 21 años de edad quien elabora diferentes productos a base de maíz (Tamales, Tortillas, Yoltamal) y los vende ambulantemente y Doña Paubla F. de 49 años de edad quien distribuye cosméticos y vende joyería de plata en su zona.

loans.use: Compra de Otros articulos para ampliar el negocio

loans.name: Evelyn Ester

texts.es: Evelyn Ester D. L. D. T. resiD. en la capital D. El Salvador. Evelyn tiene 48 años D. edad , se dedica D. tiempo completo a su negocio donD. venD. variedad D. comida rápida y tortillas, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en el mercado Dueñas en Santa Tecla; su clientela es muy estable,  ya que todas las personas que trabajan en el mercado compran D. la comida D. Evelyn,  por ser reconocida como una persona con mucha higiene en la elaboración D. sus platillos; el crédito que solicita Evelyn es para compra D. materia prima que le permita aumentar su producción en comida que a veces no es suficiente para la demanda D. sus clientes.
texts.en:
Evelyn Ester D. L. D. T. is 48 years old and lives in San Salvador. She is dedicated full-time to her business of selling tortillas and fast food, which is located in the Dueñas Market in Santa Tecla. She has a stable customer base, since all the people who work in the market buy their food from Evelyn. She is known as someone who practices good sanitation when preparing her dishes.

The loan Evelyn is requesting will be used to buy ingredients so that she can increase her food production because sometimes she is not able to meet the demand of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: La Señora Critina se dedica a la elaboracion de pan en el horno que pertenece a la suegra. El esposo tambien ayuda en el trabajo,realizando la distribucion del pan a los distintos clientes, actividad con la que estan saliendo a flote gracias a nuestro financiamiento logrando mayor productividad y nuevos mercados.  Con esta actividad mantiene a la familia de seis integrantes, dos de ellos pequeños que estudian.
texts.en:
Mrs. Cristina is dedicated to the bakery business; she makes bread in her mother’s in law oven. Her husband helps her with the distribution of the bread to different customers.

They have grown their business, increased their production and reached new markets, thanks to financial help that they are getting. This business helps them to support their family of six members, two of whom are small children and go to school.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Binda

texts.en:
Binda S. is currently in the business of selling tea and bread at the restaurant and is requesting a loan to open up a shop. Binda is 28 years old and is single. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy land, build and rent it out.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open a shop

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en:
Genelyn R. is from the village of Don Jose Aguirre. She is 22 years old. Genelyn is married. To make a living, Genelyn raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Genelyn has been engaged in her business for over two years with approximate average monthly earnings of 4,000 Philippine pesos for these activities.

In 2009, Genelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Genelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to pay for services in cultivating the farm to increase crop yield. Genelyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the second loan taken out by Genelyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Osvaldo Luis

texts.pt:
Osvaldo Luís Gonhele nasceu na cidade da Matola, província de Maputo, tem 26 anos de idade, solteiro e não tem nenhum filho, estudou ate 12ªclasse e estando neste momento a preparar-se para concorrer a admissão no ensino superior. Vive na casa própria e sustenta dois irmãos mais novos que vivem com ele.

Nunca mudou da cidade, sempre viveu na cidade da Matola. É comerciante permanente a 06 anos, faz dez horas diárias e não tem nenhum empregado. Aprendeu a fazer o negócio em Boane com amigos há sete anos. Os seus melhores produtos são a cerveja, refrescos e vinhos, os preços dos mesmos variam consoante a qualidade. O rendimento varia de 8.000,00mt a 10.000,00mt com o qual sustenta a família e poupa algum.

Nunca trabalhou com nenhuma outra instituição de crédito e este é o seu segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku, o primeiro empréstimo foi de 13.000,00mt também destinado para o negócio. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigos que também são clientes da instituição.
Com o presente empréstimo de 20.000,00mt para compra e venda de refrigerantes e outros produtos com o objectivo de investir no negocio, satisfazer a demanda de produtos, neste período de Inverno e aumentar o rendimento.

Pretende continuar a pedir empréstimos na Hluvuku para melhorar a sua residência, por isso compromete-se pagar bem este empréstimo.
texts.en:
Osvaldo Luís Gonhele was born Matola, in the province of Maputo, Mozambique. He is 26 years old, single and has no children. He finished 12th grade and is getting to go to college. He lives in his own house and supports two younger brothers that live with him. He owns his business and has been working 10 hours a day for the past 6 years, with no other employees. His best selling products are beer, refreshments and wines. He makes between $280 and $350 per month, money that he uses to support himself and his brothers, and save. He is asking for $700 in order to invest in his business, and satisfy his customer's demands for new items now that the winter is coming up, improving his profit. He is committed to pay it back on time and in the future hopes to get another loan to make improvements to his house.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beverages for selling (soft drinks, beer and wine)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: renovating her business place

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase an additional stock of drinks in bulk

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en: Margarita is  61, married and is from Agusan Del Sur. She has ten children;  her oldest, who is 35, no longer lives with them. Margarita is involved in rice farming, which supplies her income to feed, clothe and sustain her family. Currently, she is short of capital for her business. She applied to CEVI and asked for a loan of Php 7000. She will use this loan to finance her farm and hopefully get a better income from the next harvest.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Kiwanga Twegatte Group, Mukono

texts.en: B. Agnes is the leader of her lending group in Mukono. She is a single mother of three children. Two of her children are in school and the other is a baby. She also takes care of one dependant. Agnes has had a salon in Kiwanga for five years doing both women and men’s hairstyles. Ever since she started using loans in her business, Agnes has been able to grow her business. She makes more profit compared to the time before the loans. She needs a loan to be able to restock her salon with more hair oils, weaves, hairpieces and chemicals so that she can treat her customers to their satisfaction.

loans.use: To restock her salon.

loans.name: Chanthol

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthol O., 43, and her husband, Mr. Chansithy Thorn, 46, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1990 and have four children: three sons and one daughter.

Chanthol has been a silk weaver for 30 years, a skill she learned from her mother, while her husband has been a motor taxi driver for eight years. She wants to supplement their income by starting a pig-raising business and is therefore requesting her first loan of $600 to purchase piglets and pig food.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig food

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora B. is 33 years old, married and has four school-age children. They are from the village of Seti, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. To make a living, Flora raises pigs for sale. Flora has been in her business for over three years and earns approximately 1,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2008, Flora joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Flora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC which was used to purchase feed for the pigs. Flora is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her business. This will be her fourth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase feed for the pigs

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Chantal is 35 years old, married with 5 children who are aged between 3 and 12 years old.  Chantal and her family live in Rwamagana, a region of Kibungo situated in the eastern province of Rwanda.  Chantal has been in the business of sewing various styles of clothes (for children, men and women).  Chantal starts her work from 8 AM and continues until late in the evening hours.

After 17 years in this profession, Chantal needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company so that she can purchase some additional sewing machines and clothing items.  With these additional sewing machines, Chantal will create more jobs for the people from her community and in addition, her profits will increase improving the standard of living  for her family.  Through her business expansion, Chantal will also be able to save for the future education of her children.

loans.use: Additional sewing machines and some sewing items

loans.name: Ligia Mercedes

texts.es:
La  Señora Ligia Mercedes Solís Larga espada, Labora como Inspectora en turno Sabatino y Dominical en el Instituto Manuel Olivares Rodríguez de  Managua, ella tiene un   hijo a su cargo,  y este  se encuentra en edad escolar, es madre soltera, ha trabajado tres créditos con CEPRODEL durante tres años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido tres créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.  

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como, arena, cemento, hierro y bloques  para la construcción de un anexo en su casa de habitación.
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
Ligia dijo que los préstamos otorgados han sido para el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ligia Mercedes Solís L. works as an inspector on the weekend shift at the Manuel Olivares Rodríguez Institute of Managua. She has a school-age son in her care and is a single mother. She has had three loans with CEPRODEL over three years and over this period of time she has used the three loans for the improvement of the house in which she lives, thanks to the financing given by CEPRODEL. The requested loan is to be used for the purchase of building materials such as sand, cement, iron and blocks to build an annex in her home. This is all for the aim of providing them greater security and a better quality of life for her children. Ligia said that the loans provided have been for the improvement of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: HOME IMPROVEMENT AND EXTENSION

loans.name: Minerva's Group

texts.en:
Minerva D. is from the village of San Pedro, Alicia, Isabela. She is 50 years old. Minerva is the group leader of a 17-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Minerva is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Minerva owns & operates a business venture making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling candies, such as 'macapuno' and 'ube', to the local community. Minerva has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Minerva joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Minerva is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Minerva from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Sok Heng

texts.en:
Mr. Sok Heng P. and his wife are farmers who own 0.5 hectares (1.25 acres) of land on which they cultivate rice to support their family. In their rice field, they have some problems because their field has infertile soil and it is far from the irrigation system. Thus, in order to improve their production of rice, he decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and fuel for his water pump.

Mr. Sok Heng P. is the father of five children, one of whom is a laborer, while the others are attending the local public school. They all live in Kor village in Kandal province.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and fuel

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita V. is from the village of Sta. Ana Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 57 years old. Rosita is married and has 2 school-aged children. Rosita owns & operates a business selling seafood such as fish in the local community. Rosita has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Rosita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rosita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. Rosita is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Rosita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 46-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and one child. He has been working as a car electrician for over 25 years. In 2009, he opened his own shop. His main customers are local community members. He says that the unique location of his business has allowed him to remain competitive and successful. He says that effective promotion and securing capital are two major challenges to his work. In the future, he would like to expand his business to include auto repair for new cars.

He is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua. He plans to purchase new electric tools for his work. He believes the loan will add to his business so he can better support his family. This will be his first loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To purchase new electric tools for his work.

loans.name: Ireneo

texts.en:
Ireneo S. is from the town of Banga. He is 32 years old. Ireneo is married and has a 4-year-old child. To make a living, Ireneo owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Ireneo has been engaged in his business for over 9 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

Ireneo joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ireneo is requesting a loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. This will be the first loan taken out by Ireneo from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 26 years old. He is married with 5 children between the ages of 3 and 10, all of whom are attending school.  He is a dairy farmer from Litein, in Rift Valley, Kenya. He has been farming for 4 years and has employed one person from the community. His products are milk, which he sells to the tea estate, and tea, which he sells to the Kenya Tea Development Authority. Before venturing into farming Richard was operating a hotel business.  His biggest challenges in farming are lack of animal feed, the high cost of artificial insemination services, which are not readily available, and a lack of knowledge about dairy farming.

Richard has requested this loan of KES 45,000 from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The income from this loan will help him to repay the loan and to pay his children’s school fees. In the future, he would like to upgrade his dairy animals to high yielding cows, and build a dairy unit.  He will also request more loans from Juhudi Kilimo.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Sandra Rafael

texts.pt:
Sandra Rafael M., nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha Província de Maputo Sul de Moçambique, vive maritalmente é mãe de uma filha de 21 anos que vai a escola.fez a 9ªclasse, parou com os estudos quando foi ao lar. Vive na casa própria com a sua neta e sustenta dois enteados que vivem com ela.

Sandra quando junta se com seu marido, aranja um emprego no Centro de Saúde de Namaacha como Servente onde trabalha das 7:30h sa 15:30h auferindo mensalmente 2.200.00mt que aplica nas dispesas da casa. Mas devido ao facto do seu entiado ser o herdeiro da casa onde se encontram, ela legaliza um terreno em nome da   filha e pede empréstimo a Hluvuku e Kiva para dar inicio da construção de uma moradia que sera construida pelo marido que é pedreiro.



Este é o primeiro empréstimo de Sandra na Hluvuku e Kiva no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção ( pedras locais, cimento, areia) e dar inicio da construção de uma casa para a filha. Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo pois conta com ajuda do seu marido que é pedreiro. Tem maior sonho de se casar oficialmente e ter uma vida condigna.
texts.en:
Sandra Rafael was born in the district of Namaacha in the province of Maputo, South of Mozambique. She is in a common law marriage and is the mother of a 21 year old daughter who goes to school. She studied through 9th grade and stopped when she moved in with her husband. She lives in her own home with her granddaughter and supports two stepchildren who live with her. When she moved in with her husband she found a job a the Namaacha Health Center as a janitor where she works from 7:30am to 3:30pm and makes 2,200 meticais per month which goes to house expenses. Due to the fact that her stepson will inherit the house they live in, she is registering a lot of land in her daughter's name. She is requesting Hluvuku and Kiva for a loan to start building a house there. Her husband, who is a bricklayer, will build the house. This is Sandra's first loan with Hluvuku and Kiva and it is for 10,000 meticais. She intends to use it purchase construction materials (local stone, cement, sand) and start building a house for her daughter. She is confident she will pay back the loan ahead of time since she will have help from her husband who is a bricklayer. Her biggest dream is to be legally married and to have a suitable life.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (local stones, cement, sand)

loans.name: Mayra Azucena

texts.es: Mayra tiene 2 hijos de diferentes edades pero ella se encarga de mantenerlo y proporcionarle el alimento diario. Por lo que no es la primera experiencia que ha obtenido con los financiamientos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, hace mas de 3 años que tiene este negocio, actividad que realiza desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche todos los días, pues siempre está pendiente de los que sus clientes le solicitan y esta es la oportunidad que tiene para buscar nuevos productos. Por lo que  solicita un préstamo para la compra de pantalones, vestidos, trajes formales ya que en estos paquetes viene una gran variedad.
texts.en:
Mayra has two children of different ages that she is in charge of supporting and feeding. This is not, therefore, the first time she’s gotten financing. She sells used clothing. She has been in this line of work for over 3 years. She works from 7am until 8pm every day and is always attentive to her customers’ needs. This is her opportunity to seek out new products. She is asking for funding to buy pants, dresses and formal wear since the bundles have a great variety of items.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy assorted clothing.

loans.name: Mellany's Group

texts.en:
Mellany D. C. is from the town of Dumabato Norte, MadD., Quirino. She is 33 years old. Mellany is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Mellany is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Mellany owns & operates a business selling frozen foods. Mellany has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Mellany joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mellany has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Mellany is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Mellany from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Chen

texts.en: Chen S., 30, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. She is employed at a local garment factory for an income of $3 US per day. Her husband is an electrician, earning an income of $4 per day.  S. is requesting a loan of $1,200 to help build her brother’s house. In the future, she would like to send her children to good schools.  This is her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: help build her brother's house

loans.name: Kuljamal

texts.en:
Kuljamal Z. lives in Kok-Tokoy village in the northern region of Kyrgyzstan.  She is 42 years old, married, and has three children. After graduating from medical college in the capital city, she worked in the local hospital.  Her open-hearted personality and attentive attitude to patients helped her to acquire an excellent reputation as a medic.  As salaries in rural areas are low,  people need to find an additional means to lift themselves from the poverty level. For this reason, Kuljamal and her family started their own business in cattle breeding. At present, the farm has 13 sheep and one milch cow.  Kuljamal is also engaged in cultivating apples, pears, raspberries, and currants, all of which were planted 15 years ago.  Today her family works hard to get a good harvest.  These activities allowed Kuljamal to improve her household, but she still needs a loan of 60,000 KGS to buy 10 sheep and one colt. Revenues from this loan will allow Kuljamal to send her children to the capital city of Bishkek in order to get a good education.  

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas leading to increased employment and meeting the needs of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Ath's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of five people who live in Preaek Hour Kaeut village, Kandal province. Ath K. is a 52 year old married woman and was selected as the leader of a group loan. The members of this group will use their portion of the loan to support their different purposes. 

Ath K. and her husband, Mr. Y Vet, 54 years old, are farmers who own a plot of land that they use to cultivate vegetable for a living. In order to support this farm, Ath K. will use the loan to buy fertilizer to cultivate vegetables. Aside from being farmers, they are also fishermen who are able to earn a small income to support their family. This couple is works very hard to support their three children. The children are students who also help their parents businesses.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to cultivate vegetables.

loans.name: Izro

texts.en:
42-year old Izro D. is hoping to achieve success in his own business. He has been a farmer for more than 18 years and would like to improve the size of his harvest so that he can support his family's needs.

He grows rice and the income from this endeavor has helped his family in terms of buying food, clothes, and other basic necessities. It also allows him to maintain his farm and send his children to school. 

He applied for a loan of Php 10,000, which he will use in buying seed, fertilizer, and other farm necessities. He chose CEVI because of its very good program. He likes it a lot because it helped his business grow when it was small and it provies good insurance coverage for him and his fellow borrowers.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar vive en la casa de sus padres cuyo domicilio esta ubicado en la comunidad chahuira chico “Achacachi”. Es productor lechero, su producto lo vende a Pil Andina (planta Industrializadora de leche), también trabaja como albañil es su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutención. Edgar tiene 4 hijos.  
 
El préstamo lo destinara para la compra de un ganado lechero. Esto le servirá para aumentar su producción de leche.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro.
texts.en:
Edgar lives in his parents' house, which is located in the small Chahuira community "Achacachi." He is a dairy farmer and sells milk to Pil Andina (an industrial milk plant). He also works as a builder, which is his main source of income to support himself. Edgar has 4 children.

Edgar will use this loan to purchase a milk cow so that he can increase his milk production. 

This is his first loan with Impro.

loans.use: Purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Leh We Help Weself Group

texts.en:
Meet members of the “Leh We Help Weself” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL 800,000 for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Augusta B. S. is the leader of this group. The thirty-year-old is married to a teacher and they have two children. Augusta has been a businesswoman for fifteen years now. She sells bags, shoes, clothes, cloth, body sprays, creams, etc. Augusta will use her share of this loan to buy the above-mentioned items in large quantity to add to her business inventory.

loans.use: Buy bags, shoes, clothes, cloth, body sprays, creams, etc.

loans.name: Clara Maribel

texts.es:
Clara se dedica a la venta de merienda y tortillas, ella es viuda y vive con su madre y sus dos hijos, reside en Usulután, este negocio nació hace 3 años cuando su esposo falleció, ya que ella seria desde ese momento la responsable del hogar y debía buscar una fuente de ingreso para poder darle la alimentación y el cuido necesario a sus hijos. 
Ella solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en los productos para preparar las meriendas, como los ingrediente para cada tipo de comida por ejemplo pollo, carnes rojas, condimentos, arroz, aceite, también maíz para las tortillas, este préstamo le será de mucha ayuda ya que ella solo cuenta con la buena voluntad de progresar con el negocio pero no tiene el dinero que se necesita para impulsarlo.
Su objetivo es estar siempre atenta a sus hijos, contar con una fuente de ingreso estable para poder alimentarlos y cubrir todas las necesidades que demanda un hogar.
texts.en:
Clara sells meals and tortillas.  She’s a widow living with her mother and two children in Usulután.  She started the business three years ago when her husband died because at that moment she became responsible for the home and had to find a source of income to feed and provide necessary care for her children.

She is asking for funds to buy ingredients to prepare each kind of meal like: chicken, red meats, spices, rice, cooking oil and corn for the tortillas.  The loan will be of great use for her since she has the will to progress with her business but lacks money to propel it.

Her goal is to always be watchful of her children and to have a stable source of income to be able to feed them and cover all the needs her home demands.

loans.use: To buy chicken, meats, spices, rice, cooking oil, corn.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman with one child who is still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a food-selling business for the past three years, selling from her home to neighbors and passers-by. Price fluctuation is the major challenge Mwanasiti faces in her business. She hopes to open a big restaurant in the future.

With the 20,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase sacks of rice, maize flour, and potatoes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase rice, maize flour, and potatoes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of peanuts

loans.name: Solidario Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
SOLIDARIO VIRGEN D. FATIMA

La señora Claudia Velásquez  necesita D. nuevo su crédito para la elaboración D. D. dulces típicos, que ahora entrega en diferentes  clientes,  sus ventas aumentan en  enero por la  feria patronal donD. tiene una gran cantidad D. visitas. La señora Ana Paulina  necesita su préstamo para la compra D. maíz Y productos comestibles para elavorar tamales ya que en este mes tiene más pedidos  por las fiestas D. fin D. año. La señora Berta Mariana C. necesita su crédito para  la venta D. productos plasticos,  y también la venta D.  comales  que tiene ubicada en el mercado Local D. otro municipio. Las tres miembros del grupo coinciden en que esta es una buena fecha para poder invertir y aprovechar antes D. que inicie el ciclo escolar en enero, ya que D. esta manera ellas se aseguran D. tener lo necesario para que los niños vayan a la escuela.
texts.en:
SOLIDARIO VIRGEN D. FATIMA

Claudia Velásquez needs credit again to prepare typical Guatemalan sweets that she delivers to various customers.  Her sales increase in January when there are many visitors to celebrate the feast day of the patron saint.  Ana Paulina needs her loan to buy corn and ingredients to make tamales since this month she has more orders for New Year’s Eve parties.  Berta Mariana C. needs her loan for plastic products and “comales” (flat earthenware pans for cooking corn cakes) that she sells in the local market of another town.  The three members of the group agree that since schools starts in January, this is a good time to take advantage of the opportunity to invest.  In this way, they will make sure that they have what they need for their children to go to school.

loans.use: Ingredients to make tamales and typical Guatemalan sweets and for the sale of plastic products.

loans.name: Anis' Group

texts.en:
Anis is a talented lady. She sews clothes as a business at her home to share the financial burden of her family. She sews clothes for her neighboring clients and earns well by completing them on time. In addition to her business, she is also a very good housewife and does her household responsibilities very well. 

She has given birth to two sons. Her elder son lives abroad, while her younger son is married and works in a government organization for a monthly wage. After his day job, he operates a spare-parts shop through which he offers spare parts for different vehicles to his clients. 

Anis has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to financially support her younger son, who wants to improve his business by purchasing spare parts. The additional spare parts will help him to sell to those clients who have sought parts that he couldn’t provide for them due to non-availability, with the result that he will make them his permanent customers and increase his income as well.
 
Anis is hopeful that through the loan investment, her son will be able to get more profits from his business and will improve its financial condition. She is regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meetings.
 
She belongs to Okara, which is a small city of Pakistan known for its agricultural industry. She lives there in the area of Kirpa ram with her family in a two-room brick house.  

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book called the Asasah Passbook is Anis.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith S. is from the city of Pantaon, Ozamiz City. She is 31 years old. Judith is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a motor transport service. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $75 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Judith joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC.
