Judith is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This will be her 3rd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith A. is from the village of Sta. Ines, Talisayan, Misamis Oriental. She is 53 years old. Judith is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Judith owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling sausage and hot dog kebabs in the local community. Judith has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Judith joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Judith has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Judith is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Judith from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Bethzaida Anabell

texts.es: La Sra. Bethzaida Anabell S. E. ella es trabajadora activa de una Entidad estatal desempeñándose como Conserje  tiene cuatro años  de trabajar para esta institución es Casada actualmente, tiene tres hijos en edad escolar. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como Arena, Cemento, Piedra, Piedrín, Bloques etc. Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en: Bethzaida Anabell S. E. currently works as a custodian for a government organization and has done so for four years. She is married and has three school-aged children. She has had two loans with CEPRODEL and each one has been used for the purchase of construction materials such as sand, cement, stone, gravel, etc., to improve and enlarge the house where she lives. The loans with CEPRODEL have been of great help to her since through them she has improved her living conditions and those of her family.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials - sand, cement, stone, blocks, etc.

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es: Sandra Elizabeth M. D. A. una mujer D. 45 años D. edad vive con sus dos hijos pequeños en casa D. sus suegros. Ella posee una panaderia ubicada en la colonia San Patricio en San Salvador y que ha logrado mantener gracias al apoyo económico D. su esposo; pero hace seis meses su compañero D. vida quedo sin trabajo y Sandra a tenido que sacar adelante sola el negocio, es por eso que le solicita credito a INTEGRAL, con el cual tiene pensado comprar material para su panaderia tales como harina, agua, azucar, leche, grasas y otros como el gas propano y bandejas para el pan que le permita ampliar su produccion. Con esto Sandra espera poder ofrecerle a sus clientes un pan con excelente calidad, y a un buen precio asi podra mantener sus clientes; los cuales la prefieren por dar ese sabor especial a sus panes y por la higiene que mantiene en el lugar D. trabajo. Ella tiene grandes espectativas a futuro con su negocio pues como toda mujer emprendedora quiere mejorar su calidad D. vida y la D. su familia.
texts.en: Sandra Elizabeth M. D. A. is 45 years old and lives with her two young children in her in-laws' home.  Sandra owns a bakery which is located in San Patricio neighborhood, in San Salvador.  She has managed to keep it running thanks to the financial support of her husband.  However, six months ago her life partner lost his job and Sandra has had to keep her business running on her own.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that she plans to use to buy supplies for her bakery such as flour, water, sugar, milk, fats and other products such as propane gas and bread trays which will allow her to expand her production.  In this way, Sandra hopes to be able to offer top-quality bread at a good price so that she can keep her customers who prefer her bakery for the special flavor of her bread and the hygiene that she observes in her work place.  Sandra has a lot of hope for the future of her business because, like every enterprising woman, she would like to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour, water, sugar, milk, fats, propane gas and bread trays

loans.name: Gloria Lucía

texts.es:
Aportar en el hogar para cubrir los gastos de la familia, fue el propósito de Gloria Lucía T. A. para iniciar a confeccionar en un espacio de su casa, pues lo que su esposo gana no les alcanzaba para solventar las necesidades de su familia conformada por 6 hijos. 

Su deseo es ampliar su negocio para incrementar sus ingresos y poder garantizarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, necesita de un préstamo para comprar algunas telas e insumos.
texts.en:
Gloria Lucía T. A. began sewing in her home in order to help support her family, because what her husband earns is not enough for their necessities. Their family includes six children.

Her desire is to expand her business to increase earnings and guarantee her family a greater quality of life. She needs a loan to buy fabric and supplies.

loans.use: To buy fabric and supplies

loans.name: Naranchimeg

texts.en:
Naranchimeg is 45 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a house in Songinohairhan district, Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her older son, age 20, goes to a college and younger daughter, age 15, attends a local secondary school.

She operates a traditional clothing making business with the help of her husband in Ulaabaatar city. She started her business in 1998. She is responsible for making traditional clothing called Deel, and her husband is responsible for selling them at a rented stall at a trading center. Her business is quite profitable, which allowed her to buy a car last year. Now, her monthly net profit is 650,000 MNT, with a daily earning of 80,000 MNT. She makes two pairs of Deel per day at a cost of 40,000 MNT and sells them for 80,000 MNT. She has gained a lot of experience and is planning to expand her business in the future. She is an honest woman who says, “I make traditional clothes that satisfy my customer's need." She is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT of loan to purchase materials for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sewing materials

loans.name: Johnes

texts.en:
Johnes W. is a married man but has no children yet. His business is located at the busy Kongowea market in Mombasa. Mombasa is in the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many tourist attractions not forgetting the Indian Ocean's white beaches. He sells fruits and vegetables to the local people. 

Johnes has been in this business for two years now. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is that there are so many people doing the same kind of business as his in the area and so customers are not loyal as they are spoilt for choice. However he works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep his business doing well. 

He is using his loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more kale, onions, tomatoes and other fruits and vegetables to grow his business and meet the demand of his customers. He hopes to grow the business and become the supplier of groceries in Mombasa. In future, he sees himself owning a farm from which he will be growing and selling vegetables. He describes himself as ambitious.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables.

loans.name: Roger

texts.es: El señor Roger trabaja como secretario con un abogado. El crédito lo requiere para el costo de ingreso a la universidad.  Con esta actividad solventa los gastos que tiene. Vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz;  es soltero y no tiene hijos. Esta es la segunda vez que su crédito se canaliza a través de Kiva.
texts.en: Roger is secretary to a lawyer. The loan he is requesting will be used to pay for university registration fees. Thanks to his job he is able to pay for his expenses. He lives in his parents' house in Tambladerani, a neighborhood of the town of La Paz; he is single and has no children. This is the second time his has requested a loan through Kiva.

loans.use: To pay for univertisy registration fees.

loans.name: Aurora Helena

texts.es: Aurora es una madre de familia de 40 años, su actividad es una  pulpería ésta actividad la realiza desde hace un poco más de 2 años. Ella ofrece productos para el hogar, de limpieza, golosinas granos básicos y con estos ingresos que obtiene se ayuda para sacar adelante a sus hijos. A solicitado un crédito para comprar granos básicos, sopas, enlatados, detergentes, galletas y mercadería como ropa para diferentes edades, ya que en su barrio las personas que le compran le han comentado que sería bueno que también venda otras cosas. Aurora es una persona muy conocida por ser una mujer trabajadora, alegre, responsable y una buena madre al querer brindarles un mejor futuro para los sus hijos.
texts.en:
Aurora is a 40 year old mother who runs a small grocery store. She has been doing this for a little more than 2 years. She offers domestic goods, cleaning products, snacks, and basic food items. With the money that she earns she helps her children to get ahead.

She has asked for a loan to buy basic grains, soups, canned goods, detergents, cookies and other merchandise like clothing for different ages, because the customers in her neighborhood have commented that it would be good if she also sold other things

Aurora is well-known for being a hard-working, happy and responsible woman and a good mother who wants to give her children a better future.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, soups, canned goods, detergents, cookies and merchandise like clothing.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is 41 years old and married with three children.

Miriam works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying & selling jewelry in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of jewelry.

Miriam has borrowed and paid back six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her jewelry business for three years and earns additional income from selling ready to wear clothes.

Miriam aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional jewelry to sell

loans.name: Nzembi

texts.en:
Nzembi is a married woman with five children, three of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past year, Nzembi has operated a business selling cows at the market to her neighbors and passersby. Her major business challenge is seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

Nzembi decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With a loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), she plans to purchase a cow for sale.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for sale.

loans.name: Maria Consuelo

texts.es:
La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal “Las Natividades” de la Asociación Arariwa.

La socia nació en la ciudad de Quillabamba de la provincia de la Convención del departamento del Cusco (Perú) y tiene 29 años de edad, ella está casada y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos.

Actualmente, la socia vive en la ciudad de donde nació y donde desarrolla sus actividades comerciales. Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de maíz y también se dedica a la crianza de animales como por ejemplo chancho, cuy y ganado. Ella tiene una pequeña picantería en su domicilio donde vende chicha de jora. Ya son cuatro años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su negocio. En esta oportunidad la socia requiere el préstamo para comprar carne de chancho para preparar chicharon pues se están acercando las festividades de la Virgen del Carmen.
texts.en:
The member is a responsible, hard working person.  Because of these qualities her fellow members invited her to participate in Asociación Arariwa’s “ Las Natividades” (Nativities) communal bank.

She was born in the city of Quillabamba in La Convención Province, Cusco Department (Perú).  She is 29 years old, married and has two children.

Currently, she still lives in the city of her birth and where she carries out her commercial activities. She is a corn merchant but also raises animals like pigs, guinea pigs and cattle.  She has a small snack bar at home where she sells chicha de jora (drink based on corn). She’s been in business for four years now and does very well thanks to the effort she puts into it. 

On this occasion she needs the loan to buy pork to prepare fried pork because the feast days of Our Lady of Mt. Carmel are approaching.

loans.use: to buy pork.

loans.name: And Soukali Jeeguene Pire6 Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de 5 membres qui habitent dans le village de Pire à cent km de DAKAR la capitale du Sénégal, leur activité principale est le commerce de produits agricoles  les tubercules de manioc. Elles sont expérimentées dans le domaine et disposent  d’une bonne  clientèle. Leur journée commence à 8 heures du matin et se  termine vers 20heures du soir. Avec ce financement elles comptent  acheter 100 sacs de manioc qu’elles vont revendre  au marché. Les revenus tirés de la vente du manioc leur permettra de renforcer leur commerce mais aussi de satisfaire les besoins de leurs enfants (paiement des frais de scolarité les frais médicaux et participer a l’entretien de la maison).
texts.en: This group is composed of 5 members who live in the village of Pire, 100 kilometers from DAKAR, the capital of Senegal.  Their main business is selling agricultural products, such as manioc tubers.  They are experienced in this field and have a strong client base.  Their days begin at 8 a.m. and end around 8 p.m.  With this funding, they plan to buy 100 bags of manioc that they will resell at the market.   The income earned from the sale of manioc will enable them to expand their business and to take care of their children’s needs (payment of school fees and medical expenses and helping with home maintenance).

loans.use: To buy manioc, ground nuts and millet

loans.name: Zenovia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SANTO DOMINGO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco,  y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Zenovia; ella tiene 52 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. restaurant, ella venD. desayunos, almuerzos y cenas, ella prepara platos como estofado D. pollo, rocoto relleno, lomo saltado entre otros platos, la socia trabaja desD. las 4:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m, por medio D. este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar la atención D. negocio D. restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, aceite, pollos, carnes y verduras.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the "Santo Domingo" communal bank, which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

This borrower is Ms. Zenovia. She is 52 years old, married and has three children. She divides her time between her daily activities and running her restaurant business. She sells breakfast, lunch and dinner. She prepares foods like chicken stew, stuffed peppers, beef stir-fry and other dishes. Zenovia works from 4:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m. This business has been the means by which she has helped her children to get ahead. She would like to expand and improve the service at her restaurant. She is requesting this loan to buy ingredients for cooking such as rice, oil, chicken, meat and vegetables.

Zenovia is happy to receive this loan and promises to comply with her repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for cooking such as rice, oil, chicken, meat and vegetables

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.ru:
Наталия замужем. Они с мужем живут в небольшом городке под названием Виноградово в Западной Украине. Наталия занимается продажей косметики. Ее торговая точка находится в самом центре городка, конкуренция практически отсутствует. Наталия занимается этим видом торговли уже около 6 лет. На данный момент у нее в товаре находится около 45 000 гривен, а доход составляет 6 000 гривен. 

КИВА кредит в размере 10 000 гривен Наталия планирует использовать для того, чтобы закупить новые парфюмерные изделия для продажи в своем магазинчике. Она хотела бы приобрести более новые и дорогие духи и туалетную воду по оптовой цене, чтобы разнообразить предлагаемый ею ассортимент товара. Цель Наталии – расширить торговлю и продолжать развивать свое дело. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en:
Nataliya is married. She and her husband live in a small town called Vinogradovo in western Ukraine. Nataliya sells cosmetics. Her shop is located in the heart of the city, with virtually no competition. Nataliya has been in business around 6 years. At this time, she has 45,000 hryvnia in inventory, with an income of 6,000 hryvnia. 

Nataliya is requesting a Kiva loan of 10,000 hryvnia in order to purchase new perfumes for her shop. She would like to purchase new and more expensive perfumes and eau de toilette at wholesale cost in order to diversify the range of products she offers. Nataliya's goal is to expand her inventory and further expand her business.

loans.use: purchase new perfumes to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Iemaima

texts.en:
Iemaima, a 36-year-old married mother of two children, owns and operates a business venture selling baked goods in the local community. With two years of experience in this business, she is requesting a loan of WST $1500 to purchase sacks of flour and sugar, baking powder, and flavouring. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 190 talas or US $79 per week) to make improvements to her house.

In 2009, Iemaima joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Iemaima's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of flour and sugar, baking powder, and flavouring.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is married, with 6 children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Cynthia is 51 years old and has 2 children who are in school.

Cynthia has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. Cynthia requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more items like bedsheets, pants and blouses to sell to customers.  Cynthia has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Cynthia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like bedsheets, pants and blouses to sell to customers

loans.name: Lkhagvasuren

texts.en:
Mr. Lkhagvasuren, 56, is a taxi driver. He lives with his wife in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been doing this business since he bought his car in 2007. His daily earnings are quite less than his necessities. 

Recently, he has started the building of his new house in the outer part of Ulaanbaatar city. He has a plan to install a low-pressure chimney in his new home. It will use smokeless fuel and will be less harmful to environment. He absolutely cares about the environment's welfare. Due to this, Lkhagvasuren is requesting a loan to cover the payment for the new low-pressure chimney that uses smokeless fuel at his home.

loans.use: To cover the payment for the new low-pressure chimney that uses smokeless fuel in his home.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda, a 38-year-old married mother of two children, lives in the Philippines where she has had a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages for the past five years.  A new member of HSPFI, Rosalinda has requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for her store.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en: Benson is a focused businessman aged 34 and he is single. For the last two years, he has been operating a motorbike transport business to make a living. His potential customers are passersby.  In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy motorbike spare parts. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to manage his business with the previous loan.

loans.use: buy motorbike spare parts

loans.name: Subhiah

texts.en:
Subhiah is a 53-year-old divorced woman who started a small business a year ago to be able to support herself.

Subhiah’s business started by renting party and wedding dresses to the ladies and expanded to include doing make-up for the brides at her home.  Now she has applied for this loan to buy beauty salon basic tools and a skin cleaner machine.

loans.use: to buy beauty salon basic tools and a skin cleaner machine.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy is 17 years old and lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala North region of Uganda. Teddy has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells fish at the local market. 

To help expand her business, Teddy has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more fish for resale, and will help Teddy to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself. Teddy hopes that in the future she will be able to become a doctor. 

Teddy is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Teddy's future prospects by helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for resale.

loans.name: Reyna Marisol

texts.es:
La señora Reyna Marisol desempeña su cargo de maestra en un colegio de su comunidad en El Sauce, bajo estas circunstancias ha sabido llevar el bienestar de su casa y su familia logrando mantenerla en buenas condiciones.  

La señora Reyna cuenta con un hijo bajo su cargo, y el destino del crédito es para darle mejoras a su vivienda que tanto lo necesita sabiendo que Ceprodel en todo momento apoya a los maestros para que estos puedan tener un techo digno donde habitar.
 
 Con el crédito comprará cementó, arena y pago de mano de obra, con esto le permitirá mejorar el piso de su casa ya que han sido sus sueños de vivir en mejores condiciones en conjunto con su hijo
texts.en:
Reyna Marisol is a teacher in a school in the community of El Sauce, and these working conditions have enabled the wellbeing of her home and her family and she has successfully taken care of them.

Reyna cares for a dependent child and the money from the loan is to make improvements to her housing, knowing that Ceprodel can help teachers at any time to be able to have a decent roof over their heads.

With the loan she will buy cement, sand and pay for the labor. This will permit her to improve the floor of her home as she has been dreaming of living in better conditions together with her child.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand and to pay for the labor

loans.name: Furaha

texts.en:
Furaha is 29 years old and married. She has two children, ages 3 and 6 years old. 

Her business is clean and good. She sells African clothes in the market. She has five years experience in this business and employs one person to help her. Her business runs from 9 a.m. until 7 p.m. every day.

Furaha has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more African clothes for resale. 

With any profit from the loan, Furaha will expand her business and save for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more African clothes for resale.

loans.name: Filwende Group

texts.fr:
Mme SUZANE est la représentante du groupe FILWENDE. Elle est  mariée  et mère de 02enfants. Le plus âgé  a 04ans et  le moins âgé a 04ans ( ce sont des jumeaux). Tous vont  à l’école. Elle a 02 personnes  en charge.

Elle vend des paniers  depuis 01ans. Elle s’approvisionne  à Banfora une ville du BURKINA. Ses clients sont  les femmes et hommes (au marché et le voisinage).

Elle veut  s’acheter 20 gros paniers, 70 moyens et 250 petits paniers.

 Mme utilise ses bénéfices pour mieux satisfaire sa demande. Elle ambitionne  acheter  une parcelle et assurer l’éducation et le bien être de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Madame Suzane is the representative of the Filwende group. She is married with two sons; they are both four years old (they are twins) and both go to school. She is responsible for two people.
She has sold baskets for one year. She stocks up in Banfora, a town in Burkina Faso. Her customers are men and women (from her neighbourhood and customers at the market).
She would like to buy 20 large baskets, 70 medium baskets and 250 small baskets.
Suzane uses her earnings to better serve her customers' demand. Her goal is to buy a plot of land and ensure her children's education and well-being.

loans.use: to buy 20 large baskets, 70 medium baskets, and 250 small baskets.

loans.name: Ekué

texts.fr:
Ekué est un homme âgé de 37 ans. Il est marié à une couturière et a 02 enfants.
Ekué travaille comme revendeur de CD depuis 2008. Il vend au grand marché de Lomé et achète ses marchandises au Nigéria.
Ekué a requis son quatrième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des CD. 
Dans les prochaines années, Ekué voudrait avoir d’autres activités et assurer un bon avenir à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ekué, age 37, is married to a seamstress and has two children. Since 2008, he's been working as a CD retailer. He gets his supplies in Nigeria, and sells them at the Grand Market in Lomé.

Ekué is seeking his fourth loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy CDs. In the forthcoming years, he would like to diversify his business and secure a good future for his children.

loans.use: to buy CDs

loans.name: Keyci

texts.es: Keyci de 24 años de edad  vive en la ciudad de Cartagena, lugar donde tiene su propio negocio de vender carnes frías y productos de aseo. Su negocio lo inició una vez dejó de trabajar con un empresario que comercializa estos productos y con quien adquirió su experiencia.  Así fue como  hace 1 año emprendió su propia aventura de negocio independiente, teniendo el apoyo del empresario con quien trabajaba, pues él le daba los productos a consignación. Con   sus ahorros, generados por sus ganancias,  logró tener su propio capital y hoy compra directamente, pero en épocas de mucho movimiento comercial, como la navidad y la llegada del nuevo año, las ventas se incrementan y es cuando su capital de trabajo, se torna insuficiente para responder a la demanda. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la  Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará carnes frías, embutidos, productos de belleza, desinfectantes y ropa que tiene encargados por sus clientes y que le permiten tener en su negocio un buen surtido. Su sueño es hacerlo crecer, para aumentar sus ingresos y en el futuro tener su casa propia y ofrecerle una buena educación a su  hijo que tiene 8 meses de nacido.
texts.en:
Keyci, 24, lives in the city of Cartagena where she has her business selling cold cuts and cleaning supplies.  She started her business when she stopped working for a businessman who also sells these products and where she gained her experience.  

A year ago, then, she started her own adventure as an independent business with support from that businessman she used to work for because he’d give her products on consignment.  With savings generated from her profits she managed to have her own capital and today she buys directly but during seasons of high commercial activity, like Christmas and New Year, her working capital is insufficient to meet demand.

This is the reason behind her Kiva loan, her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she’ll use to buy cold cuts, canned goods, beauty products, disinfectants and clothes she has customer prior orders for so that she can have a well-stocked business.  Her dream is to make it grow to increase income and in future have a house of her own and to provide her 8-month-old son with a good education.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store and clothes she has standing orders for.

loans.name: Mmasava's Group

texts.en:
Mmasava’s group has four group leader farmers and is located in Webuye District.  The group leaders represent a total of 57 individual farmers (not pictured) who are each asking for an average loan of 5,349 KES to purchase a One Acre Fund package for ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  As the Kiva group representative, Mmasava is pictured on the right of the Bahati Group with his hand raised.
							
Mmasava is a reliable member of the community.  He is married with three children.  Mmasava is 38 years old and has been working as a farmer for the last 20 years to support his family.  In addition to this, Mmasava is very active in his community and is involved in the savings group and prayer group.  His harvest last year was not with One Acre Fund.  He hopes as a One Acre Fund farmer, he will be able to join the ranks of the One Acre Fund farmers that have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program!							
							
The 2013 Long Rains season will be Mmasava’s first season with One Acre Fund.  He joined this year in order to learn new farming methods.  As an active member in his community,  Mmasava also volunteered his time to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he wants to help more farmers.  Mmasava plans on using profits from the harvest to save for the future.  He believes that his life will improve by working with One Acre Fund.
							
Mmasava and the Bahati Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.   One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.
							
The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and hybrid seeds for maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en: Zenaida is 58 years old married with two children and resides in Clarin Misamis Occidental along with her family. She owns and manages a general store, selling grocery goods and home products in her community to make a living. Zenaida has successfully repaid her previous loans from GDMPC used for her business. Recently, Zeniada took a new loan to buy additional grocery goods to sell. She plans to use the income generated with her loan to expand her business and save for her future of her children.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Ayaba Victoire

texts.en:
Ayaba Victoire K. is married and the mother of a child. Since the start of her marriage, she helped her husband in his hardware business. Very dynamic and intelligent, she discovered how to identify what things are in demand in the village of her birth. So, using an initial loan of $550, which she has since repaid without difficulty, she opened a little hardware supplies store she calls My Victory, a name inspired by her given name. With the experience derived from her husband and his business, she manages her enterprise pretty well demonstrating a complete mastery of it.

To grow the business and bring in more income, Mrs. K. is requesting a loan of $1,000 which will serve to acquire hardware supplies for resale. The success of her plans will strengthen the welfare of these two parents, who also have five other dependents from their respective families to care for.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame K. Victoire Ayaba est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Depuis son mariage, elle aide son époux dans son commerce de quincaillerie. Très dynamique et intelligente, elle a su identifier et déceler le manque de ces articles dans son village natal. Elle a alors ouvert un petit magasin de quincaillerie avec son premier crédit de $550 qu’elle a bien remboursé et sans incident. Avec cette expérience acquise auprès de son mari, elle fait preuve d’une maîtrise totale cette activité qu’elle gère assez bien.

Pour accroître ses activités et augmenter ses revenus, Madame K. Victoire Ayaba sollicite aujourd’hui un crédit de $1000 qui servira à acheter et vendre de la quincaillerie. La réalisation de projet renforcera le bien-être de couple qui a à sa charge cinq (05) autres personnes issues de leurs familles respective.

loans.use: to buy and sell the hardware

loans.name: Eldaniz

texts.en:
This young man is 32 years old.He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region settled in the Fizuli region, Behmenli village. He is married and has a child.
Eldaniz is the sole breadwinner in his family.
In the beginning of his business he did work in home repairs. He did not have enough tools. Then he decided to borrow $600 and bought the necessary tools.
Now he needs a loan of $800 to purchase building materials.
Eldaniz has run this business for 4 years.

loans.use: To buy building materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase food and materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase basic cooking ingredients

loans.name: Ni Ketut Sriani

texts.id:
The surrounding conditions is a primary factor and very influential to one’s decision. Ni Ketut Sriani is not hesitant in carrying out pig farming as during every religious celebration in Bali pork is an essential. Currently, she only breeds the local pig, as her capital is small. With this loan from DINARI of Rp 1.400.000 (USD175), this capital can be used to fund 4 pigs, costing Rp 1.000.000 (USD125). The remainder to purchase feed. In less than 6 months, the pigs can be sold for gross income of Rp 2.800.000 (USD350) less cost of Rp 1.500.000, leaving a net income of Rp 1.300.000 (USD165) for the 6 months. She can then set aside funds to pay for her child’s education.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Lingkungan adalah faktor utama yang sangat berpengaruh atau mendukung Ni Ketut Sriani untuk menjalani usaha beternak babi, maka Ni ketut Sriani tidak ragu – ragu dalam menjalankan usaha ini. Karena di Bali setiap upacara keagamaan sangat membutuhkan daging babi.Saat ini Ni Ketut Sriani hanya memelihara Babi Lokal karena kurangnya modal yang dimiliki.Dengan adanya pinjaman modal dari Dinari sebesar Rp.1.400.000,- modal ini dipergunakan untuk memelihara 4 babi penggemukan sebesar Rp.1.000.000,-. Sisanya dipakai untuk membeli pakan babi.Dalam kurun waktu 6 bulan babi sudah siap untuk dipanen pendapatan kotor yang didapat dari penjualan babi Rp.2.800.000,-sedangkan modal yang dikeluarkan Rp.1.500.000,-.Keuntungan bersih Rp 1.300.000,- per 6 bulan. Dari hasil usahanya ini Ni Ketut Sriani bisa menyisihkan uangnya untuk persiapan biaya sekolah anaknya .

loans.use: Purchase piglets and feed (Membeli bibit babi dan pakan ternak)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more dishes, ingredients and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy macaroni , tomatoes etc.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline A. is a mother of 6, is 40 years old, and hails from the Ighando Area of Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells drinks, juices, wine, and provisions. She has been in business since 2002. She needs the loan amount of $875 to buy more drinks for sale.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and provisions for sale

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
The great responsibility of maintaining the security of his family in his home has led this unselfish father to dedicate many hours to his job inside his small vehicle. With the daily work that he carries out he has been able to establish their well-being. However, despite his sacrifices he has not been able to perform complete repairs on his car. Temporarily, the malfunctions have depleted his profits. His aspirations of improving his vehicle's conditions have driven him to ask for a loan to cover satisfactorily the large number of hours for labor.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

La inmensa responsabilidad de mantener a buen recaudo a su familia dentro de su hogar, han llevado a este abnegado padre a desempeñar largas hora de labor a bordo de su pequeño automóvil. Con el trabajo diario que lleva a cabo les ha procurado bienestar pero a pesar de sus esfuerzos no ha podido refaccionar su vehículo completamente y temporalmente las fallas merman sus ganancias. Su deseo de mejorar las condiciones de su vehículo lo conducen a solicitar un préstamo para cubrir con satisfacción las inmensas horas de labor.

loans.use: To repair his small vehicle

loans.name: Maura's Group

texts.es:
Dora and Maura have belonged to the Sumaq Wasi (“Pretty House”) Communal Bank for 6 months.

Dora lives in a communal home. She is 43 years old and has 3 children. Dora and her husband have a business processing cereals and milk. They sell their products to different stores in the city of Ayacucho. In addition, Dora sells cosmetics via a catalogue.

Meanwhile, Maura is married, 44 years old and has 2 children. Maura sells cereals, groceries and vegetables from her house.

Dora and Maura need loans of 600 soles and 1000 soles, respectively; money that will be invested in the purchase of soy, arverja (a vegetable used to make flour), quinua (a native grain), perfumes, sugar, rice, oil and cereals.

The dreams of Dora and Maura are to have a larger business, to offer a good education to their children and to have more supplies for their business.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Dora y Maura pertenecen al Banco Comunal Sumaq Wasi que significa “ Casa Bonita” hace 6 meses.

Dora es conviviente, tiene 43 años y 3 hijos, Dora junto a su esposo tienen un empresa de procesamiento de cereales y lácteos, sus ventas lo realizan a las diferentes tiendas de la ciudad de ayacucho. Además Dora vende cosméticos por catálogo.

Mientras que Maura es casada, tiene 44 años y 2 hijos, Maura vende cereales, abarrotes, verduras, en su casa.

Dora y Maura necesitan préstamos de 600 soles, 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de soya, arverja, quinua, perfumes, azúcar, arroz, aceite y cereales.

Los sueños de Dora y Maura son tener un negocio más grande, brindar una buena educación a sus hijos y surtir más su negocio.

loans.use: To buy soy, arverja (a vegetable used to make flour), quinua (a native grain), perfumes, sugar, rice, oil and cereals for their cereal production and grocery businesses.

loans.name: Thị Hằng

texts.vi:
Mrs. N. Thị Hằng (MS: 070018), 30 years old, is a teacher. Her husband is a general labor. She has had one loan before, fully repaid. She would like to apply for a loan of 175USD to invest in her few pigs to get some extra income.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị N. Thị Hằng (MS: 070018), năm nay 30 tuổi. Chị vay 2.478.000 VND để lấy vốn nuôi lợn. Chị là giáo viên, chồng chị đi làm thêm để có thêm thu nhập. Chị đã tham gia được một kỳ và hoàn trả rất tốt.

loans.use: Livestock

loans.name: Halima

texts.ru:
Halima B. lives in the city of Yavan. She is married and has five children. Although she is not employed, she does practice agriculture. She raises vegetables and sells the harvest at the market. This is a business she has been involved in for 10 years, and it helps her family earn additional income. She would like to receive a loan in order to buy high quality fertilizer. She plans to repay the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer.

Бердикулова Халима жительница города Яван. Замужем и имеет 5 детей. Нигде не работает , но занимается сельским хозяйством. Сажает овощи и полученный урожай продает на базаоре. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 10 лет. Ее деятельнеость помогает ее семье получать дополнительный доход. Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы закупить качественные удобрения . Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Fertilizer purchase

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 54 years old. She is married with five children. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, evaporated milk, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oil, washing powder, toilet soaps, candies, and biscuits in the local market. She wants to use the loan to buy her goods in bulk to expand her business. Rose hopes to make good income from the expanded business to enable her provide the children with quality education. She belongs to the community group called ‘Beloved Trust Group’. The group guarantees a loan through repayment pledge. Peer pressure and support provide additional incentive to repay, because if one person in the group defaults, the other group members make up the repayment amount.

loans.use: To buy rice, canned foods, milk, assorted food spices, washing soaps and powders in bulk

loans.name: Mame Penda

texts.fr:
Mame Penda T. was born in 1970. She is married and lives in the Grand Thies neighborhood in Senegal. She has been in business for over five years. She sells cloths, fabrics for women's clothes and cosmetic goods that she buys in Mauritania and the Ivory Coast. She is requesting this loan with the goal of increasing her profit margin.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva volunteer.

mame penda T. est une femme mariée née en 1970 et vit au quartier grand thies .elle fait du commerce depuis plus de cinq ans .elle vend des draps ;des tissus pour femme et des produits cosmétiques qu'elle achète en MAURITANIE ou en COTE D'IVOIRE . c'est dans le but d'augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire qu'elle sollicite ce pret.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Phan Thi

texts.vi: Chị Hằng tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2003. Gia đình chị có 2 con đều đã trưởng thành.Gia đình chị sống ở cạch sông Đáy nên rất thuận lợi cho việc đánh bắt cá. Hàng ngày ngoài thời gian đi đánh bắt cá trên sông anh chị còn đầu tư vốn để chăn nuôi  thêm. Với thu nhập khoảng 4.000.000đ /tháng từ công việc đánh bắt cá và nguồn thu khá ổn định từ chăn nuôi kinh tế gia đình chị Hằng đã ngày càng ổn định và phát triển hơn. Vòng vốn tới chị Hằng  mong muốn được vay 10 triệu đồng để đầu tư mua bộ lưới mới phục vụ cho việc đánh bắt cá.
texts.en:
Ms. H. has been a member of this organization since 2003. She has 2 children who are now grown adults. Her family place of residence is in close proximity to a river which allows them to fish. Beside the family’s fishing business, Ms. H. and her family is able to invest into raising livestock. Her family’s finances has been steady and growing, averaging 4.000.000d/month from both businesses. This next loan she is requesting an amount of 10.000.000d to buy supplies for her fishing business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Lynn Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tool to fish

loans.name: Pala

texts.en: Pala T., 25, is married. She has many years of experience in the taro/banana business. She sells to the villagers and the public two days per week. She has one previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (about $208 USD). SPBD loans are Pala's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use her loan to buy chemicals, pesticides, bush knives, spades, and shovels. Her husband helps her with her taro/banana business.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals, pesticides, bush knives, spades and shovels

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: La señora Elizabeth pertenece al Banco Comunal “Amigas por Siempre”, ubicado en el Jr. Los Mangos Nº.506 “San Fernando” del Distrito de Manantay del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 29 años y es madre 2 hijos, menores de edad que aun dependen de ella, es casada, su esposo trabaja como Supervisor de Telefonía Básica. Elizabeth con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/300 decide invertir en la venta de kekes y pasteles. Tiene 1 año trabajando con el Banco. nnEn la actualidad ella cuenta con la venta de Broastería, se levanta temprano para atender a sus hijos por las tardes se dedica a preparar lo necesario para salir a vender en las noches. nnCon este préstamo de S/1.200 el cual será pagado en 5 meses comprará: 10 kilos de papa, 7 pollos, 3 kilos de arroz, 2 kilos de maíz morada, 5 docenas de huevos y otros.nnElizabeth agradece a Manuela Ramos porque su negocio ha crecido, desea seguir surgiendo en la vida por el bienestar de sus queridos hijos.n
texts.en:
Elizabeth belongs to the "Amigas por Siempre" Communal Bank, located on Jirón Los Mangos San Fernando in the district of Manantay, department of Ucayali. She is 29 years old and the mother of 2 children, who are minors and still her dependents. She is married and her husband works as a telephone supervisor. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos for S/300 she invested in cakes and pastries to sell. She has been working with the Communal Bank for 1 year. She currently sells roasted chickens. She gets up early each day to take care of her children and in the afternoons prepares what she needs to go out at night to sell. With this loan for S/.1,200, which will be repaid in 5 months, she will buy: 10 kilos of potato, 7 chickens, 3 kilos of rice, 2 kilos of purple corn, 5 dozen eggs and other items. Elizabeth is thankful to Manuel Ramos because her business has grown. She wants to continue improving in life for the wellbeing of her beloved children.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies at wholesales prices.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
“ For a long time I’ve been dreaming about a good and a bright future for my children”, says Flora L., who is 47years old and married with 5 children.  She is from Matina, Davao City. By sending all of her children to college she believes that there will be a future ahead of them after school.

Flora has a retail store  that sprouted from very modest beginnings. She is a new client of CEV and is determined to succeed in her business. She is requesting a $125 loan from CEV to purchase additional goods to be displayed in her store. She plans to utilize her loan for additional stock to augment her income. 

Now that she is a member of CEV, Flora enjoys receiving the credit assistance, trainings and insurance coverage that the organization provides.

loans.use: Purchase additional goods to sell in her store

loans.name: Eulogia

texts.es:
La señora Eulogia es socia del Banco Comunal “Flor de Canela”, distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Tiene 43 años de edad, es soltera y madre de un hijo que es estudiante universitario y que mantiene económicamente. Nos cuenta que tiene la intención de ampliar su negocio abriendo una sucursal de su librería y fotocopiadora. Tiene casi 3 meses trabajando con el banco comunal.

Con este préstamo de S/. 600, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará papel, toner y ampliará su negocio.

Eulogia desea continuar trabajando para apoyar a su hijo a que termine sus estudios y llegue a ser profesional.
texts.en:
Mrs. Eulogia is a member of the communal bank "Flor de Canela", in the district, province and region of Puno. She is 43 years old, single, and has one son who is studying in the university, whom she supports economically. Her goal to expand her business by opening another branch of her bookstore and photocopy business. She has worked with the communal bank for almost three months. With this loan of 600 soles, which will be repaid in four payments, she will buy paper and toner and expand her business. Eulogia wishes to keep working to support her son so he can finish his studies and start his career.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy paper and toner and expand the business.

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en:
Mr. Chhun N., 35, makes a living as a rice farmer and also is a local palm climber. By palm climbing, he can tap palm juice from palm trees, boiling it to make palm sugar or turn it into palm wine for sale. He is currently earning an average of US$ 1.50 a day to help feed his family. He is married to Our Own, 33, who works with him in the farm work. Together they live with four children, all of whom are single and attend school.

N. is applying a loan to buy a cart to transport his rice crops and some material to use for climbing palm trees. The family lives in Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a cart and some material to use for climbing palm trees

loans.name: Sulton

texts.ru:
Cултон мужчина 38 лет , отец троих детей , жена продавец в магазине.Сам Султон работает на заводе по ремонту автомобилей.Он мастер по ремонту моторов легковых авто. Помимо своей работы он имеет также дополнительный бизнес, производство и продажа пчелиного мёда.У него очень вкусный и целебный мёд,который пользуется большим спросом на рынке Худжанда.Для закупа оптом сахара ему понадобился кредит.
Для чего он и обратился в Микроинвест.
texts.en:
Sulton, 38, married, is a father of three. His wife works as a salesperson at a retail store. Sulton works as a mechanic at an auto repair factory. Sulton specializes in repairing engines of passenger vehicles. In addition to his job at the factory, Sulton keeps honeybees. His bees produce delicious and salubrious honey, which is in great demand at the Khudzhand market. Sulton will use this loan for wholesale purchase of sugar for his bees.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sugar for honeybees

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es:
Soledad es socia del Banco Comunal Despertar.
Soledad es casada, tiene 54 años y 5 hijos, Soledad tiene hospedaje ubicado cerca al mercado central D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. sus hijos y 1 empleado. Además Soledad tiene 2 puestos D. venta D. comida en el mercado Santa Elena y también cuenta con la ayuda D. 1 ayudante.
Soledad necesita un préstamo D. 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. sabanas, almohadas y como parte D. pago D. una congeladora.
Soledad sueña con que sus hijos culminen sus estudios y obtengan sus títulos, construir sus puestos con material noble.
texts.en:
Soledad is a member of the Despertar Microfinance Institute.

Soledad is a 54-year-old married mother with 5 children. She owns an inn that is located near the central market of Ayacucho. She runs the business with the help of one of her children and an employee. She also has 2 stalls in which she sells fast food in the Santa Elena market, and has an employee working for her.

Soledad needs a 1,500.00 PEN loan, which will be invested in purchasing bed sheets and pillows. She will also use the rest of the money as one installment for a freezer.

Soledad dreams of seeing her children complete their studies and earn their degrees. She would also like to build her stalls with decent materials.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bed sheets and pillows; give an installment for a freezer

loans.name: Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The Village Bank loan consists of sixteen people, located in Prachum Angk village in Kandal province. All members will use the loan for different purposes.

Mrs.Phin D. is the Village Bank president, who was selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. In this plantation, she cultivates rice in the dry season and her field now faces a small problem because it has infertile soil which has a bad affect on her crop. So she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support the field and use the rest of the loan to buy fuel for her pump to water the field to make her crop more productive.

Her husband, Mr. Sim Thea, is a construction worker who can earn less income to support the family. Phin D. is 36 years old and the mother of five children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory and the other two attend the local school.

This loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Nine members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer to support her farm and buy fuel to pump water on the field to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Mehriniso

texts.ru: Мехринисо – женщина 41 лет, замужем и мать 6-х детей. Её муж занимается купле -продажей скота на скотном рынке. А она откармливает крупнорогатый скот дома. Она помогает мужу в развитии его бизнеса, потому что хочет иметь больше прибыли, чтобы женить своих сыновей.  За счет займа они хотят увеличить количество скота и  получить больше прибыли.
texts.en:
Mehriniso is a 41 year old woman; she is married and is the mother of 6 children. Her husband purchases and sells livestock at the livestock market. Mehriniso fattens the livestock at home. She helps her husband to develop his business, because she would like to increase their income to marry off her sons. They would like to use the loan to increase their livestock headcount and increase their income.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
El señor Eduardo B. Díaz es propietario de un negocio de abarrotes de nombre “Williams” negocio establecido desde hace 8 años, perseverando para lograr sus objetivos y dedicándole el tiempo suficiente a su tiendita.
Don Eduardo le ha ido realizando mejoras a su hogar (lugar donde tiene su negocio), pero la necesidad que ahora presenta es la colocación del vitropiso en su tienda,para darle una nueva imagen,y por esto solicita este crédito.
texts.en:
Mr. Eduardo B. D. is the owners of a grocery store called "Williams". He started this business 8 years ago, persevering to attain his goals and dedicating his time to his store. Don Eduardo has made improvements to his house (the place where he has his business). His current need is to install a tile floor in his store to give it a new look, for this he is requesting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Installation of a tile floor in his store.

loans.name: Ajka

texts.en:
Ajka comes from a suburb of the town of Banovići. She is 51 years old and lives with her husband; their children are adults and live away from the parents' home. Ajka works as a cleaning lady in a local school; her husband is employed too.

Ajka, like most Bosnian women, has a garden where she produces vegetables for her own use. Besides that, Ajka has one hobby - raising turkeys. Turkey meat is very popular and healthy and Ajka keeps always two or three for her own use. But now she has decided to make more out of her hobby and she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner MFI, WWI, in the amount of 800 KM, to purchase more turkeys to raise for resale.

loans.use: To buy turkeys to raise

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga tiene 38 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y admirada en su barrio, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su hija Mayomi de 17 años, a quien desea dar unos buenos estudios superiores. Su trabajo le exige mucha responsabilidad, es empleada del hogar, y entre sus muchas tareas diarias como; cocinar, lavar, planchar, etc, está la de cuidar a los hijos de la familia para la que trabaja, a quienes quiere como si fueran sus propios hijos. Su día comienza muy temprano, a las 7 de la mañana el desayuno tiene que estar preparado sobre la mesa, para luego llevar a los niños hasta sus respectivos centros educativos, luego, y lo más le gusta es cocinar y la sazón que le pone a sus comidas es muy sabrosa. Lleva 25 años realizando esta actividad, 5 de ellos, con esta familia, pero su deseo es tener un negocio propio. Este es el primer préstamo de Olga con MFP, espera cumplir con todas sus cuotas a tiempo y así no perjudicar a las socias de su banco comunal, en donde es muy respetada por la responsabilidad que demuestra. Los mil nuevos soles solicitados serán parte de capital para su futuro negocio, una de las posibilidades es comprar ropa para venderla en la feria de su localidad los días que tiene libre de su trabajo, la otra, es instalar una bodega en su casa y dejar de trabajar para otros. Asimismo, con una parte del dinero pagará los gastos de educación de su hija.
texts.en:
Olga, 38, is a very hard working woman who is admired in her neighborhood. She lives in a rented house with her 17 year old daughter. Olga wants to give her daughter a good university education. Her work demands a lot of responsibility. She is a household employee. Among her many daily tasks are: cooking, washing, ironing, etc. She takes care of the children of the family she works for, and she loves the children like they were her own. Her day starts very early. At seven in the morning breakfast has to be ready and on the table. Then, she takes the children to their respective educational centers. Later, she does what she likes best; she cooks. The flavor that she adds to her meals is very delicious. She has been doing this type of work for twenty five years. Five of those years have been with this family. But, her wish is to have her own business. This is Olga’s first loan with MFP. She expects to make all of her payments on time. That way she will not harm the members of her community bank where she is much respected for the responsibility she has demonstrated. The 1,000 PEN will be part of the capital for her future business. One of the possibilities is to buy clothes to sell at the local fair on her days off from work. The other is to set up a store in her house and stop working for others. With part of the money she will pay her daughter’s educational expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital to invest in her business

loans.name: Celerina

texts.en:
Celerina C. is from the village of Sugbongcogon, Tagoloan Cagayan De Oro City. She is 33 years old and single. To make a living, Celerina owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling (wholesale or retail) "ballot" a famous egg delicacy among Filipinos. Celerina has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Celerina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Celerina is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to finance her business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Celerina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the family's daily needs.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Nivea Lourdes

texts.en:
Nivea Lourdes B. is from the village of Brgy. Lumad, Mambajao Camiguin. She is 21 years old. Nivea Lourdes is single and has an infant child. To make a living, Nivea Lourdes owns & operates a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fish in the local community. Nivea Lourdes is just starting this business.

In 2009, Nivea Lourdes joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nivea Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Nivea Lourdes from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Zaba Group

texts.en:
Zaba is the group leader of Zaba group. There are four members in this group and each of them wants to take a loan to progress their business and make it larger. So they are requested a group of loan 20,000 Afghani.

Zaba wants to take a loan for her tailoring business.

Sariu wants to take a loan for her husband who has fruit and vegetable shop.

HA. wants to take a loan for his general store.

Aliui wants to take a loan for her tailoring business.

They are thankful for AFS and Kiva lenders who are able to support all entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To expand her tailoring business

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
M. Christine is married and has two children, a boy and a girl. Her daughter recently took the Bac and will attend university next year. Her son is 14 years old and is in school. For three years, she has been running a small general store where she sells various goods. She buys her products at the Ouando Market in Porto-Novo. 

Christine’s brother helped her open her shop a few years ago. After acquiring her first loan from Alidé, a Kiva Field Partner in Benin, Christine was able to start selling gasoline. Christine is seeking a second loan from Alidé in order to restock her store. In particular, she would like to buy wood, diesel fuel, soap, pasta, and couscous. With more financial resources, she hopes to someday acquire the funds to buy a grinder that turns corn into flour.

loans.use: To purchase wood, diesel fuel, soap, pasta, and couscous

loans.name: Karla Del Carmen

texts.es:
La dama Karla Aragon a raiz de sus esfuerzos múltiples ha logrado establecer su propia pulpería la que es atendida por ella misma en el departamento de Masaya en donde a diario ofrece los productos a sus clientes que le visitan.

Como todo negocio en desarrollo, la pulpería requiere de la inversión directa para la compra de los productos y por esto es que Karla ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar el crédito y de esta manera invertirlo directamente en la compra de los productos diversos para la pulpería.
texts.en:
As a result of her efforts, Ms. Karla Aragon has managed to set up her own general store that she attends herself in the department of Masaya, selling goods to her customers daily.

As with every developing business, the general store needs direct investment. Karla has now turned to Ceprodel for a loan that she can invest in purchasing a variety of goods for her general store.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Nelson Zamir

texts.es: Nelson de 36 años es soltero, tiene 3 hijos, la menor tiene 17 años y esta estudiando su ultimo año en la secundaria, tiene un pequeño negocio en la casa de su mamá que es donde habita, esta solicitando refinanciamiento de su 2do credito para acondicionar un poco mas su negocio que es un salon de billares con 4 mesas, con el credito anterior logró acondicionar la infraestructura del local, ahora desea comprar mas tacos, juego de bolas y al mismo tiempo invertir para vender gaseosas, refrescos, enchiladas, los cuales consumirian sus mismos clientes que lo visitan. El mayor sueño de Nelson es lograr que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y poder brindarle mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Nelson is 36 years old, is single, has 3 children, the youngest is 17 years old and is in her last year of high school. He has a small business in his mother's home, where he lives. He is requesting to refinance his second loan to renovate his business, a billiard hall with 4 tables. With his last loan, he renovated the structure of his business. Now he wants to buy more tacos, sets of pool balls and, at the same time, start to sell soft drinks, enchiladas, which would be eaten by the clients that visit his business. Nelson's greatest dream is to succeed in having his children finish their studies and to be able to provide them a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Billiard Hall and Sale of Refreshments

loans.name: Vitza

texts.es:
Vitza, es ayudante de albañil y trabaja de lunes a sábado en una construcción. 
Vive en la zona de alto Llojeta de la Ciudad de La Paz, en casa propia 
El crédito será destinado para capital e iniciar el negocio de venta de azúcar, arroz, harina, etc., al crédito y poder mejorar sus ingresos y calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. Su responsabilidad y la necesidad que tiene le dan la oportunidad de obtener este crédito.

loans.use: Compra de articulos de consumo básico, como harina, arroz, azucar, etc., para su posterior venta al crédito.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth R. is from the village of Don Jose Aguirre. She is 26 years old. Elizabeth is married and has two school-age children. To make a living, Elizabeth owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables to sell. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for over five years with an approximate average monthly earnings of $150 from these activities.

In 2009, Elizabeth joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to pay for help in cultivating the land to increase crop yield. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her second loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children and to improve their quality of life in the future. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie F. is from the village of Maquilao, Tangub City. She is 37 years old, married, and has 2 school-aged children.

To make a living, Lanie raises livestock. Her main source of income comes from selling pigs to the local community. Lanie has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Lanie joined GDMPC to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lanie successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Lanie is requesting her second loan from GDMPC for 5000 PHP which she will use to purchase feed for the pigs.

She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her family’s general living conditions.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note
To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders

loans.use: To purchase feed for the pigs she sells.

loans.name: Leonor Elija

texts.pt:
Leonor Elija C. nasceu no Distrito de Chibuto, Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique, tem 51 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de 3 filhos de 35, 32 e 25 anos de idade, ninguém vai a escola. Não estudou porque na altura os pais não dispunham de condições financeiras favoráveis. Vive na casa própria com a família e sustenta mais 2 netos que vivem com ela.

Saiu da Província de Gaza para Maputo anos de 1987, após a morte do presidente Samora Machel, a procura de melhores condições de vida, tendo depois construído uma residência no bairro 5 em Boane na Província de Maputo. Tem um negócio próprio de venda de produtos de primeira necessidade a mais de 3 anos, também é médica tradicional (curandeira). Nestas actividades consegue um rendimento mensal de cerca de 5.000.00mt que aplica no sustento da família e poupa algum por mes, através do sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa.

Nunca teve empréstimos com outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma amiga e este é o seu 7º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar produtos de mercearia (arroz, óleo, açúcar, amendoim e outros) para poder responder a demanda do mercado. Os empréstimos anteriores foram (quatro de 15.000,00mt, 1 de 10.000,00mt, 1 de 5.000,00mt e 1 de 2.500,00mt para as actividades de comércio e habitação.

No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos, para construir uma mercearia de material convencional, como forma de garantir segurança e higiene nos seus produtos.
texts.en:
Leonor Elija C. was born in the district of Chibuto in the province of Gaza in southern Mozambique. She is 51; single, and the mother of 3 children who are 35, 32, and 25. None of them goes to school. She didn't go to school because her parents didn't have the financial resources to send her. She lives in her own home with her family and also supports 2 grandchildren who live with her. She left the province of Gaza for Maputo in 1987 in search of better living conditions after the death of president Samora Machel. Afterwards, she constructed her home in neighborhood 5 in Boane in the province of Maputo. She has had her own business selling basic goods for more than 3 years. She also practices traditional medicine, which is known as curandeira. With these activities, she make a monthly profit of 5,000 meticais, which she uses to support her family. She also saves some every month through a traditional rotating savings program. She has never had a loan with another insitution. She became familiar with Hluvuku through a friend. This is her 7th loan, and it is for 15,000 meticais. She will use it purchase merchandise (rice, margarine, sugar, peanuts, etc.) to respond to market demand. Her previous loans ( 4 for 15,000 meticais, 1 for 10,000 meticais, 1 for 5,000 meticais, and 1 for 2,500 meticais) went towards her business and housing needs. In the future, she hopes to request more loans to construct a shelter of conventional materials as a way of guaranteeing the safety and freshness of her products.

Translated from Portuguese by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell various food products

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is 29-year-old barber who has his own barber shop in Ramallah city, Palestine. He is married and has two children. Mahmoud`s business brings in stable income for his family, but it is their only source of income, and he is requesting a loan to improve his shop and buy new barbering tools. Mahmoud believes these improvements will help him attract more clients.

loans.use: Improve his shop and buy new barbering implements

loans.name: Norberto

texts.en:
Mr. Norberto C. is a father with two children. He has been married to Victoria since 1998.

Norberto is a rice farmer and he also drives a tricycle. He uses his income from driving to buy feeds for the pigs he raises. He works hard for his family and his children’s education. He wants all of them to have proper education and to have a decent job someday.

Norberto joined CEVI in 2007 and is grateful for the opportunities he gained access to. He is now requesting to borrow 10000 PHP. He will use this loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies. This loan will surely help Nortberto maintain his farm

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Samet

texts.en:
Mr. Samet D. (pictured here), 51 and his wife, Mrs. Rann Ry, 50, were married in 1980 and have five children- two sons and three daughters. One of the children is married and lives outside the family home, and two are in school. The family is living in a village along National Road Number One approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Samet has been a farmer for thirty years. He grows cauliflowers. His wife has been selling fruit since 2003. She buys it from her village and transports it to sell in Phnom Penh market. Samet is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase fruit for his wife to sell.

loans.use: To purchase fruits for his wife to sell.

loans.name: Rutendere Group A, Kihihi

texts.en:
T. Geofrey is a married man with five children aged between 2 and 15 years. He also takes care of his mother. He is a hardworking man with two businesses: he grows, buys and sells, and he also has a motorcycle business. He has been in business for 15 years at Butogota trading center, and is able to make 50,000 UGX profit every week.
Geofrey lacks sufficient capital for his businesses to thrive since most of his earnings are taken up with the payment of school fees. Geofrey is requesting a loan to buy more coffee for resale since this will expand his business and increase sales and profits. He is grateful for his loans.
In the future he would like to convert his retail business to wholesale, have a wholesale shop, and build a permanent house for his family.

loans.use: To buy more coffee for resale

loans.name: Maylyn's Group

texts.en:
Maylyn V. is from the village of Antagan 2nd. She is 26 years old. Maylyn is the leader of a 5-member loan group sponsored by ASKI. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Maylyn V..

Maylyn is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Maylyn owns and operates a specialized retail store where she sells daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Maylyn has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Maylyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maylyn has successfully repaid a previous loan that she used to purchase additional products to sell. Maylyn is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Maylyn's fifth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Juan Agustín

texts.es: El señor Juan Agustín V.
