C., cuenta con 53 años de edad, casado, vive con su propia familia, en la actualidad Don Juan  tiene el oficio de Artesanía “Elaboración de cortes típicos” se acerco a la asociación ASDIR para  un pequeño préstamo para poder sufragar unos gastos personales que se presento, el poder comprar unos bienes, de esa pequeña ayuda el podrá mejorar su condición de vida, como también podrá aumentar los bienes que le corresponde, para que a su familia no le falte nada.
texts.en:
Juan Agustín V. C. is 53 years old, married, and lives with his own family. Juan currently has the job of making traditional clothing. He approached Asociación ASDIR for a small loan to be able to defray some personal costs and be able to purchase a few goods. With this small help, he will be able to both improve his living conditions and increase the goods he owns so that his family is not lacking anything.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Handicrafts (purchase of raw material)

loans.name: Máximo Leonel

texts.es: En el municipio de somotillo, comarca palo grande el señor Máximo Leonel J. C., ha dedicado la mayor parte de su vida al desarrollo de actividades agropecuarias las que desarrolla en el trayecto del día todos los días de la semana, y cuyas jornadas comprende un promedio de 6 horas diarias, el señor Máximo J. tiene dos hijos los que también contribuyen a los que haceres diarios, dentro de los principales rubros que desarrolla están las siembra de maíz, ajonjolí, sorgo y la crianza de ganado bobino, porcino, aviar y en menor escala la crianza de peses de forma artesanal todas estas actividades son las que le permiten obtener sus ingresos para el sostén de su familia, el señor Máximo J. ha tenido 4 créditos con los cuales ha comprado la mayoría de su ganado sin embargo quiere seguir aumentado su hato ganadero ya que ha considerado que es un rubro muy prometedor para su bienestar familiar.
texts.en:
Mr. Máximo Leonel J. C. has dedicated most of his life to developing his agricultural business in the locality of Somotillo, in the Palo Grande region. He works every day of the week for an average of six hours a day. Mr. Máximo J. has two children who help out with the daily duties. Some of the work they perform include planting corn, sesame, sorghum; raising cattle and pigs; and on a smaller scale raising fish. These activities allow him to earn the income necessary to support his family. Mr. Máximo J. has previously been granted four loans that he has used to purchase most of his cattle. He would like to purchase more cattle as it’s proven to be a profitable business for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Siham

texts.en:
Siham is a 58-year-old widow woman with two children, one of whom is still dependant. She has 25 years of tailoring experience. After the death of her husband, she started running a tailoring business from her home to raise her family with the support of her older employed child. The loss of her husband was hard for her; she has taken on all the responsibilities after his passing. She produces all types of clothing according to the customers' requests and she repairs torn clothes. 

Today, Siham is asking to borrow $1,000 to purchase a new sewing machine and improve her business productivity. She’s certain that the loan will be very helpful for her work.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn M. comes from a family who does fishing and fish-selling as a business. She is a widow who faces the challenge of giving her only child a better life, alone at her young age (35 years old). Adrian, her son and her life, is now 10 years old and is in elementary school. Because of him and the support of her family members, Rosalyn is inspired to work hard for her small fish-selling business to make it grow and become stable. Profits from this business will support her ambition of allowing her son to pursue his education until he graduates from college.  

Presently, Rosalyn is requesting a loan which will be used to purchase materials to repair her family’s fishing boat. In her family’s fishing business she will be given a share which will enable her to increase her revenue and have savings for the future of her only child.

loans.use: To purchase materials to repair a fishing boat.

loans.name: Jennifer's Group

texts.en:
Jennifer L., from the village of Bocator Tangub City, is the 35-year-old leader of a two-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are each responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group member if she is delinquent or defaults.

Jennifer is single. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store selling seafood, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Jennifer has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jennifer joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC, she is now requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her second loan from GDMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: To God Be The Glory Group

texts.en:
Francis T. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called "To God Be The Glory." He is 34 years old, single, and has a 12 year old child. He has an associates degree in electronics.

For 6 years, Francis has been selling building materials, such as nails, hinges, locks, and saws on a table at the Redlight Market in Paynesville, Liberia. He sells goods that customers demand, which keeps customers returning. But he has problems during the rainy season because, when it rains, business can be very hard for him.

Francis started selling with 1,000.00 Liberian Dollars of working capital that he saved from working with a private security firm. He now has about 35,000 Liberian Dollars of working capital. 
 
He plans to use his 10,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 48,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more building materials, such as nails, hinges, locks, and saws, to sell. His goal is to improve his business, open a shop, and build a house for his family.

He describes himself as a quick forgiver and a fast reactor.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Francis is holding the sign.

loans.use: To buy more building materials to sell

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida T. is from the village of Brgy.Tucal, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 55 years old. Aida is widowed and has four adult children. 

To make a living, Aida owns a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops, with her income primarily generated by planting and harvesting rice for sale. Aida has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 40,000 PHP during the harvest season.

In 2010, Aida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aida is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase her crop yield. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Aida from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for services to increase her crop yield

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Monsieur Adama Niaré un homme marié de 28 ans et père de 2 enfants.  Il vit avec sa femme  et ses enfants dans le quartier Dialanicoro de Bougouni.
Après l’école coranique, Monsieur Adama Niaré se lance dans les activités génératrices de revenus. Il a fait la commercialisation des céréales pendant 4 ans au marché de Bougouni et dans les villages environnants les jours de foires hebdomadaires. Cette activité ne lui a pas porté fruit, c’est ainsi qu’il décida de commencer l’achat et la vente des condiments alimentaires au grand marché de Bougouni.
Avec 6 années d’expérience, Monsieur Adama Niaré maitrise son activité qu’il a appris auprès de sa sœur.
Afin de renforcer son activité, il décide de collaborer  avec Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter, une grande quantité de condiments alimentaires.
Il s’approvisionne à Bougouni et à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali). La majorité de ses clients sont les femmes.
Avec ce prêt, Adama compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 37 500 FCFA.
Il  ambitionne de construire une maison à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
Mr. Adama Niaré is a married man who is 28 years old and father to two children. He lives with his wife and children in the Dialanicoro district of Bougouni. After attending Koranic school, Mr. Niaré started up his income generating activities. He sold cereals for four years at the market in Bougouni and in surrounding villages on weekly fair days. However, this activity did not bear any fruit and he thus decided to buy and sell condiments at the large market in Bougouni. With six years of experience, Mr. Niaré now masters this activity which he learned from his sister. In order to strengthen his business he decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso in order to buy a large quantity of condiments. He gets his supplies at Bougouni and in Bamako (the capital of the Republic of Mali). The majority of his customers are women. With this loan, Adama is expecting to make a monthly profit of 37,500FCFA a month. His ambition is to build a house to live in.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of condiments

loans.name: Almend

texts.en:
Almend C. is from the village of Guinabot. She is 36 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. Almend owns and operates a food market, selling foods and delicacies in the local community. Almend has been engaged in her business for 7 years and earns a monthly net income of 6,000 PHP.

In 2005, Almend joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Almend has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used as additional capital for the business. Almend is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used for the expansion of the business. This will be the 8th loan taken out by Almend from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Expansion of the business

loans.name: Las Flores Group

texts.es:
el grupo Las Flores son mujeres que se dedican al comercio, cada una de ellas posee su propio negocio, son mujeres que se conocen muy bien entre ellas mismas ya que residen en la misma comunidad.
a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan diariamente:

la sra. Alejandrina Maria D. se dedica al comercio y su actividad principal es la venta de abarrotería, su negocio opera bajo el nombre de Pulpería “DINORA” 
Doña alejandrina tiene varios años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, y es notable que durante este tiempo lo a sabido administrar, con los ingresos que le genera su negocio le ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y de sus hijos.

El esposo de la Sra. Díaz se dedica a la agricultura ya que este es uno de los oficios más productivos en toda la zona de El Coyolar Jutiapa.        
El negocio de Doña María luce bien surtido en la comunidad del Coyolar ya que dentro del mismo se encuentra lo más necesario para el consumo diario como ser: Azúcar, arroz, manteca, jabón, café, salsa, espaguetis, carnes, embutidos, queso, mantequilla, etc.

la sra. Marta Facunda M. tiene varios años de dedicarse al negocio, su actividad principal es una pequeña pulpería, misma que opera bajo el nombre de Pulpería “M.”
Doña Marta nos comento que inicio con poco producto en su negocio, pero cada vez a logrado hacerlo mas grande, las ganancias la invierte de nuevo en su negocio y de esta forma a hecho que sea mas grande cada vez.

  En su negocio se encuentra lo más necesario para el consumo diario como ser: Azúcar, Jabón, manteca, arroz, café, espaguetis, salsa, papel higiénico, pollo, carnes, embutidos etc.
Su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación y con las ganancias que recibe a sacado adelante a sus 2 hijos.
Su compañero de hogar el Sr. Marco Ruiz se dedica al destazo de Res y a la agricultura. el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia al por mayor y asi surtir mas su pulperia.


la sra. Mariana del Carmen M. D. tiene 2 años de haber iniciado con su negocio de elaboración y venta de tortillas de Maíz, negocio en el cual le va muy bien.
Doña Mariana tiene contrato diario de lunes a viernes de por lo menos L. 180.00 de tortillas con la dueña de la caseta del Instituto Polivalente de la aldea de Jutiapa, mas lo que vende dentro de la comunidad donde ella reside y esto equivale por lo menos 5 medidas de maíz molidas diariamente.
Doña Mariana nos comento que por las cantidades de que muele, un saco de maíz solo le dura de 8 a 10 días y con las ganancias que percibe de su tortillera a colaborado con su compañero de hogar a la manutención y estudio de sus 2 hijos. El Sr. Donaldo Rodríguez es su compañero de hogar y se dedica a la agricultura.
texts.en:
The group "Las Flores" ["The Flowers"] is made up of women who work in trade. They all have their own businesses, and they are women who know each other very well, since they live in the same community. The following sections describe the various activities they carry out each day: Alejandrina Maria D. works in trade, and her main activity is selling groceries. Her business operates under the name "Pulpería DINORA" ["Dinora General Store"]. Alejandrina has worked in this business for several years, and her excellent management during this time has been noteworthy. With the income from her business, she helps her husband with the expenses of their household and children. Mrs. Díaz' husband works in agriculture, since it is one of the most productive areas of all of the zone of El Coyolar Jutiapa. Her business is one of the best-stocked in the community of Coyolar, containing all of the basic necessities for daily life, such as sugar, rice, shortening, soap, coffee, sauces, spaghetti, meat, sausages, cheese, butter, etc. Marta Facunda M. has worked in her business for several years. Her main activity is a small general store, which operates under the name of "Pulpería M..” Marta tells us that she began with just a few products in her store, but she has gradually been able to expand it. She has invested her earnings back into her business, and in this way she has been able to make it bigger and bigger. Her business include the most necessary items for daily consumption, such as sugar, soap, shortening, rice, coffee, spaghetti, sauces, toilet paper, chicken, meat, sausages, etc. Her store is located in the house where she lives, and with the profits she receives, she has helped her 2 children get ahead. Her live-in partner, Marco Ruiz, is a beef butcher and farmer. She will use the loan to buy more merchandise on a wholesale basis and thus expand her store's inventory. Mariana del Carmen M. D. started her business two years ago. She works preparing and selling corn tortillas, a business that is going very well for her. Mariana has a daily contract, from Monday through Friday, for at least L.180.00 worth of tortillas from the owner of the food stand at the Multipurpose Institute in the municipality of Jutiapa, plus what she sells within the community where she lives. This represents at least 5 measures of ground corn each day. Mariana tells us that because of the quantities she grinds, a sack of corn only lasts her 8 to 10 days. With the earnings from her tortilla business, she has worked together with her life partner Donaldo Rodríguez, a farmer, to pay their household expenses and educate their 2 children.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying products such as sugar, rice, shortening, soap, coffee, sauces, spaghetti, meat, sausage, cheese, butter, firewood, corn, lime, water and matches

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Maria Isabel es una mujer comerciante dedicada al trabajo, durantes años lleva vendiendo tortillas, cosa de horno también vende carne de cerdo, logrando tener mejor ingreso, ya que cuentan con pocos recursos económicos, y la canasta básica esta cara.
Su esposo es jardinero y junto han hecho su pequeña casa de bloques y madera, su cocina aun no tiene solo un techo donde palmea sus ricas tortillas, que espera en un futuro poder construir para una mejor higiene.
Con este préstamo comprara materia prima para seguir aumentando la producción en venta de tortilla y cosa de horno. Comprara. Maíz, azúcar, dulce, cal, leña, manteca  logrando así su objetivo.
texts.en:
Maria Isabel is a business woman dedicated to working. She has been selling tortillas, baked goods and pork for several years which has allowed her to have a better income since she has few economic resources and her basic needs are expensive. Her husband is a gardener and together they have built their small home of blocks and wood. Her kitchen, where she makes her delicious tortillas, does not yet have a roof. She hopes to be able to build a roof in the future for better hygiene. With this loan she will buy supplies so that she can increase her production and sale of tortillas and baked goods. She will buy corn, sugar, sweets, lime, wood and lard to achieve her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn, sugar, sweets, lime, wood and lard to increase her production and sale of tortillas and baked goods.

loans.name: Preung

texts.en:
Preung S., 36, is a professional silk weaver. She makes $2 USD each day. She lives and works in the Takeo Province. She is married and has four children to support who live at home. Her husband, Thouk Nov, makes approximately $2.50 USD every day, working in construction.

Preung S. would like a loan of $1,000 USD to purchase more silk.

loans.use: To purchase more silk.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline I. is from the village of Calaran Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old and single. To make a living, Evangeline owns and operates a business providing motorcycle services in the local community. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Evangeline joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to expand the services provided. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide her service. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Evangeline from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Mrs. Srun Koem Lieng Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of nine people, located in Chroung Sdau village in Takeo province. Mrs. Srun K. L., who was born in 1951, is the village bank president, selected by the other members. They will use their portion of the loan in different ways to improve their family's standard of living. 

Mrs. Srun K. L. is a farmer who owns a one-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. She has a problem because her field has infertile soil. So, to improve production, she is using her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and to hire a machine to plow her field. 

She is a widow and the mother of a child who is married.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica A. is from the village of Bal-ason, Gingoog City. She is 48 years old. Veronica is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Veronica runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Veronica has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Veronica joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Veronica is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Veronica from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es: La señora Reina tiene 46 años es madre soltera con  2 hijos menores de edad que está a su cargo. Ella se dedica a una pulpería en su casa de habitación, Allí vende desde granos básicos hasta golosinas para llamar la atención de los clientes que habitan cerca. Esta no es la primera vez que tiene financiamientos para su negocio. Ella ya tiene 4 años de dedicarse a este negocio, empezó vendiendo solamente golosinas, y con el aporte de su esposo más la reinversión realizada al negocio ha podido ir prosperando para tener un negocio más grande. Este crédito será invertido en la compra de granos básicos tal como arroz, fríjol, azúcar y aceite principalmente. Su sueño es llegar a ver su negocio con más productos, más surtido con productos que demanda la población, para brindar más facilidades económicas a sus hijos y que puedan prepararse en la universidad.
texts.en: Reina is 46 years old. She is a single mother with 2 children who are not yet grown and still in her care. Her business is a general store in her home. There, she sells products ranging from staple foods to snacks, attracting customers who live nearby. This is not the first time that she has had financing for her business. She has operated this business for 4 years; she started by selling only snacks, and with help from her husband in addition to reinvestment in the business, she has been able to continue to prosper and create a larger business. This loan will be invested in buying staple foods, chiefly rice, beans, sugar and cooking oil. Her dream is to see her business stocked with a greater number and variety of products that are in demand among the population, so that she can provide more economic benefits to her children and they can receive a college education.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha C. A.  tiene 38 años. Es casada vive con el esposo y los hijos, vive  en el cantón de Guaranda en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 7 hijos.

Martha pertenece a la Ventanilla Casaiche Chilipamba ubicada a media hora de Guaranda perteneciente, es un grupo que se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería como vacas lecheras y chanchos, esta ventanilla tiene 20 miembros.

Martha se dedica a la agricultura de maíz, trigo fréjol y papa y a la ganadería cría vacas lecheras, las comprar las realiza en Guaranda y vende en el mercado mayorista de la  misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para la siembra maíz, trigo fréjol y papa y animales para engordar y después vender. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades de la familia. Su sueño es ponerse comprar casa.
Le gusta cocinar y jugar con lo hijos pequeños.
texts.en:
Martha C. A. is 38 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and children.  She lives in Guaranda canton, in Bolívar province.  She has 7 children.

Martha belongs to the Casaiche Chilipamba solidarity group which is located half an hour from Guaranda.  It is a group that works in agriculture and farming livestock such as dairy cows and pigs.  The group has 20 members.

Martha grows corn, wheat, beans and potato and also raises dairy cows.  He makes his purchases in Guaranda and sells in the wholesale market in the same town.

She is requesting a loan to buy supplies for sowing corn, wheat, beans and potatoes and also animals to fatten and then sell.  The support from the loan will help her to fulfil her family's financial needs.  Her dream is to be able to buy a house.

She likes to cook and play with her small children.

loans.use: To buy supplies for sowing corn, wheat, beans and potatoes.  To buy animals to fatten and then sell

loans.name: Aime Gilbert

texts.fr:
Client de 41 ans ayant bénéficié d'un premier prêt il y a de cela quatre ans, faisant preuve d'un bon remboursement et d'une irrégularité dans les épargnes , il n'a pas connu des difficultés durant tout le long de l'exercice de son activité.
Avec le second prêt , il veut élargir en achetant des polos, survêtements,blousons en Jeans, débardeur, gilets et tous ce dont les clients ont besoin.
Tres motive par son business, il a fait usage de beaucoup de stratégie, en vendant en crédit des tenues de cérémonie aux jeunes et dans les administrations.
texts.en: Mr Aime Gilbert S. is 41 years old and benefitted previously from a loan four years ago, which he reimbursed successfully and without difficulties in meeting deadlines. He is asking for a second loan in order to purchase greater quantities of polo shirts, tracksuits, jackets, jeans, t-shirts, vests and other articles of clothing depending on his customer's requests. He is very motivated by his business and has really thought through several business strategies including selling ceremonial outfits for credit to both young persons as well as in large organizations/administrations.

loans.use: Purchasing clothing for men: pants, t-shirts, button down shirts, jeans, suits, vests

loans.name: Savzali

texts.ru: Амонов Савзали проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 68 лет. Женат. Имеет 5 детей. Образование среднее. Более 12 лет занимается торговлей. Арендует торговую точку на рынке "Саховат". Он в основном продает овощи. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Savzali A. lives in Kulob and is 68 years old, married with five children. He has a secondary education and more than 12 years in sales. He rents a stall in the market "Sahovat" where he sells mostly vegetables. He is asking for a loan to increase his sales.

loans.use: Increase sales

loans.name: Djamila

texts.en:
Djamila is 43 years old, married, and has six children. Currently, six of her children attend school. Her husband is a businessman. Djamila owns a restaurant, which she has done for 13 years.  

Djamila will use this loan to purchase more utensils and foodstuffs for her restaurant. With the new profits from her expanded business, Djamila plans to build a house. She hopes to have a booming business in the future where she can cover all her basic necessities.

loans.use: To buy more utensils and foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Nilda, de 43 años, está casada con Samuel, de 47 años. Ambos tienen 5 hijos, pero solo vive con 4 de ellos en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Cumutay. Está luchadora mujer se dedica a la agricultura, que junto a su hijo Wilder, se dirigen todas las mañanas a sus cultivos de arveja, papa y maíz; donde trabajan arduamente desde al amanecer hasta el anochecer.  Lo que más le gusta a Nilda, es cuidar de sus animales como vacas, toros, cerdos y corderos. Ya tiene 20 años dedicándose a ello, y afirma que a pesar de los inconvenientes que se suscitan constantemente, como en temporadas de lluvia, cuando aparece la enfermedad de “la rancha”, malogrando los sembríos. Ella tiene mucha fe y ganas de trabajar, ya que el campo “es su vida”, ahí nació y creció. Por ello más adelante desea construir una casa más segura donde pueda vivir y poner un negocio propio.  Es el octavo crédito con MFP, y como socia antigua de su banco comunal, se siente agradecida por todo el apoyo que recibe de parte de ellos. 
De obtener el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de varios sacos de abono, los cuales esparcirá en sus cultivos de papa.
texts.en:
Nida is 43 years old. She is married to Samuel, 47 years old. Together they have 5 children, but they only live with 4 of them in their own home located in the rural town of Cumutay. This hard-working woman works in agriculture. Together with her son, Wilder, she heads to work every morning to her fields of beans, potatoes and rice where they work hard from dawn until dusk. What Nilda enjoys most is the care of her animals such as cows, bulls, pigs and sheep. She has already worked 20 years in this and upholds it despite the inconveniences that they are constantly experiencing such as rainy seasons, outbreaks of the “la rancha” sickness, and spoiling the seeds. She has a lot of faith and desire to work, since the country “is her life,” where she was born and grew up. In the future, she wants to build a more secure house where she can live and have her own business. This is her eighth loan with MFP, and as a longtime member of her communal bank, she is thankful for all the support that she receives from then.

Once she obtains the loan that she requested, she will invest it in the purchase of various bags of fertilizer, which she will use on her potato crops.

loans.use: To purchase several bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Abdullojon

texts.en:
Abdullojon is married with three children. He owns a small business that sells foodstuffs in bulk. His business is located at the market and many retail vendors get their goods from Abdullojon. Low prices and good customer service help him to keep repeat customers. Abdullojon has been in this business for 5 years. This is the only income for this family. 

Abdullojon would like to borrow 1500 USD to increase his assortment. Abdullojon is a talented entrepreneur and wants to develop his business even further. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing more foodstuffs to expand his range of goods

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita P. is from Maquilao, Tangub City. She is 45 years old, married and has 3 adult-aged children. Esterlita owns and operates a business providing motor transportation services. Esterlita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Esterlita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esterlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Esterlita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This will be the third loan taken out by Esterlita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair a vehicle for better service

loans.name: Arni

texts.en: Arni A. is from the town of Banga. She is 46 years old. Arni is married and has five children. Her eldest child is 17 years old, while the youngest is only 5 years old. To make a living Arni owns and operates a business in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Arni joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arni has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Arni is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her family. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009 CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but, additionally, savings, insurance, and training, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fertilizers

loans.name: Ana Lidia

texts.es: La Sra. Ana Lidia P. ella es trabajadora por cuenta propia en el negocio de Venta de Granos Básicos  su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación tiene quince  años  de dedicarse a esta actividad es casada actualmente, tiene un  hijos en edad escolar. Ha tenido  once créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado Para la Compra de productos varios como Arroz, Frijoles, Gaseosa, Golosinas, etc. y así   invertirle a su negocio para ampliarlo y mejorar la condición de  su negocio, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en: Ana Lidia P. is self-employed selling basic grains. Her business, which she has had for fifteen years, is run out of her house. She is married and has a school-aged son. She has had eleven loans with CEPRODEL and each one has been used to purchase products for her store such as rice, beans, sodas, sweets, etc., investing in her business in order to improve it and see it grow. These loans with CEPRODEL have been of great benefit to her since in this way she has improved the quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: Purchase products for her store, such as rice, beans, soda, etc.

loans.name: Silvia Maribel

texts.es:
la Sra. Silvia Maribel M. tiene 26 años de edad, vive en el Barrio el Reparto por Bajo y se dedica a la venta de desayunos, almuerzos y golosinas, su negocio opera bajo el nombre de Comedor “LAS GEMELAS”, el cual esta ubicado en el MERCADO SAN PABLO de la ciudad capital, su comedor lo abre desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde todos los dias, primero comienza con el aseo y luego con la preparacion de las comidas.

el credito lo utilizara para la compra de una estufa industrial para hacer mas rapido sus comidas y en mayor cantidad, esto le vendra a facilitar su trabajo y despachar mas rapido a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Silvia Maribel M., age 26, lives in the Reparto por Bajo neighborhood.  She sells breakfast, lunch, and sweets.  Her business, an eatery, is called “Las Gemelas” (The Twins).  The business is located in the San Pablo Market in the capital city.

Her business is open every day from seven in the morning until five in the afternoon.  First she starts cleaning, and then she makes the food.

She will use the loan to buy an industrial stove.  She will do this to make the food quicker and in greater quantities.  This will help her in her work, and she will serve her customers more quickly.

loans.use: to buy an industrial stove

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es:
La Señora. María S. es socia del banco comunal Eugenio Espejo, vive por el sector de Sayausi en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad fue nombrada en 1999  patrimonio cultural de la humanidad por su centro histórico, los 4 ríos que la bañan hacen de esta una bella ciudad.

Doña María tiene 38 años, vive en unión libre y tiene 5 hijos de 18, 15, 8 (gemelos) años  y un bebé de 9 meses de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en un colegio a distancia y trabajan, sus dos hijos gemelos estudian en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como albañil, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

La Señora. María labora arreglando casas, esta actividad la realiza desde que tenía 13 años de edad. Hace un año en sus tiempos libres se dedica a la venta de productos Yanbal.

Es socia del banco comunal hace un año y los créditos le han beneficiado para iniciar  su negocio, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y más productos Yanbal.
  
Su sueño es tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Mrs. María S. is a member of the Eugenio Espejo communal bank.  She lives in the Sayausi sector in the city of Cuenca.  This city was named a World Heritage site in 1999 because of its historic center.  The four rivers that flow through it make it a beautiful city.

Doña María is 38 years old and has a common-law husband and five children ages 18, 15, 8 (twins) and a baby 9 months old.  Her two eldest study in a distance-learning program and work.  The twins study at the local school.  Her husband works as a bricklayer and they rent the property they live in.

María has worked as a housecleaner since she was 13 years old.  For a year now she has been selling Yanbal products in her free time.

She has been a member of the communal bank for a year and the loans she has received helped her set up her business.  She plans to use the new loan to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and more Yanbal products.

Her dream is to have her own home.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, costume jewelry, etc.

loans.name: Assitan Cheick

texts.fr:
Madame ASSITAN CHEICK D. est âgée de 26 ans,  célibataire et mère de 1 enfant. Elle vit dans une famille nucléaire  avec  sa mère et ses frères  au quartier Missira de Ségou  (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ayant abandonnée l’école en classe de 9ème année fondamentale (système éducatif Malien), elle commença à faire le commerce de draps de lits auprès de sa mère. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage à ses cotés, elle évolue seule, en menant la même activité et cela depuis maintenant 5 ans et jouit d’une grande clientèle. 
Dans  le but d’augmenter son fonds de commerce afin de faire face à la demande clientèle, elle a fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est  à son 1er    prêt individuel et compte l’utiliser pour acheter 2 rouleaux de draps. Elle s’approvisionne à Bobo au Burkina Faso. 
Madame  ASSITAN CHEICK D.  vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée  de femmes majoritairement. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000 FCFA, qui lui servira à rembourser son prêt et à   se prendre soi même  en charge (achat de vêtements et de cosmétiques). 
Son ambition est de donner plus d’élan à son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. ASSITAN CHEICK D., age 26, is single and the mother of one child. She lives in a nuclear family with her mother and brothers in Missira, a neighborhood in Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Having dropped out of school after the ninth year, she started selling bed sheets with her mother and spent several years training beside her. She's now been working on her own for five years, and has acquired a large clientele.

In order to bolster her working capital and meet customer demand, she turned to Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso. She's seeking her first personal loan, and intends to use it to buy two rolls of bed sheets. She gets her supplies in Bobo in Burkina Faso.

Mrs. ASSITAN CHEICK D. sells for cash and on credit, to a clientele comprising mostly women. She intends to turn a monthly profit of XOF 50'000 (cas US$ 110), to be used to repay the loan and provide for herself (clothing and cosmetics). She ambitions to bolster her business.

loans.use: to buy two rolls of bed sheets

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is a young man from Jabalia refugee camp. Muhammad is a father of one son. Muhammad's house is a very small one that has only one bedroom, a kitchen and a sitting room. Muhammad started building an extension in the backyard of his house.

Muhammad, who appears in the picture here, needs $1,500 from FATEN to cover the rest of the construction expenses so as to have a room that his son would use.

loans.use: to enlarge their house by adding a new room.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: El señor Alejandro trabaja como profesor de computación. El crédito lo requiere para cubrir los gastos médicos para curar la rodilla que se lastimó. Vive en alquiler la misma esta ubicada en la zona de Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz. Alejandro es separado y  tiene cuatro hijos. Esta es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito a través de Kiva.
texts.en: Alejandro is an informatics teacher. He needs the loan to pay for medical attention he needs for his injured knee. He rents a house located in the region of Alto San Pedro in the city of La Paz. Alejandro is separated and he has four children. This is the second time he has had a loan through Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for medical attention he needs for his knee.

loans.name: Hotencia De Calidade

texts.pt:
Hortencia de calidade nasceu no Distrito de Buzi, Provincia de Sofala, centro de Moçambique, casada e maê de 2 filhos de 1 e  4 anos idade. Fez 11ª classe parou quando foi fazer o curso de enfermagem. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta sua sobrinha que vive com ela, as vezes manda algum dinheiro para os pais em Sofala. 

Saiu de Sofala Para Maputo quando o seu marido foi transferido pela instituição onde trabalha. Trabalha como enfermeira e quadro do Ministerio da Saude ha mais de 2 anos e tem como salario6.778.00mt por mês. Este valor aplica nas despasas de casa, construção da sua residencia e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.

Teve emprestimos em outros bancos e pagou sem dificuldades, conheceu a Hluvuku atraves de colegas  que tambem são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 18.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (aros de porta, cimento, barrotes, chapas de zinco e outros) para continuar com a construção da sua casa. 

Compromete-se a pagar devidamente para aceder a outros créditos no futuro. Pretende solicitar novos  empréstimos para concluir a sua casa e mobilar para oferecer mais conforto a sua familia.
texts.en:
Hortencia de Calidade was born in Buzi District, Sofala Province in central Mozambique. She is married and has 2 children, ages 1 and 4. Hortencia finished 11th grade and stopped school when she started training to be a nurse. She lives in her own house with her family and supports her niece, who lives with her. Sometimes she sends some money to her parents in Sofala. 

She left Sofala to move to Maputo when her husband was transferred by the institution he works for. Hortencia works as a nurse and has been on staff at the Ministry of Health for more than two years. Her salary is 6,778 meticais per month. She uses the money for household expenses and construction on her house, and she also saves some in her bank account.

Hortencia has had loans from other banks, and she paid them off without any problems. She learned about Hluvuku through coworkers who are also customers of this institution. This is her first loan with Hluvuku, and she is asking for 18,000 meticais to buy construction materials (door frames, cement, beams, zinc sheets and other items) to continue work on her house.

She promises to pay off the loan promptly so she can have other loans in the future. She intends to ask for more loans to finish her house and furnish it so she can make her family more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (door frames, cement, beams, zinc sheets, etc.)

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia, a 38-year-old married mother of four children, works hard to provide for her family. She has been operating a sari sari store for two years in the Philippines and also earns an income from food vending. Having received and repaid five previous loans from NWTF, she is now requesting a PHP 13,000 loan to buy items to sell such as milk, groceries, etc. in her sari sari store.

Nelia aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en:
Immaculee, 42 years old, is married and has two children, 2 and 20 years old. She also takes care of five children. Immaculee sells vegetables such as eggplant, tomatoes and onions. Her business is well-organized and operates from 7 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day. Immaculee has 6 years of experience.

Immaculee has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more vegetables. With this profit, she will reinvest in her business and will be able to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables

loans.name: Carla Vanessa

texts.es: La Señora Carla Vanessa de 23 años, reside en el municipio de la Paz pues su  hijo vive con ella. Ella es una mujer llena de metas y con mucho entusiasmo de salir adelante. Carla tiene su negocio que es el destace de cerdos ubicado en su vivienda,  ya que ella se destaca por ofrecer una buena calidad en sus productos y por ser amable con su clientela. Es por eso que le solicita un crédito que le permita comprar más cerdos. ella tiene gran esperanza en que esto le permitirá mejorar la economía de su hogar y así aspirar a una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Carla Vanessa, 23, lives in the town of La Paz; her son lives with her.  She is a woman who is full of goals and lots of enthusiasm to get ahead.  She has a pig butchering business located in her home.  She stands out because she offers high quality products and for being very kind to her clientele.  Because of this she's asking for a loan to buy more pigs.  Her great hope is that this will make it possible for her to improve her home's economy and thus be able to aspire to better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more pigs.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Cidade de Matola, provincia de Maputo, ao sul de Mocambique casado e pai de 6 filhos de idades entre 9 a 19 anos de idade.Fez a 6ª classe e parou quando perdeu o seu filho porque ficou sem forças de voltar a estudar. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta mais 2 netos e sua mãe que vivem com ele.
Saiu da Matola para Boane com seus pais ainda pequeno,quando o seu pai recebeu a sua reforma nos CFM (caminhos de Ferro de Moçambique), tendo mais tarde afixado la a sua residencia. Trabalha como agente de serviço no Instituto Agrario de Boane a 23 anos e tem um rendimento mensal de 5.500.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM), conta com ajuda da sua esposa que é negociante.
Nunca fez emprestimo noutros bancos. Conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de conversas com colegas que tambem são clientes, e este é o seu sexto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material para sua obra (construçao de uma casa, ou seja, moradia) (prancha, ferro, areia, cimento, chapas, pedra, e outros). Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 5.200.00mt, 7.800.00mt, 10.000.00mt, 10.000.00mt,e  15.000.00mt. 
 Pretende concluir a sua obra e construir uma papelaria para ajudar a sua esposa no negocio e para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Jorge was born in Matola City, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. He is married and has six children between the ages of 9 and 19. Jorge finished sixth grade and stopped school when he lost his son because he no longer had the will to return to his studies. He lives in his own house with his family and also supports two grandchildren and his mother, who live with him.

When he was young, Jorge left Matola to move to Boane with his parents when his father retired from CFM (Mozambique Railways), and later he made his home there. He has worked as a agent for Boane's Agrarian Institute for 23 years and has a monthly income of 5,500 meticais. He uses the money for household expenses and saves some in his bank account (at BIM). He also relies on the help of his wife, who is a businesswoman.

Jorge has never had loans from other banks. He learned about Hluvuku by talking with coworkers who are also customers, and this is his sixth loan from Hluvuku. He is asking for 15,000 meticais, which he will use to buy construction materials (boards, iron, sand, cement, zinc sheets, stone and other items) for his housing project. The earlier loans were for 5,200 meticais, 7,800 meticais, 10,000 meticais, 10,000 meticais, and 15,000 meticais.

He intends to finish building and to build a stationery store to help his wife with her business, and to do this he plans to ask Hluvuku for more loans.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (boards, iron, sand, cement, zinc sheets, stone, etc.).

loans.name: Carmen Lucciola

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Mi Banquito.

La señora Carmen es socia fundadora del banco comunal y le gusta la ayuda que siempre le dan con los créditos. Tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos, uno de ellos ya es mayor de edad y dos de 16 y 4 años, uno  estudia en, colegio. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar realiza el crédito para que él pueda financiar su negocio, él se dedica a la venta de granos como por ejemplo frejol, lentejas, maní, entre otros, trabaja cuatro días a la semana en el mercado de Manta, lleva 15 años que se dedica a esta actividad  y gracias a Dios esto le ha dado para salir adelante.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar lenteja, frejol, maní, maíz, entre otros.
 
Sus sueños son tener buena salud y seguir adelante.
texts.en:
In Los Bajos de Montecristi, a town known for its great diversity of typical products, such as the straw hats that are well-known in and outside the country, the communal bank “Mi Banquito” meets every two weeks.

Carmen is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes the help it gives her with the loans. She is 46 years old and married and has three children. One of them is grown and the other two are 16 and 4 years old. One studies in high school. Her husband works in sales.

She is a very good homemaker. To help her husband with the household expenses, she requests the loan so he can finance his business. He sells grains, such as beans, lentils, and peanuts, among other things. He works four days per week in the market in Manta. He has been in this business for 15 years and thanks to God, things have gone well so that he has been able to get ahead.

She will use this loan to buy lentils, beans, peanuts, and corn, among other things. 

Her dreams are to have good health and keep working.

loans.use: to buy lentils, beans, peanuts, corn, etc.

loans.name: Elvis

texts.en:
This is Elvis, 36, a resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. He is married to Irene, his business partner and mother to his three children. Elvis, together with his wife, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Elvis operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails in groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Elvis earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from the store, he is also involved in direct selling. He sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands. A customer’s order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. His store is located adjacent to his house. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP1400 in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP50,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Elvis dreams to be able to give his children a good and high quality education through all his hard work on his business. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in his business.

loans.name: Aliaskar

texts.ru: Aliaskar jivet v Baku regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. On ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. Aliaskar 24 qoda. On uje 3 qoda kak zanimayetsya selskim xozaystvom i virashivayet cveti dlya prodaji. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit kulenku i balki dlya togo chtobi sdelat parnik, tak kak nastupayut xoloda.
texts.en: Aliaskar lives in the Baku Region together with his relatives. He is single, without children. Aliaskar is 24 years old. For three years, he has been working in agriculture, growing flowers for sale. At present he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy beams and poly film for building a greenhouse as the cold season of the year is about to begin.

loans.use: to buy beams and poly film for  a greenhouse

loans.name: Gocha

texts.en:
Gocha is from the village Geguti in West Georgia.  He is 44 years old, married, and lives with his wife Guranda, 16 year old daughter, 12 year old son, and his mother-in-law (retired).  Both children go to school. 

The family earns a living through agricultural activities.  In particular, they have two greenhouses.  In the period of October through May, greens are grown.  In the months of June through September the greenhouses are used for growing cucumber.  Gocha sells harvested greens to the wholesale exporters, who export greens to the Ukraine.  He sells harvested cucumbers himself at a local open market.  Guranda, his wife, is also actively involved in the family agriculture business.  The total average monthly income of the family is 900 Laris, including the pension of Gocha’s mother-in-law. 

Gocha requested credit for purchasing fertilizers.  After fertilizing the land in the greenhouses, he will get a better quality harvest and be able to sell it for a good price.  It will positively affect the family income and consequently their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilzers for the greenhouses.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is 34 years old, married, and lives in the Philippines. Susan has a shop that sells vegetables, spices and food seasonings. She has had this business for 10 years. Susan requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy spices, food seasonings and vegetables to sell. Susan has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Susan hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy spices, food seasonings and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is aged 59 and has been in farming for 9 years. She is married, with four adult children.  For the past 4 years, she has been producing milk, maize, and eggs for the local market.

Rosalia has requested for a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase more poultry birds for her business. This is her fourth loan request with Juhudi Kilimo and she says it will help improve her farming income and allow her to enjoy economies of scale. She says her focus is to repay the loan like the previous ones.

She says the greatest challenges are animal diseases and the high cost of feed.

loans.use: To purchase poultry birds

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: El señor Daniel es productor lechero y además es promotor veterinario, su esposa lo ayuda con las actividades agrícolas. Con el dinero del crédito comprará un par de vacas lecheras para mejorar su producción de leche y sus ingresos. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Achacachi  del departamento de La Paz; es casado y tiene cuatro  hijos. Es la primera vez que el cliente solicita un crédito;  el análisis financiero indica que es sujeto de crédito y el análisis social indica que merece una tasa preferencial de interés, por lo que se canaliza a través de Kiva.
texts.en: Daniel is a dairy farmer and also a veterinary salesman.  His wife helps him with the farming chores.  With the money from the loan he will buy a pair of dairy cows to increase milk production and his income.  He lives in a house of his own located in Achacachi, La Paz Department.  He’s married and has four children.  This is the first time the client has requested a loan.  The financial analysis indicates that he’s credit worthy and the social analysis indicates that he deserves a preferential interest rate so it will be channeled through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a pair of dairy cows.

loans.name: Zulma Beatriz

texts.es:
La Sra. Zulma es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene 36 años de edad, está casada con el Sr. Dario de 41 años de edad. Juntos tienen 4 Hijos, todos menores de edad, en edad escolar.
Ella tiene una Despensa en su domicilio particular, la cual está bien surtida con todo tipo de productos. Comenta que tiene clientela bien formada, lo cual la ayuda mucho, pues le genera un buen ingreso. Ella se define como una mujer trabajadora, luchadora y por sobre todo muy emprendedora. Ella dice que por medio de este trabajo ella ayuda a su marido con los gastos de la casa y también en la educación de los hijos
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de azúcar, leche, panificados, carne, embutidos, hortalizas y demás, con lo cual podrá abastecer su negocio y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Zulma lives in the city of Santaní.  She’s 36 years old, married to Darío, 41, and they have four children who are all minors and school age.

She has a grocery store at home that’s well-stocked with all sorts of products.  She comments that she has a well-formed clientele which helps her a lot because it generates good income.  She defines herself as a hardworking, tenacious but, above all, very enterprising woman.  She says that through this work she helps her husband meet household expenses and also pay for her children’s education.

She is asking for the loan to buy sugar, milk, baked goods, meat, cured meats, vegetables and others to stock her business and meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Joana

texts.en:
Joana is 28 years old and single.  She lives in Pasay City, Philippines. She manages her household while operating her business so that she can meet her everyday expenses.  

Joana operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the working community and most families eat home-cooked meals during the evenings where all of the family is at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to pay for cooking gas and food for one or two people when buying cooked rice and meat cost less than raw food. 

Joana is also in  direct selling for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns approximately 500 PHP a day.

Joana is requesting a loan for 15,000 PHP, which will help her continue operations of her business. She will be using the loan to buy more quantities of products such as meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, and seasonings. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Joana hopes to finish her degree and find a stable job after finishing college; she also wants to see her business expand. She meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from God.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Olga Lucia

texts.es:
La señora Olga Lucia a sus 45 años de edad y madre de un hijo de 14 años de edad, se vio en la necesidad de tener su propia fuente de ingresos luego de que su esposo la dejó y se separó de ella.  El trabajo de las confecciones lo aprendió de una amiga quien le ensañaba en los tiempos libres de la señora Olga Lucia. El taller de ella está ubicado en su propia casa para poder desde allí cuidar a su hijo, en esta función lleva más de once años.
Actualmente la señora Olga Lucia desea comprar una maquina plana para adquirir una mayor capacidad de producción, conseguir ingresos y a corto plazo ampliar su negocio y continuar brindando a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Olga Lucia is 45 years old and the mother of a 14-year-old child. She saw the need to have her own source of income after her husband left and separated from her. During her free time, Olga learned how to sew from a friend who was willing to teach her. She now has a workshop in her home, which allows her to look after her son. Olga has been in business for more than 11 years.

She currently wants to buy a tabletop sewing machine so that she can increase her production capacity, continue generating income, expand her business in the short term, and continue providing a better quality of life for her son.

loans.use: to buy a tabletop sewing machine and supplies such as needles, rulers, paper, and elastic.

loans.name: Dora Piedad

texts.es: La señora Dora a sus 48 años de edad es madre de tres hijos de 27, 18, y 4 años de edad. La señora Dora lleva más de ocho años prestando en su propio local el servicio de peluquería. La señora Dora es viuda, lo que hace que trabaje arduamente día a día en su salón de belleza para sacar adelante a sus hijos. La señora Dora requiere de hacer adecuaciones locativas al baño de su negocio tal como el arreglo del piso, las paredes y las tuberías.  Con lo anterior, la señora Dora podrá prestar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. El sueño de la señora Dora es agrandar su negocio y que esté posicionado en el sector.
texts.en: Señora Dora is 48 years old and is the mother of 3 children aged 27, 18 and 4 years. Señora Dora has been a hairdresser in her neighbourhood for more than 8 years. Señora Dora is a widow which means that she must work hard every day in her beauty salon to raise her children. Señora Dora needs to make imporvements to her salon's bathroom such as mending the floor, the walls and the pipes. With these improvements, Señora Dora will be able to offer her clients a better service. Señora Dora's dream is to grow her business and be well positioned in the sector.

loans.use: to make improvements to the bathroom.

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en: Clementine is 41 years old and has four children aged 10 to 19. All four children are in school. She sells meat in a shop she has run for 17 years. She would like a loan to buy more cows to sell in her shop. Any profits will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy meat to sell in her butcher shop.

loans.name: Edith

texts.fr: Edith, est mariée et mère de trois enfants tous scolarisés. Elle vit avec eux chez son mari.Elle est reconnue dans la vente des divers dans le plus grand marché de Porto-Novo. Elle maîtrise son activité compte tenu de son expérience dans le secteur. Elle s'approvisionne dans des marchés à cotonou. Compte tenu de son emplacement dans le marché et en vue de satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle, elle sollicite un micro-crédit à Finadev afin d'agrandir son commerce et surtout pour la stabilité de  sa famille.
texts.en: Edith is married and is the mother 3 children who all go to school. She lives with them in her husband's house. She is known for selling miscellaneous items in the biggest market in Porto-Novo. Given her experience, she handles this occupation really well. She buys her merchandise from various markets in Cotonou. Given her location within the market, and in order to meet the needs of her customers, she is requesting a loan from Finadev so that she may expand her business and, above all, provide stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy several cans of sardine, milk, and canned tomatoes

loans.name: Sindy Julieth

texts.es: Sindy Julieth es una joven de 20 años que recibió el negocio de abarrotes de la tradición familiar. Sus abuelos empezaron con el negocio vendiendo abarrotes básicos como el mercado; a medida que ha ido creciendo el negocio se ha ido surtiendo poco a poco, y ahora que Sindy Julieth lo tiene a su cargo lo quiere diversificar aún mas vendiendo licor, snack y dulcería. Sindy Julieth sueña con poder hacer crecer el negocio y poder vender en el ropa, accesorios en general entre otras cosas, así podrá cubrir mejor sus gastos, mejorando sus ingresos y aumentando el nivel de su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sindy Julieth, 20, continues the family tradition of having a general store.  Her grandparents opened the business selling basic products like a market does.  The store grew little by little as more merchandise was added.  Now that she is in charge she wants to diversify even more by selling liquors, snacks and sweets.  
Sindy Julieth dreams of expanding her business and being able to sell clothing, accessories and more.  That way she can better cover her expenses, increase her income and raise her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as liquors, snacks and sweets for her general store

loans.name: Amadu's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They want a loan of 8,500,000.00 SLL in order to solve their immediate financial problems. At the end of each month, they will repay the loan using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for doing the repayment on their behalf. 

Amadu is the leader of this group of teachers. He is forty-seven year old and a native of Njaiama Nimikoro in eastern Sierra Leone. He is married to a teacher and the couple has five children – four in secondary school and one in college. Amadu has been in the teaching profession for twenty-nine years. He has requested this loan in order to buy house building materials like corrugated metal sheets, bags of cement, rods, nails, etc. for the construction of a family house.

loans.use: to buy materials like corrugated sheets, bags of cement, rods, nails, etc. for the construction of a family house

loans.name: Priscillah

texts.en:
Priscillah is a married woman with three children, all of whom attends school. She lives at her own  house that has no  electricity but has  piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation and theft in her business.

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Mereane

texts.en:
Mereane is married with 6 children. She lives in the village of Sogi is close to the CBD of the capital Apia, located on a thin strip of land which has on one side of it a tidal mangrove swamp. Fishing is the main activity in the village. Mereane\'s husband fishes for crabs in the mangrove. Previous loans have been used to buy fishing equipment, a small canoe and also some second hand roofing iron which she is building up to renovate her house.

Mereane is pictured by her house which is directly on the shore of the mangrove which is at low tide. In the background is the mangrove and her small canoe. Beside her are the crab traps. These consist of a pole suspended above a wire cage which is left underwater to catch the crabs.

With her next loan Mereane will complete the purchase of the roofing iron and improver her house.

loans.use: Home improvement - fix roof

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid is a 36 year old Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region. He is settled in the Fizuli region, Bala Behmenli village. He is married and has a child.
He has been in this business for 4 years.
He sells cabbages out of his own car.
Having borrowed $400 he started his business.
Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy a new car.
This business allows his family to have a better income.
In order to transport the cabbages he wants to buy a new car, because with his own car to sell the cabbages is uncomfortable.

loans.use: To buy a new car

loans.name: Mario Ruben

texts.en:
Mario is 52 years old, married, and has 2 children. Mario is an electronic technician and owns a workshop to repair radios, televisions, and all types of electronic goods. In addition to his workshop, Mario owns a snack bar at his home, which he runs with the help of his wife who works there during the day.

Between both businesses, they can pay for their needs. They plan to expand the snack bar to offer other things like fast food, take-out and delivery service. Because the snack bar currently generates most of the family income, they invest most money in this part. The repair of radios and television has gone down lately.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Mario tiene 51 años, es casado y tiene 2 hijos. Mario es técnico en electrónica y actualmente cuenta con un taller de reparación de radios, televisores y todo tipo de artefactos electrónicos. Además de su taller Mario tiene un copetín en su domicilio el cual maneja con la cooperación de su esposa quien se encarga de la atención en el día a día.

Con ambas actividades ellos pueden cubrir todas sus necesidades, inclusive tienen proyectado ir ampliando el copetín incorporando otros servicios como el de comida rápida, sobre pedido, como así también la de entrega a domicilio. Dado que el copetín en estos momentos es la actividad que genera mayores ingresos a la familia la mayor inversión se hace en ese sector, ya que el tema de reparación de radios y televisores decayó en estos últimos tiempos.

loans.use: To expand his bar

loans.name: Romao Anibal

texts.pt:
A reformed official, Romao asked for an initial loan of approx. 225 dollars in 2007 for the construction of an aviary. He is married with 5 children, and he is starting a poultry business with his wife. The loan of 375 dollars is to purchase chicks, chicken feed, and medicine.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Funcionario reformado, tomou o 1. emprestimo em 2007 para construcao de um aviario no valor de 6.000mts , e casado com 5 filhos e esta a iniciar o negocio de frangos para a sua esposa, que depois se tornara nossa cliente. Tomou dia 17/07/07, 10.000mts para a compra de pintos, racao e medicamentos.

loans.use: To purchase chicks, chicken feed, and medicine

loans.name: Tati

texts.en: Tati H. is 45 years old and is married. She sells sandals on credit. She always goes around to other places besides her own village to find customers.  Her earnings from this business usually total around $22 per week. She is a new member of MBK and would like a $50 loan to buy more sandals and expand her business. She is willing to repay this loan.

loans.use: To buy more sandals and expand the business

loans.name: Iyabo

texts.en: Iyabo T. is 38 years of age, married with 2 children, and has been an LAPO client for the past 3 years. She is from Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells bag of rice. She has been in business since 2004 and needs the loan of $625 to buy more bags rice for sale.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice

loans.name: Mirzoolim

texts.en: Mirzoolim N. lives in Mastchokh; he is married and has 4 children. He has been a client of MicroInvest since 2006 and he has been a good client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures. He is in business of livestock-raising and selling.  He would like to purchase a pedigree bull, to increase his livestock further. Also, he plans to produce  pasteurized milk, sour milk, sour cream and curd and supply it to bazaars.  He works intensively to widen the existing business to increase his family's well-being. Now he requests a loan of US $525 to support the existing business and to implement new opportunities.

loans.use: To support the existing business and develop new opportunities

loans.name: Thi Ngoan

texts.vi:
Mrs. Ngoan, 44, has 3 children. The oldest is working now and the other two are still in school. Years ago she sold chè nước, kind of Vietnamese desert. Then she changed to selling phở, a popular Vietnamese noodle soup, 5 years ago. She has a phở kiosk at the Chờ market where she serves phở from early morning to 4pm everyday. Her husband helps her to run the business in the morning, then rushes home to tend her pig stock. She uses the left over food from her stand and buys more from neighbor stands as feed for her pigs. That feed would make pigs grow faster and have tastier meat. She like to borrow money from Binh Minh because it allows her to make weekly payment.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Cô Ngoan, 44 tuổi, có 3 con, 1 người đã đi làm còn 2 người còn đang đi học. Trước kia, cô bán hàng chè nước, hiện nay, cô chuyển sang nghề bán hàng bún phở được 5 nă,. Cô có 1 kiôt ở chợ Chờ, cô thường bán từ sáng cho tới 4h chiều. Chồng cô cũng tham gia phụ bán hàng, giúp cô vào buổi sáng, sau đó về nhà chăn lợn. Cô tận dụng thức ăn thừa, và mua thêm ở các hàng ăn khác để chăn nuôi, nên lợn chóng lớn và ngon thịt hơn khi chăn bằng cám công nghiệp. Cô thích vay của chương trình tài chính vi mô Binh Minh vì được trả dần hàng tuần.

loans.use: mua hàng để bán Bún, Phở

loans.name: Funke
