texts.en: Funke M. is 30 years old, is married, and has 5 children. She hails from the Mushin Area in Lagos State. She sells drink and provisions. She has been in her business since 2004. She is seeking a loan of $450 to buy more provisions and drinks for sale.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To Buy 80 lbs. of Shrimp, 80 lbs. of Fillet, 80 lbs. of Fish and 80 lbs. of Conch.

loans.name: Mohammad Hayoub

texts.en: Mohammad Hayoub lives in district 17 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He has a retail shop and has been involved in this business for more than 5 years. Every day he works hard to expand his business so he has requested an individual loan to enlarge his shop and buy more food items for his business. He is happy with this loan and he would like to thank lenders who help poor people around Afghanistan.

loans.use: To enlarge his shop and buy more food items

loans.name: Oun Sam Group

texts.en:
Four residents in Prey Taing Thnong Village make up one group in Kampong Chhnang Province. Mrs. O. S., the group leader is a farmer and sells cakes in her village. She is a widow with four children, two of whom are farmers. The other two are studying at the state school. In September of last year, three of her children contracted malaria. Mrs. O. S. obtained a loan of $325 to purchase medicines to cure them of the disease.

She usually buys ingredients to make the cakes for resale. This requires a positive cash flow and because many villagers purchase on credit, she is unable to purchase the raw ingredients in a timely manner. Mrs. S. would like to sell her cakes in a primary school and increase her cash flow. She is requesting a loan to achieve this goal.

One group member, Mr. Ruon Y., is not in the picture but his wife represents him.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to make cakes for resale

loans.name: Diame

texts.fr:
Diame Seme is a married farmer with several children. Next to his fields, which only keep him busy three months out of the year, he raises cattle to increase his income. With a first loan of 100,000F cfa, he started raising cattle. Currently, he is on his sixth loan. His latest loan was for 400,000F cfa.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Diame S. est un cultivateur marié et pere de plusieurs enfants .A cote de ses champs qui ne l'occupent que pendant trois mois durant l'année ,il pratique l'embouche bovine pour accroitre ses revenus. Avec un premier pret de 100000F cfa il a demarré l'embouche aujourd'hui il est à son sixiéme pret .son dernier pret est de 400.000f cfa.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Fatou Kairé is 62 years old, married, and supports three children and three other adults. For three and a half years she has been a member of the Kairé village bank. She buys local products like palm oil and dried fish wholesale and sells them retail. The income from her transactions permits her to improve her standard of living. She seeks a loan that will be repaid in six months.

Translated from French by Joyce, Kiva Volunteer.

Fatou Kairé, 62 ans mariée, 03 enfants et 03 autres personnes en charge est membre du banc villageois de Kairé depuis 3 ans et demi. Elle achète des produits locaux comme l’huile de palme et le poisson sec et revend au détail. Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent d’améliorer ses conditions de vie. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Trade in local products (palm oil, dried fish)

loans.name: Sabra's Kinamama Group

texts.en:
Sabra is 29 years old. She is married with five children aged between 6 and 13. She owns and runs a small food vendor store. She works at her business each day and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 (US Dollars) in sales.

Sabra hopes for a loan to buy more rice, maize flour, and bananas for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Adila.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr:
Madame E. Kossiwa est une femme mariée dynamique qui a pour activité, la vente de produits de premières nécessités dans le quartier d’Agoè au nord de Lomé. Elle est née le 09 janvier 1966 et a quatre (4) enfants. 
Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra de refaire son stock par l’achat de 10 sacs de riz, 05 sacs de sucre, 8 bidons d’huile et 10 cartons de savons. Elle n’aime jamais avoir de rupture de stock, à cet effet, elle se donne toujours les moyens pour le faire.
texts.en:
Mrs. Kossiwa E. is a dynamic married woman who has a business selling staple items in the neighborhood of Agoè in the northern part of Lomé. She was born on January 9, 1966 and has four children.

This first loan that she is requesting will permit her to refurbish her inventory by buying 10 sacks of rice, 5 sacks of sugar, 8 jerry cans of oil, and 10 cases of soap. She doesn't ever like to run out of the products she sells, so she always manages to have the means to keep her inventory up.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of staples for re-sale

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: la Sra. Martha, casada y con dos hermoso hijos de 10 y 17 años de edad, los cuales están estudiando, tiene 38 años de edad, y habita en un barrio que se llama Memorial Sandino, su esposo es comerciante en venta de queso. Doña Martha tiene una pulpería y vende también verduras desde hace dos años, e inicio con fondos propios que su esposo le dio, comenzó solo con venta de ropa, pero tuvo la iniciativa de poner una pulpería en su casa que le permitiera obtener mejores ganancias. Con la solicitud de préstamos es para invertir en capital en la compra de granos básicos y productos enlatados y otros, para ofertar siempre la variedad de productos a sus clientes. A futuro es captar otros clientes, obtener mejores ingresos a si como ayudar a sus hijos en la educación de los estudios.
texts.en:
Martha, married and with two beautiful children who are 10 and 17, both of whom are in school, is 38 years old and lives in a neighborhood that is called Memorial Sandino. Her husband is a cheese salesman. Martha has a small grocery store and has also sold vegetables for the past two years. She started with her own funds and from her husband, beginning only with clothing sale, but she took the initiative to put a small grocery store in her house that would allow her to obtain higher earnings. This loan request is to invest in capital for the purchase of basic grains and canned products and others to always offer a variety of products to her clients. In the future she would like to gain other clients, obtain a higher income as well as to help her children in their education.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic grains and canned goods.

loans.name: Ni Nengah Budiastri

texts.id: Hidup di desa membuat Nengah Budiastri berkeinginan untuk memelihara babi. Supaya bisa membantu menambah penghasilan suaminya yang bekerja sebagai buruh yang pendapatannya pas-pasan.Nengah Budiastri memiliki seorang anak perempuan yang bernama Ni Kadek Yudiantini baru berumur 4 tahun. Kebetulan lewat organisasi yang ada di desanya yang bekerja sama dengan Dinari Nengah Budiastri mengajukan pinjaman ternak. Adapun jangka waktunya 6 bulan dan pembayaran pada akhir periode pinjaman. Nengah Budiastri sangat mengharapkan agar dana yang dibutuhkan bisa cepat direalisasikan.Karena sampai saat ini dana belum diterimanya rencana kalau dananya sudah diterima Nengah Budiastri ingin memelihara 2 babi penggemukan untuk persiapan anaknya kalau sudah bersekolah.
texts.en:
Nengah Budiasrti wants to be in the business of raising pigs. She wants to do it to help her husband who only earns small income. They have a 4 year old daughter named Ni Kadek Yudiantini. Nengah is now participating in a 6 month loan program. She has not received the loan money yet but she is already making plan to use the money to buy 2 breeding pigs. She wants to use the proceed to help her finance her daughter education.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy pigs and pig foods (Membeli anak babi dan pakan)

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en:
A loving and truthful wife, Bernardita O. G. is a new member of Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) of Antique South West Branch of Igcaputol Center 38. She has experienced a miserable life because her parents are very poor and less educated. Because of her bloodline, being native or indigenous people, her capacity was always under estimated. She works hard under the sun in order to provide her family's daily needs. 

She was blessed with six children, but unfortunately one child died at the age of 18. Due to their painful and miserable life, she was forced to work hard in order to have an income for their food.  When her son died, she really felt hopeless. However, she needed to move on and was forced to apply for a loan in one of the institutions with a higher interest just to cope with the financial needs of her family. But it seems that they were abused by the financial institution; many of her group mates had missed their payment and their savings was used to pay the unpaid balance. 

When ASHI encouraged her to take the opportunity to have a loan she was hesitant at first because of her bad experience. When one member of their area received a loan, she understood the advantage of joining the institution. She was encouraged to form a group and avail the chance of having capital. She had a proposal for Php5,000.00 to be used for a boat and fish net for fishing. She is looking forward to the utmost support.

loans.use: Fish Net & Fish Vending

loans.name: Flora Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Flora es casada, tiene 3 hijos, uno de 16, otro de 13 años y un pequeñito, los que todavia estan bajo su cuido. Doña Flora junto a su marido tienen dos negocios, que son la venta de ropa usada y algunas mesas de billar. El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de productos y fortalecer el negocio de los billares, su marido quien le ayuda a atender el negocio de los billares, mientras ella se encarga de la administración de la venta de la ropa usada; con las ganancias del negocio pagan los gastos familiares y costos de mantenimiento del local donde tienen el salon de billares.  Doña Flora se ha caracterizado por ser una persona responsable, desea crecer en su negocio para que a sus hijos no les falte lo necesario.
texts.en:
Mrs. Flora is married and has 3 children. One is 16, another is 13, and the other is very young. The children are still under her care. Flora, along with her husband, has two businesses. One is selling used clothes and the other is a billiard hall. She is requesting this loan to buy products and to strengthen her billiard business. She counts on the support of her husband who helps her take care of the business while she manages the business of selling used clothes. With the earnings from the business, they pay for the family expenses and the costs of maintaining the billiards hall. Mrs. Flora characterizes herself as a responsible person. She wants to grow her business so that her children do not lack what they need.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Billiards hall

loans.name: Dany

texts.en:
Mrs. Dany C. is a villager in Krassaing Chy Me village in Kampong Speu province. She and her husband, Mr. Duk Phea Rom, raise pork to sell in the local market. Their business is doing well and they want to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Dany C. decided to ask for a loan to purchase more pigs to support her business. She hopes to increase her income and improve their living conditions with her business.

She is 27 years old and the mother of two children who are too young to work or study. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase more pigs to support her business.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah B. is married and has 3 children. She has received schooling through junior high. Hannah sells clothing and fabric. She is a seamstress who has specialized in sewing lady's ware at Bantama, near Elmina. She recently started this business. Her husband is a carpenter. Hannah uses her income to support her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family. Hannah will use the loan to purchase a greater quantity and variety of  fabrics and other sewing materials for her sewing work. With the new profits from her expanded business, Hannah plans to save towards a house that she wants to put up with her husband for their children.

loans.use: To purchase a greater quantity and variety of  fabrics and other sewing materials for her sewing business

loans.name: Milagros Group

texts.es:
El Banco Milagros inicia su tercer ciclo con  19 socias.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. abarrotes en general, verduras, cereales, ropa, cosméticos, comida, pescado y animales.

Como es el caso D. Marcelina es casada, tiene 42 años y 3 hijos, Marcelina tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes, frutas, verduras, actividad que realiza todos los días.

Mientras que Melania es separada, tiene 48 años y 2 hijos, Melania venD. ropa, sus ventas son al crédito y los realiza a domicilio y en los mercados.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 450 soles, 600soles, 900 soles  haciendo un total D. 12,450 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, uniformes escolares, animales, trigo, cebada, verduras, frutas.

Los sueños D. las socias son salir adelante con sus negocios, tener capital propio, sus hijos culminen sus estudios y prosperen.
texts.en:
The Milagros (“Miracles”) Bank starts its third cycle with 19 members. The members have different types of businesses, such as selling groceries, vegetables, cereals, clothing, cosmetics, food, fish and animals. This is the case for Marcelina who is married, 42 years old and has 3 children. She has a store in her home where she sells groceries such as fruits and vegetables every day. Meantime, Melania is separated, 48 years old and has two children. She sells clothing, her sales are on credit, and she realizes them door-to-door and in the markets. The members need different loan amounts such as 300 Peruvian soles, 450 soles, 600 soles and 900 soles, for a loan total of 12,450 soles in the cooperative bank. Their loans will be invested into the purchase of rice, sugar, school uniforms, animals, wheat, barley, vegetables and fruits. The members’ dreams are to help their businesses get ahead, to have their own working capital, and for their children to complete their educations and prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, school uniforms, wheat, barley, vegetables, fruit.

loans.name: Isa

texts.en: Isa F., 32, is married with five children.  She has three years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the general public/villagers four days per week. She has two previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~187 USD).  SPBD loans are Isa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Isa's loan will be used to purchase a plant sprayer, knives, spade, wheelbarrow and sacks of fertilizer for her business. Her husband helps her with the business.

loans.use: To buy farming equipment and fertilizer

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
Nguyen Thi H. is a thirty-two-year-old female living in the town of Nghệ An.  She is married and has two infant-aged children.  To make a living, Hằng works in a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising fish for sale.  Hằng has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately $145 a month from these activities.

In 2004, Hằng joined TYM Fund, a Kiva field partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.  Hằng has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to purchase young livestock to raise and sell in the future.  Hằng is now requesting a new loan of $700 which will be used to purchase breeding livestock.  The loan will be the tenth loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund.  Hằng plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family.

loans.use: To buy breeding livestock

loans.name: Soledad Regina

texts.es: doña Regina es originaria de la aldea ChiP. del Municipio de Totonicapán su activida principalmente es la tejeduria que lo viene realizando desde las epocas del noventa hasta la fecha incico en esa época con telas laboriadas de diferentes colores, mateles hace unos cinco años este tipo de trabjo se fué desapareciendo ella decidio  cambiar de producto y la cual se dedico hacer cortes tipicos,para damas y la cual las entrega en el deaprtamento de Chimaltengo y Salcaja Quetzaltenango. Vista las oficina de la sucursal de ASDIR en un credito para aumentar su produccion.
texts.en:
Reginia is from the ChiP. village in the Totonicapán municipality. Her business is knitting, which she has been doing since the nineties. She started with fabric made in different colors. She made tablecloths, but for about the last five years this type of work has been disappearing. She decided to change products and make traditional clothes for women. She delivers them to Chimaltengo and the Salcaja Quetzaltenango department. She is asking ASDIR for a loan to increase her production.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Oumou

texts.fr:
Née le 02 Octobre 1987,  Oumou Coulibaly  est une célibataire qui vit chez sa sœur à Hamdallaye, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer à l’école pour des raisons sociales, elle  s’initia très vite aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat-vente des pagnes wax, de soutien-gorge, de slip et des tissus brodés. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée  de sa clientèle (composée essentiellement des femmes) pour la qualité de ses produits.
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est à son premier prêt  individuel.
Ce prêt sera utilisé pour acheter, 4 douzaines de slip, 6 douzaines de Soutien- gorge et 4 pièces de pagnes wax.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        
Elle achète ses marchandises auprès des grands commerçants de la ville, ensuite elle les revend de façon ambulante à Sikasso.
 Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born on October 2, 1987, Oumou C.is single and lives with her sister in Hamdallaye, one of the working-class neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Not having had the chance to get ahead in school for socio-economic reasons, she began early on to work at money-earning activities, notably selling "wax pagnes" (high-quality, brightly patterned African fabrics), bras, women's underwear, and embroidered cloth. She is much in demand with her clientele (composed essentially of women) for the quality of her products.

With the intention of satisfying her ever growing clientele, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom she is on her first individual loan. This loan will be used to buy 4 dozen pairs of women's underwear, 6 dozen bras, and 4 bolts of "wax pagne" fabric. She buys her merchandise from the big merchants of the town, then she sells it on foot throughout Sikasso.

She expects to earn a monthly profit of 50,000 F CFA with this loan which will be used essentially to increase her working capital, contribute to family expenses, and pay the interest on the loan, investing any remainder in her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of "pagnes", bras, and underwear

loans.name: Gerardina

texts.es:
Gerardina es socia del Banco Comunal Fe.
Gerardina es casada, tiene 51 años y 4 hijos, Gerardina tiene un puesto en el mercado F. Vivanco en donD. venD. carne, los animales los adquiere en las diferentes ferias D. la región y los beneficia en el camal.
Gerardina necesita un préstamo D. 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. cerdos y ovino.
Los sueños D. Gerardina son mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Gerardina is a partner of a communal bank. She is married, has four children, and is fifty-one years old. Geradina has a stand in the marketplace called Vivanco where she sells chicken and other animal meats. She gets the animals from other marketplaces and then takes them to the slaughter house. Then she sells the meat. Gerardina needs to be loaned $325 which she will invest in buying pigs and cows. Her dream is to improve her business.

(Translated by Andrea of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in buying pigs and cows

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: Elsie P. is a rice grower. She lives in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur, an agricultural community in Mindanao. She is 37 years old and has two children who are still schooling. She and her husband are striving so hard to provide the needs of their family. She has a farm with an area of 3 hectares (7.5 acres) on which she grows rice as their only source of income. After Elsie heard about CEVI and Kiva loans, she requested a loan of Php 15,000. The purpose why she is applying for loan is to purchase six quarts of foliar (liquid) fertilizers, six sacks of urea (a granular fertilizer) and other farm needs. The loan will truly help her and her family obtain the maximum yield from their rice farm. CEVI helps small farmers sustain their livelihood. It provides not just credit assistance but also offers training and insurance coverage to empower their clients to become leaders in their own communities.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm needs

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen D. D. is 42 and is from the village of Purok 9B, Kiwalan Iligan City. Helen is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Helen owns & operates a specialized retail business; her main source of income comes  from selling clothing, snack food and dried fish in the local community. Helen has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Helen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen is requesting her first loan, of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children's education. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Purok 9B, Kiwalan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Murod

texts.ru: Мурод Рахмонов  1980 года рождения женат, имеет 2 детей. Он работает    водителем такси . В день он делает до 8 рейсов .   Живет с родителями и братьями. Но жена настаивала на переезд. Несколько лет копили деньги что бы купить квартиру. Настал долгожданный момент, но все таки нахватало несколько тысяч. Родители немного добавили . Жена также посоветовала обратится за кредитом .

loans.use: покупка квартир

loans.name: Flor De Pino Group

texts.es:
El grupo Flor de Pino, es originario de la comarca San Pedro, perteneciente al Municipio de Ticuantepe, pero que queda aledaño a la zona de Nindiri, por lo cual es más factible para éste grupo viajar a Nindiri que a Managua. Está formado por cuatro integrantes que son: Doña Ana Julia V. M., Doña Paula Nelis L. H., Doña Edda del Carmen M. L. y Marvin de Jesús H. A..

Doña Ana es la mayor, tiene 44 años de edad, y es la coordinadora del grupo puesto que infunde confianza a los otros miembros, que aun que siendo jóvenes, abrazan mucha responsabilidad.

Ella trabaja en la elaboración de Tortillas de maíz en su comarca, oficio que aprendió hace tres años, gracias a su vecina que le enseño a hacerlas y le motivo a iniciar la venta de éstas, doña Ana se retó a iniciar el negocio para poder ayudar a su esposo, quien trabaja como bodeguero en una empresa, pero cuyo  salario no les permitía brindar a sus hijos las condiciones necesarias para salir adelante; 

Al ver que le iba bien decidió continuar y gracias al trabajo de ambos hoy su hija de 18 años está en la Universidad concretando su futuro y sus dos hijos menores tendrán la oportunidad de hacerlo de igual manera.

Doña Ana aspira poder vender otras variedades de productos ayudándose de los financiamientos recibidos, es por esto que el grupo flor de Pino, mantiene su excelente record crediticio.

Doña Paula es vendedora de ropa de todo tipo, según sea la demanda de sus clientes. Doña Edda es distribuidora de cosméticos de la línea AVON, y Marvin Distribuye pollo en diferentes zonas de su comarca.
texts.en:
The Group “Flor de Pino” (Pine Blossom) originates from the San Pedro region, which is part of the town of Ticuantepe and adjacent to the district of Nindiri. Because of their location, the group members find it relatively easy to travel from Nindiri to Managua. The four members of the group are as follows: Doña Ana Julia V. M., Doña Paula Nelis L. H., Doña Edda del Carmen M. L., and Marvin de Jesús H. A..

Doña Ana is the senior member of the group. She is 44 years old and the group coordinator. She instills confidence in the other members. Even though they are quite young, they embrace taking up much responsibility.

Doña Ana makes and sells corn tortillas in her neighborhood. She learned this skill three years ago thanks to a neighbor who taught her how to make them and motivated her to start selling them. She started her business with the help of her husband, who works for a company as a winemaker. His salary alone was not enough for them to provide the necessary conditions for their children to succeed.

Seeing that she had the support her husband, Doña Ana decided to continue her business. Thanks to both of their incomes, their 18 year old daughter is in college shaping her own future. Their two younger children will have the same opportunity to do likewise.

With the help of her loan, Doña Ana wants to begin selling a variety of other products. This is why she started the “Pino de Flor” group. The members have maintained an excellent credit record.

Doña Paula sells all types of clothing based on customer requests. Doña Edda is an Avon cosmetics distributor. Marvin sells chicken in different parts of the region.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products to increase their businesses

loans.name: Arnoldo Antonio

texts.es: El señor Arnoldo Antonio Narváez de 57 años de edad, es un hombre que ha logrado cuidar de su familia y de su negocio, su esposa le tiene tres hijos que cursan la primaria dos de ello, y el mas pequeño a un no va a clases, , reside en el barrio Hialeah en la capital de Managua, y unos de sus planes es poder seguir mejorando su vivienda, su negocio es la vemta de granos básicos, frutas y verduras entre otros, que junto con su esposa han logrado administrar, las dificultades es que las ventan se ponen bajas y a veces pierde los perecederos, es por eso ha optado ah invertir mas en granos básicos y otros productos para incrementar su inventario y poder seguir con sus ventas. Da las gracias a la institución por apoyar a su negocio como mejorar las condiciones de vida de muchas familias Nicaragüenses.
texts.en:
Arnoldo Antonio N. is 57 years old. He has managed to take care of his family and of his business. His wife has given him three children, all of whom are in primary school. The littlest one does not go to school yet. They live in the region of Hialeah in the capital city of Managua. One of his goals is to improve their home. His business is the sales of basic grains and fruit and vegetables, and he runs it together with his wife. They run into difficulties when sales are down and sometimes their perishable items go to waste. So intead they have opted to invest more funds in basic grains and other products to supplement their inventory and keep their sales up. He is very grateful to the organization for the support given to his business, an initiative that has improved the living condition of many families in Nicaragua.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic grains and other products.

loans.name: Santos Emilio

texts.es:
El señor Emilio A. tiene  59 años de edad el tiene su taller MECANICO desde hace 40 años, esta ubicado al frente de su casa, cuenta con todas las herramientas  necesarias, y esta ubicado en un lugar estrategico, es amplio y cuenta con dos empleados,  que le ayudan a reparar los carros como ser reparaciones de motores, cajas de cambios,  disco de clutch, diferenciales, frenos, cambio de llantas, enderezados de pintura entre otros, el tiene su propia cartera de clientes los cuales los recomiendan a otros, ya que su trabajo es de calidad, el solamente cobra la mano de obra, los clientes llevan sus repuestos, mensualmente gana $ 1,232.00 , de los cuales paga empleados 600.00, quedandole una utilidad de $ 632.00 y de esta forma graduo a sus cuatro hijos, construyo sus cuartos de alquiler, el vive con su esposa quien trabaja como ama de casa, el señor se levanta muy temprano para ir al gimnacio ya que le gusta mantenerse en forma.
el solicita el credito para realizar mejoras en su casa ya que cuando llueve se le innunda de agua, quiere unir parte de su casa al taller, es una persona muy reponsable en trabajo, no le
gusta quedar mal a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mr. Emilio A. is 50 years old. He has owned a mechanic's shop for 40 years. His shop, located next to his home, in a strategic location for a business like his, and is spacious and equipped with all the necessary tools. He has two employees, who help him repair the cars, whether the work is rebuilding motors or shift boxes, clutch repairs, brakes, changing tires, body work and painting, or other repairs. He has his own clientele, who recommend him to others, since does high quality work. He only charges for labor; his clients supply their own replacement parts. He earns $1232.00 monthly, of which he pays his employees $600, leaving him a profit of $632. With this business he put his four sons through school and built rooms he rents out. He lives with his wife, who works as a housewife. Emilio gets up very early to go to the gym; he likes to stay in shape. He is requesting a loan with which to make improvements to his home, since the house floods when it rains. He wants to connect part of his home to his auto repair shop. Emilio is a very responsible person who does not like disappointing clients in any way.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cement, sand, lime and construction materials.

loans.name: Gbatima 1 Group

texts.en:
Hawa is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Gbatima 1. She is a 52-year-old married woman with two children, aged 23 and 26, both of whom are university students. Hawa is illiterate because she was born and raised in a rural area where there was no school, but later she migrated to Monrovia, Liberia. Hawa and her family now live in Virginia, and sell in the Banjaour market, north of the capital, Monrovia.

Hawa's business is food preparation. She buys ingredients and prepares food to be sold in the Banjaour market. She has been running this business for 15 years and has been able to take care of her family with the proceeds of the business. She is a good cook, which is why she has so many customers. Hawa's difficulty is the rainy season, because when it rains she doesn't really get customers because it is said that Liberians are afraid of rain.

Hawa is requesting a loan to buy more food ingredients such as tins of oil, seasoning, pepper and bags of rice, to improve her business. She is hoping to establish a big restaurant in the future in order to make enough profit to build a house for her family. This would changes their lives totally.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients such as tins of oil, seasoning, pepper and bags of rice

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn E. is from the village of P-9, Luinab, Iligan City. She is 31 years old. Emelyn is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Emelyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products such as soap in the local community. Emelyn has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Emelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emelyn is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Emelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the ducation of her children.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

location.town: P-9, Luinab, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
“Poverty is not a hindrance to success!” is an inspiring quotation from Mrs. Erlinda P. the responsible housewife of Mauro P.. They happily live in the village located at Barangay Paniki, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya, with their five children. Despite the economic crisis, they aim to support the schooling of their children so that they will find a stable job someday. As a fruit of their patience and sacrifices, two of their children graduated from college while the others are still studying.

For the sake of their future, Erlinda and her husband till their land twice a year and plant palay (rice) and some vegetables. To earn additional income Erlinda ventured in the buying and selling of dry goods like blankets, towels and floor mats. She sells them in their village through retailing.

Recognizing that the dry-goods business is really profitable, she now wants to acquire more dry goods but she has only a little capital. Thus, she wants to borrow additional capital of Php 10,000 from Kiva lenders to be used in acquiring the said products. She believes that the lenders will grant her requested loan.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her dry goods business

loans.name: Achraf

texts.en:
Achraf is a 29-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their four children. Achraf has been working as a furniture painter for almost two years. Achraf requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase some tools and a car for his work. This is his second loan cycle and he has always paid on time. 

Achraf is special in his work because he has a lot of skills and always does nice and precise work. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he had some financial issues. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work related to his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase some tools and a car for his work

loans.name: Mbalu

texts.en:
This is Mbalu T.. She is 28 years old, married, and is from Waterloo. She has one child, a boy.

Mbalu has been a LAPOSL client for some time now and has taken three previous loans. She is a member of a LAPOSL union (a credit group that acts as a collective collateral and guarantor). This is the first loan she will be receiving with the help of Kiva lenders.

Mbalu has a small kiosk on the street in Waterloo from which she sells candies, sweets, biscuits (cookies) and other small goods. With her previous loans she expanded her business by purchasing more of the same goods for sale. With her new loan, she hopes to add more goods to her business. He goal is to pay off her loan successfully.

loans.use: To purchase more sweets, biscuits, and sugar

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is 46 years old, married, and has 7 children. She lives in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria.  Theresa is a focused, hard working woman. She puts in long hours trying to sustain her business selling foodstuff at retail prices. She is requesting a loan of 80,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more foodstuff to sell. She wishes to thank all Kiva lenders.

Theresa is a LAPO client. During our visit to her stall, she was about to go to the market to purchase more foodstuff to sell.  The Lift Above Poverty Organization is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: to purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Keo C. is 25 years old and lives with her husband and three of her children in Siem Reap Province. She grows vegetables and sells them at the local market, making approximately $5 USD profit a day. Her husband is a construction foreman and, on average, makes $6 USD per day. Keo C. is asking for a loan of $800 USD to purchase a motorbike to transport vegetables to sell at the market. This will help reduce her transport costs.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to transport her vegetables to market

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila G., 62, is a hardworking single mom. She makes sure that she earns enough so that her two children can have a better life.  She has been managing her own variety store for five years. Aside from owning a store, she also manages rooms for rent.

Lucila has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than three years now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow 10 times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to buy stock for her variety store.  Both of her businesses let her earn a combined profit of 13,000 Philippine pesos per month.  

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 10,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying assorted canned goods, snacks, toiletries and hygiene products.

She dreams that her business will expand to become a mini grocery someday and she prays for an abundant and peaceful life ahead. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Buying assorted canned goods, snacks, toiletries and hygiene products

loans.name: Nouv

texts.en:
Mrs. Nouv L. is 35 years old and she lives in Brey Bay Village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to grow rice. Her husband, Mr. Sarith Maong, is a cow middleman to earn a living for the family. Since her husband's business is going well, Mrs. Nouv L. wants to expand it. So she decided to ask for 2,000,000 Riel from AMK to buy four cows to support the business. With this loan, she hopes to increase her income, so she can improve the living conditions of her family.  

Mrs. Nouv L. is a mother of three children who all are students in the public school at the local village. They also help their mother with the farming.

loans.use: To buy four cows

loans.name: Rodny Ariel

texts.es: Rodny Ariel de 26 años de edad, labora para la Alcaldia de Juigalpa desde hace 2 años en el area de programacion de proyectos, esta casado con la Sra. Thelma Martinez quien se encarga del cuido de la casa y la familia.  Rodny esta solicitando su primer credito a AFODENIC con el objetivo de hacer las divisiones de los cuartos de su casa, ya que actualmente solo consta de un cuarto grande y quiere dividirlo en 2 cuartos para mayor comodidad de la familia, ademas si el dinero lo permite pretende comprar materiales de construccion para posteriormente seguir mejorando su casa, pues el mayor sueño que tiene es tener su casa bonita para cuando lleguen los hijos poderles brindar comodidad.
texts.en:
Twenty-six-year-old Rodny Ariel works in the planning department of the Juigalpa City Hall. He is married to Mrs. Thelma Martinez, who looks after the family and the house. Rodny is requesting his first loan from AFODENIC with the aim of making rooms in his house because it is currently one big room. He would like to divide it into 2 rooms so that his family can be more comfortable. Furthermore, if money permits, he intends to purchase construction materials so that he can keep improving his house later on because he has always dreamed of having a beautiful home so that when his children come along, he can provide them with comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to make rooms

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine A. is a 48-year-old married mother of three children. When she got married, she started making and selling peanut butter. Their income is not enough to support the needs of their growing children. She joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.) to acquire secured capital to continue expanding her business. For her, the business is important, and she does not want to be a problem for her group mates or for the center. 

Josephine applied for this loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy more inventory of peanut butter and ingredients. She also wants to save money from her business to meet their daily needs. She hopes that through her loans from ASHI in partnership with Kiva, someday she will be able to discover her talent and engage in a more productive business.

Josephine dreams that her children will finish college. Additionally, she hopes to continue her business as a sustainable livelihood to support her family and provide them with a better life that is far away from poverty.

NOTE: Please disregard the date appearing on the photo. The camera internal date was not set on the correct date.

About ASHI
Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of the Grameen Bank approach (GBA) to deliver credit to the poorest of the poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models for credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To buy more inventory of peanut butter and ingredients

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is a 43-year-old lady operating a restaurant in Hoima, Uganda. She is a single mother of five children aged 23, 20, 19, 16 and 13 years. She is the family’s breadwinner and her family lives in a rented house though she hopes to construct her own residential house.

Daisy has been in business for eight years. Having started with pancakes and tea as stock, she now offers food, tea and cold drinks in her restaurant. She says she aims at improving the ambience of her restaurant to a better standard. She intends to buy a refrigerator using the loan funds because she has been hiring the one for the business.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator to replace the one she has been hiring

loans.name: Teav's Group

texts.en: In Kamnab village in Kandal province, there are five people who make up this group loan. Mrs. Teav M. is the group leader who was selected by all the members. They will use the loan for different purposes. She and her husband, Mr. Lab Chhan, are farmers who own 1.5 hectares of land to cultivate rice to support their family. Although they try to work hard, they can't earn enough income. For this reason, they want to start a new business but they don't have enough money. Thus, Mrs. Teav M. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. She is a mother of four children. Two of the children are seamstresses in a garment factory, one is enrolled in a local public school, and the other is five years old.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Anupika

texts.en:
Anupika is a 37-year-old divorced woman living with her daughter, mother and sister in the town of Hikkaduwa in the Galle area of Sri Lanka. She is a hardworking woman. Her family members are very close and work well together.

As a main livelihood, Anupika manages a sewing business and sells ready-made products to tourists, something she has been doing for a long time. She knows about her customer's desires from her experience. She can speak English quite well, too, which helps with her tourist clients. After attending school, she got started doing this business, which was twelve years ago.

Anupika has requested a 20,000 rupee (LKR) loan from BRAC Sri Lanka, and she plans to use the loan to buy material for her sewing business. She is grateful to BRAC Sri Lanka because of the financial support it provides to her.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy more material for her sewing business

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline N. is a widow who has eight children to look after, five of whom are still in school. Unable to meet the material needs of her children, she sought assistance from GHAPE when she joined the program in 2004. Her dedication to the program is unquestionable and her hard work has had untold results on her family's situation.

With her new loan, she plans to repair her pig sty, buy more three more piglets, pig feed and coffee from neighboring villages. There are a lot of small-scale coffee farmers in neighboring villages whose products are too small to attract coffee-processing firms. She plans to go to them, buy the coffee from several farmers, and resell to the coffee cooperative society in Mbengwi, which serves as a collection centre for coffee processing firms. The profit she gets from the loans will be used to educate her children and provide food for her family.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Buy piglets, pig feed, and coffee

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Christians Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Victoria describes herself as a hard-working woman. She is 56 years old and she is the leader of the 'Christians' borrower group. Victoria is a petty trader who has been selling fresh yams for the past 8 years. She also engages in farming as her second business to make extra income. She is excited to be taking out this loan, which she will use to purchase 100 yams. She dreams of being able to expand her market.  

Victoria is married to a farmer but does not have any children. She hopes to mobilize more savings to buy a container shop to sell her yams out of.

The other members of Victoria’s group are mostly farmers and as the leader she ensures regular meeting attendance and repayment of loan installments.

loans.use: To purchase 100 fresh yams

loans.name: Chien

texts.en: Chien S., 52 years old, owns a small shop in front of her home where she sells food for her neighbors. She typically makes around $3 of profit each day to meet her family's needs. She has been married for many years to Peum Bo, 45, a palm climber, and they have four children: one is married and the other three are single. To help meet the family's expenses, two of the children are employed. Chien S. will be using this Kiva loan to purchase essential ingredients for cooking foods. She proposes to use the rest of the loan to buy an old motorcycle to make her family transportation easier.

loans.use: To purchase essential ingredients for cooking foods

loans.name: José Alfredo

texts.es: José Alfredo Rodríguez G., tiene la edad de 49 años, está divorciado, y tiene 4 hijos de 1, 4,9 y 11 años de edad, son su mayor prioridad. El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar el abono y el fertilizante. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café para lograr una mejor calidad y para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don José Alfredo también trabaja desde hace varios años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
José Alfredo Rodríguez G. is 49 years old he is divorced and has 4 children of 1, 4, 9 and 11 years old who are his main priority. The loan will be used to help his ranch, specifically his coffee crops by buying manure and fertilizer. He wishes to give his coffee crops the adequate care needed to have better quality and in that way have better earnings when it is harvest time. This will be his first loan with FUDECOSUR and is very happy with their help. Don José Alfredo has worked in agriculture some years. In the future he hopes to give his family a better quality of life and more economic stability and to keep growing in his personal and professional life.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For his ranch (coffee crops)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani is a 56 year-old woman who is still very active for her age. She lives in a small city called Riawind.  Riawind is located in the Punjab province of Pakistan and is famous for its religious festivals.  

Rani is married to M. S. who runs a grocery shop in a local market. He started this business five years ago and during this time he has faced both hard and good times.  However, he has overcome problems with strong beliefs and struggle.   

Rani is the mother of five children: four sons and one daughter.  All of them are illiterate because they couldn’t get education due to financial crises. Things are different now as all of them, except her daughter, do different kind of jobs to support the family.  

Rani’s eldest son sells timbers. The next eldest works in a motor workshop. The third son has a business selling mobile phones in  a shop in the market and the youngest son is an employee in a factory on a monthly wage.   

Rani herself is involved in the milk-selling business. She has a buffalo at her home which produces 6-8kg milk everyday and she sells it to her neighborhood clients.  She sells 1kg for 45 PKRs and, on average, she earns 360 PKRs everyday.   

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan amount he will buy groceries in bulk which will enable him to fulfill the needs of his customers and to earn a better  income.

Note: In this photo, Rani is standing with one of her sons in her husband's grocery shop.

loans.use: To purchase groceries.

loans.name: Deogratius

texts.en:
Deogratius, aged 30 years, lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is married with three children and lives in his semi-permanent house.

Deogratius has been a farmer for ten years but he is now starting a retail shop to increase his avenues for income generation. The purpose of the loan is to enable him to purchase sugar, soap, salt and other domestic items to sell in his new shop.

Deogratius dreams of building a permanent house, educating his children, and becoming a retailer.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, soap, salt and other domestic items for his new shop

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia A., from the village of Mabasa Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya, is 42 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Sonia owns and operates a transportation business providing motorcycle transport to local community members. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Sonia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting her first loan of 5000 PHP to repair a transport vehicle used in the business, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

location.town: Mabasa Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina U. is currently in the business of selling fish, beans and cooking oil and is requesting a loan to stock more fish and cooking oil to sell.  Regina is 36 years old and is married. Her husband works for a company. She has 5 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: Stock more fish and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Azul X Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama AZUL X está conformado por 10  señoras, las cuales escogieron su nombre en honor a la nieta de las Tesorera María Engracia A., Azul es una niña muy especial puesto que tiene Síndrome de Down y demuestra día con día su esfuerzo por superarse, las integrantes se sienten motivadas y hacen lo mismo, es por eso que se identifican.Todas y cada una de ellas tiene una historia diferente, el grupo es muy organizado y cumplido; en general son mujeres trabajadoras con negocios creados a base de sacrificios todo con el afán de darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos, casi todas son casadas y también comparten los ideales de su Tesorera María Engracia A., la cual vende  calzado y ropa  por catalogo desde hace cuatro años, quiere obtener mayor clientela, y tener para invertir en cada temporada.En términos generales este grupo al día de hoy está sumamente motivado y existe el compromiso de tener una relación comercial solida.
texts.en:
This group is called Azul X [Blue X], and it is comprised of ten women.  They chose that name in honor of the granddaughter of the treasurer, María Engracia A..  Azul is a special girl who has Down Syndrome and demonstrates every day her effort to overcome obstacles.  The members of the group feel motivated to do the same.

Each and every one of the women has a different story, and the group is very organized and fulfilled.  In general they are hardworking women with businesses created on the basis of sacrifices.  All of the women want to give their children a better future.  Almost all of them are married and they share the ideals of the treasurer, María Engracia A..

She has sold shoes and clothes by catalog for four years.  She would like to have more customers and invest in each season.  

In general terms, this group is highly motivated and has a commitment to a strong business relationship.

loans.use: Invest in her business and sell more this season.

loans.name: Two By Two Group

texts.en:
Meet members of the “Two By Two” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of SLL 2,900,000 for the entire group. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Kadiatu S. is the leader of this group. The forty-year-old is married to a gold dealer and they have two children. Kadiatu has been a businesswoman for many years now. She sells groundnuts, rice, slippers, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above-mentioned items at wholesale prices to add to her business inventory. 

(Also included on the right in the photo is loan officer Mohamed Munu handing over the loan to the clients.)

loans.use: Buy groundnuts, rice, slippers, etc. at wholesale prices

loans.name: Doris Francisca

texts.es:
la sra. Doris Francisca F. tiene 52 años de edad, es soltera y tiene dos personas que dependen de ella, vive en Jicaro Galan en el barrio Las Delicias desde hace 32 años, tiene casa propia.
Doris se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de golosinas como ser tacos, enchiladas, tortillas con quesillo, baleadas, desayunos, almuerzos, burritas de carne.
Hace unos ocho meses inicio con venta de abarroteria teniendo una pequeña pulperia en su casa de habitacion.
 
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de granos basicos, refrescos, carne de res, cerdo y pollo, tortillas, verduras, condimentos, aceite, manteca, margarina, salsa de tomate, frijoles, queso, tortilla de harina, huevos, leña. 

el sueño de doña Doris es que su familia este nuevamente unida y que tengan salud.
texts.en: Sra. Doris Francisca F., 52, is single and has two people who depend on her.  She has lived in Jicaro Galan in the Las Delicias neighborhood for 32 years.  She owns her house.  Doris operates a business making and selling snacks such as tacos, enchiladas, tortillas, baleadas, breakfasts, lunches, burritos, etc.  She started a small grocery in her house eight months ago.  She will use the loan to buy basic commodities, soft drinks, beef, pork, chicken, tortillas, vegetables, condiments, cooking oil, butter, margarine, tomato sauce, beans, cheese, flour tortillas, eggs and firewood.  Sra. Doris' greatest wish is that her family be reunited and that they all enjoy good health.

loans.use: Buy supplies for catering business.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy M. is 18 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Mercy has a tailoring business, which she has had for 5 years. To help expand her business, Mercy has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase materials. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Mercy hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, Mercy hopes to become an international designer. Mercy is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects by teaching her job skills.

loans.use: To purchase materials for tailoring.

loans.name: Rina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN RAFAEL”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Rina; ella tiene 29 años de edad, casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azúcar,leche,menestras,golosinas entre otros, la socia es una persona muy emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir adelante, la socia trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar mas su pequeño negocio y así poder sacar a sus hijos adelante.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Rina is a member of the 'San Rafael' community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Rina is 29 years old.  She is married and has three children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her grocery store business.  Rina sells essentials such as rice, sugar, milk, vegetables, candies, etc.  She is a very enterprising person with a great desire to get ahead in life.  She works together with her husband.

Rina is requesting this loan to keep her small business running so that she can get her children ahead in life.  She is happy to be receiving a loan and she pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To keep her small store running so that she can get her children ahead in life

loans.name: Yulima

texts.es: La señora Yulima S. C. tiene 40 años y vive con su esposo y su único hijo varón de 18 años en el barrio Lucero de la ciudad de Barranquilla. Ella tiene una tienda en la cual vende toda clase de víveres. El negocio era de su padre quien es actualmente pensionado de la policía nacional. Sus padres son oriundos del departamento del Tolima, en el centro del País y se trasladaron a la costa hace más de treinta años. La microempresaria desde niña ha estado vinculada al negocio de tienda. Su jornada laboral comienza a las 6 A.M. y termina a las 10 P.M. En horas de la noche, el esposo de la señora Yulima, que trabaja como mensajero, le colabora en atender los clientes. Este es el segundo crédito que ella tramita en la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y planea utilizarlo en financiar la matrícula de su hijo en un instituto de educación técnica. El joven cursará cuarto semestre de electrónica. El promedio de ventas diarias es de $ 150.000 COP y el margen de utilidad es del 18%. Los fines de semana las ventas aumentan considerablemente porque la microempresaria coloca varias mesas y sillas en la terraza del negocio para que los vecinos del sector jueguen dominó y parqué mientras escuchan música y degustan una fría cerveza. La señora Yulima dice conocer tanto a sus clientes que casi siempre acierta en adivinar qué van a comprar.
texts.en:
Yulima S. C. is 40 years old and lives with her husband and 18 year-old son in Lucero neighborhood, in the city of Barranquilla.  She has a store where she sells all sorts of foodstuffs.  The business was her father's.  Her father is currently retired from the National Police Force.  Her parents are originally from Tolima department, in the center of the country.  They moved to the coast more than thirty years ago.

This small businesswoman has been linked to the store since she was a young girl.  Her work day starts at 6.00am and ends at 10.00pm.  During the evening hours Yulima's husband, who works as a messenger, helps her to serve her customers.

This is the second loan that Yulima has taken from Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo and she plans to use it to pay her son's registration fee for technical college.  The young man will be entering his fourth semester of an electronics course.

Yulima's average daily sales amount to 150,000 Colombian pesos and her profit margin is 18%.  On weekends, her sales increase considerably because she puts some tables and chairs outside her business where neighbors can sit and play dominoes and parcheesi while they listen to music and enjoy a cold beer.  Yulima says that she knows her customers so well that she can nearly always guess correctly what they are going to buy.

loans.use: To pay her son's registration fee for technical college

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua B. is a married woman, who was educated through the junior high school level. Her husband is a carpenter. To earn a living, Ekua prepares kenkey in Abura. (In the picture, she is in the process of mixing the dough, which will then be made into kenkey.) By doing so, she is able to assist her husband take care of their home and support their family.

She is now requesting a loan in the amount of $225 to buy more maize so that she can produce kenkey in larger quantities. She hopes to use the expected additional profits generated as a result of the loan to buy land.

loans.use: To expand her business and to increase production by purchasing additional maize

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora T. is 62 years old, married and has five adult-aged children. She is from the village of Mialen in the municipality of Clarin, a part of Misamis Occidental province on the Mindanao islands. Teodora sells flowers to the local community. Teodora has been in business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Teodora joined GDMPC to gain access to its financial services. Teodora successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Teodora is requesting a new loan, her third from GDMPC, of 5,000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional flowers to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional flowers to sell

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 34 years old, married and supports her family by operating two business ventures: food vending and pig fattening. She lives in Bindoy, Negros Oriental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2001 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her food vending and pig fattening businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 9,300. Elsie is borrowing PHP 15,000 to purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 15th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 8,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Elsie aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team  at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To fund her business operations

loans.name: Sokhen

texts.en:
Miss. Sokhen C. is single and lives with her sister and mother in a village along National Road Number Four, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She runs a grocery store from home in her village. In addition, she also rents space out of her house to garment factory workers because her house is located near a garment factory. 

Sokheng is asking for another loan of $1,200 to repair her house because it is broken in some parts.

loans.use: To repair her house

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Don Miguel L. T., , tiene 58 años de edad, se dedica a la sastreria, especificamente la elaboración de pants, cuenta con una experiencia de 20 años, con los ingresos de su trabajo ha logrado sostener a su familia. Solicita un prestamo que le servirá para ampliar su capital de trabajo y que lo utilizará para compra de materiales como telas e hilos, para poder producir mas pants de los que actualmente esta trabajando, espera con el prestamo que hace a ASDIR, logre el objetivo de mejorar su produccion y su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Miguel L. T. is 58 years old.  He works as a tailor, making pants, and has 20 years experience.  He uses the income from his work to support his family.

Miguel is requesting a loan so that he can increase his working capital.  He will use it to buy supplies such as fabric and threads so that he can make more pants than at present.  He hopes that, with his loan from ASDIR, he will achieve his goal of improving his production and his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy materials for making clothes

loans.name: Lina María

texts.es:
Después de trabajar durante años como empleada en algunos almacenes, Lina María U. A. motivada por un amigo que conoce de su trabajo, por fin emprenderá su camino como independiente, pues abrirá su propio negocio de venta de mercancía. 

Para iniciar con su negocio al que ella misma lo denomina su proyecto de vida, Lina necesita de un préstamo para comprar una vitrina y mercancía.
texts.en:
After working for several years in various warehouses, Lina, who is motivated by a friend she knows from work, will finally begin to work independently.  She plans to open her own merchandising business.  

In order to start her business, which she refers to as her “life project,” Lina is requesting a loan to buy merchandise and a display case.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and a display case in order to start her business

loans.name: Laïdou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe LAÏDOU est composé de 10 femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et de 3 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies avec leurs frères, sœurs, co-épouses, enfants et époux. Ces femmes résident dans le village de DIOUTIEBOUGOU préfecture de BOUGOUNI, troisième région administrative de la république du Mali. Ces femmes se sont connues par des relations de mariage, de parenté et de commerce. 
Dans l’intention d’augmenter leurs ressources financières elles ont décidé d’adhérer à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et cela pour faire le commerce de condiments alimentaires. Elles sont à leur septième prêt de groupe. Avec ce nouveau prêt, Assa D.  compte acheter, 7 boites de 2kg de concentrée de  tomate, 4 sacs de 25kg de sel, 10 paquets de 100 morceaux de cube maggi et diverses qualités de condiments. Les produits sont payés auprès des grossistes de BOUGOUNI pour les revendre ensuite en détail, au comptant ou à crédit dans le village de DIOUTIEBOUGOU. Leur clientèle est composée essentiellement de femmes. Avec ce prêt, Assa espère obtenir un bénéfice mensuel de 15.000 F CFA  qui sera utilisé dans les frais de santé et d’éducation des enfants.
texts.en:
The LAIDOU group is made up of ten married women, who are on average 30 years old and have three children. They live in traditional extended families with their brothers, sisters, co-wives, children, and husbands. These women reside in the village of DIOUTIEBOUGOU, BOUGOUNI prefecture (the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women got to know each other through conjugal, family, and trade relations. They decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution with the intent to increase their financial resources, in order to engage in the trade of condiments. This is their seventh loan as a group.
With this new loan, Assa D.  intends to purchase seven two-kilo boxes of tomato paste, four 25-kilo bags of salt, ten 100-count packs of Maggi bouillon cubes, and various kinds of condiments. The products are paid to wholesalers in BOUGOUNI to then be retailed cash or credit in the village of DIOUTIEBOUGOU. Their client base is comprised mainly of women. With this loan, Assa hopes to make  15,000 CFA francs in monthly benefit, to be used for the children's healthcare and education expenses.

loans.use: to purchase condiments

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school.  She owns a house that has electricity and piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Mwnajuma has been operating a food vending business for the past six years, selling retail to her neighbours and passersby. In addition, she also owns rental houses which contributes to her income. Mwanajuma faces a major challenge in the seasonality of her business. She dreams of expanding and establishing more rental houses in the future.

With this loan for Kshs 40,000, Mwnajuma wants to purchase coconuts and bundles of dried fish for her food market. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase dried fish and coconuts to resell

loans.name: Maria Rafaela

texts.es:
María de 32 años de edad,  es soltero, tiene casa propia con servicio agua y luz, ubicada en el caserío de Valle Nuevo  que pertenece al distrito de Mochumí, a unos 20 minutos del departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y turismo.

María se dedica a la crianza y venta de aves de corral (gallinas y  pavos), su corral donde viven sus animales se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta granos naturales.  Posteriormente vende sus animales una vez que hayan llegado a su tamaño y peso ideal en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad de Chiclayo y Lambayeque;  incrementando sus ingresos y obteniendo  cosas que le hacen falta en su casa.

El crédito que ha solicitado María es de 1200 nuevos soles a Edpyme  Alternativa mediante Capital Semilla, será destinado  para la compra de aves de corral para seguir negociándolo y así poder pagar su préstamo, lo que le ayudara  a mejorar su calidad de vida.

María es una persona trabajadora y empeñosa  que siempre ha sabido salir adelante para mejorar en su desarrollo personal.
texts.en:
María, 32, is single.  She has a house of her own that has electricty and water located in Valle Nuevo which belongs to Mochumí District and is about 20 minutes from Lambayeque Department.  This zone is dedicated to farming, raising livestock and tourism.

María raises barnyard fowl (chickens and turkeys) to sell.  The corral her birds live in is in her back yard.  She feeds them natural grains.  When they reach ideal size and weight she sells them in the various markets in the cities of Chiclayo and Lambayeque thereby increasing her income and obtaining the things she needs for her house.

The loan that María has asked Edpyme Alternativa through the Seed Capital program for is for 1200 new soles that she’ll use to buy barnyard fowl to continue selling in order to be able to repay the loan and which will help her improve her quality of life.

loans.use: Comprar más aves de corral

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes tiene 20 años de edad, es madre soltera y  vive en casa de sus padres con su menor hija, en una comunidad pequeña y rural llamada San Pedrillo ubicada en el  distrito de Tambogrande – Piura. 

Mercedes cuenta con un pequeño restaurante de comida marina que esta adecuadamente condicionado (ambiente y materiales) y en el cual atiende permanentemente. Tiene una experiencia de 4 años en el negocio y cuenta con clientes ya establecidos en la zona.

Mercedes tiene muchos deseos de superación y tiene planeado expandir su negocio. Para lograr sus metas Mercedes desea obtener mayores ingresos  que se lo permitan. Por ello solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que invertirá en la compra de cervezas y mejoras en el local, lo que le permitirá tener clientes que visiten su restaurante frecuentemente. Esto le traerá ganancias que podrán ayudarla a cumplir sus objetivos.

Mercedes, es una clienta conocida para Edpyme Alternativa, este su tercer crédito con nosotros y somos la única entidad con la cual trabaja, es una clienta recurrente y  todas sus cuotas anteriores las pagó puntualmente.
texts.en:
Mercedes tiene 20 años de edad, es madre soltera y  vive en casa de sus padres con su menor hija, en una comunidad pequeña y rural llamada San Pedrillo ubicada en el  distrito de Tambogrande – Piura. 

Mercedes cuenta con un pequeño restaurante de comida marina que esta adecuadamente condicionado (ambiente y materiales) y en el cual atiende permanentemente. Tiene una experiencia de 4 años en el negocio y cuenta con clientes ya establecidos en la zona.

Mercedes tiene muchos deseos de superación y tiene planeado expandir su negocio. Para lograr sus metas Mercedes desea obtener mayores ingresos  que se lo permitan. Por ello solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que invertirá en la compra de cervezas y mejoras en el local, lo que le permitirá tener clientes que visiten su restaurante frecuentemente. Esto le traerá ganancias que podrán ayudarla a cumplir sus objetivos.

Mercedes, es una clienta conocida para Edpyme Alternativa, este su tercer crédito con nosotros y somos la única entidad con la cual trabaja, es una clienta recurrente y  todas sus cuotas anteriores las pagó puntualmente.

loans.use: Comprar cerveza y mejorar local.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Salome works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling root crops and vegetables in the Philippines and earns additional income from selling banana chips. Salome is borrowing 14,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her root-crop and vegetables business.
