Sègodo vit seul et assure seul ses différentes charges. Sègodo n’a pas été à l’école. C’est un brodeur qui a son atelier situé à Jéricho, à Cotonou. Parallèlement à cette activité, Sègodo vend des tissus bazins dans son atelier. Sègodo s’approvisionne à Lomé au Togo, et parfois à Douala au Cameroun. C’est la première fois que Sègodo sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un prêt, en vue de renforcer et d’élever le niveau de son activité, pour mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Sègodo H. was born 14 December 1981, and for the past two years has been living in the Avotrou borough of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Sègodo is not yet married; he lives alone and takes care of his own expenses. Sègodo has not attended school. He is an embroiderer with a workshop located in the Jericho area of Cotonou. As a side business, he sells bazin clothing fabric in his workshop. He gets his supplies from Lomé in neighbouring Togo, and sometimes from Douala in Cameroun. This is the first time Sègodo is requesting a loan from ALIDé, to strengthen and raise the level of his business activity, and better satisfy customer demand.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy phonix thread for embroidery, and bazin clothing fabric

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
40-year-old A. Alex is, without a shadow of a doubt, a go-getter. The attitude of being proactive in whatever you do in life is one he came to terms with after he saw his childhood friends fail in their endeavors to effectively manage their businesses. What occurred to him was the thought that without effective planning and a sense of diligence and involvement, one’s enterprise is bound to go up in smoke.

At length, Alex got his own plans into gear, setting up, against all odds, his own retail shop and later a video hall in Kizinda, Bushenyi. His hardwork ethic has been his stock in trade. He also now has his small rental apartments from where he ekes out side profits. In a week, he makes profits totaling up to 35,000 shillings.

With this loan, Alex wants to start the construction of a new video hall.

loans.use: To construct a new video hall

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en:
Yousef is a 37-year-old man from Tulkarem. He is the father of five children who are school students. Yousef is an employee with a very small salary that is barely enough to cover his household expenses.

Yousef came to FATEN to take a $550 loan to cover dental expenses, because his income is too low to pay for a dental insurance plan, and he is suffering from dental problems. Because his dental treatment was expensive, he had to take a loan to pay for it.

In the picture, Yousef appears FATEN's office in Tulkarem.

loans.use: Dental treatment

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es:
Isidro tiene 47 años de edad, reside en San Rafael de Oriente, Departamento de San Miguel, es casado y tiene dos hijos los cuales son independeientes, vive solo con la esposa, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijoles.
El  cultivo de la tierra se los enseñaron los padres, tiene experiencia en el cultivo de maíz y frijoles, actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para compra de  Fertilizantes para cultivo de Maiz y frijoles que le permitan obtener una buena cosecha, el préstamo le ayudara para cubrir necesidades básicas. 
Las aspiraciones son cultivar la tierra para generar ingresos y sacar adelante la familia, contribuir a mejorar las condiciones de vida de la familia.
texts.en:
Isidro is 47 years old and lives in “San Rafael de Oriente” in the San Miguel department. He is married and has two adult children on their own. He lives with his wife and works as a farmer raising corn and beans. His parents taught him how to work the land and he is experienced in the raising of corn and beans. He is requesting a loan so that he can buy fertilizer for his corn and bean crop, which will help bring him a better harvest. The loan will help him cover his basic expenses. His aspirations are to work the land to earn an income, to move his family ahead, and to improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a farmer from the town of Murang'a in Rift Vally Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for the last 14 years and has employed two casual laborers. His main products are milk and coffee which he sells through Kenya Cooperative Creameries and the local market. He also depends on his pension and the income from his quarry services care for his needs.

Charles is 65 years old and a separated father of 3 children who are all adults.

Charles has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 53,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that this loan will help him own a good dairy cow that will produce enough milk for sale and increase his income. He would like to venture fully in dairy farming by acquiring at least 3 pure bred dairy cows producing over 40 liters of milk daily.

Charles is very satisfied with the services from Juhudi. He considers Juhudi to be very supportive of small scale farmers and feels he will go far partnering with Juhudi.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Khorn's Group

texts.en:
A group of four people from Chrouy Poun village in Takeo province are asking for a loan, and have selected Mrs. Khorn M. as their group leader. The group members will use their individual portions of the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Khorn M., born in 1966, is a farmer who owns a two point six-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice for sale to support her family, while her husband, Mr. Chan Ben, is the village chief. Her problem is that her field has infertile soil. So to improve the quantity and quality of rice production, Mrs. Khorn M. is requesting a loan manly to buy fertilizers and use rest of the loan to hire a plow machine to plow her field. She has four children, two of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory, while the other two are attending school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Khanga Group

texts.en:
Havinitishi N., who is in her middle thirties, is married with two sons and two daughters. She has been running a grocery business selling beer, soda and water for two years. She works from 4 p.m. to 12 p.m. and is able to earn a monthly profit of about $92.

This will be Havinitishi’s 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She has successfully paid back her previous loans which she used to increase her stock and bought empty beer crates and chairs.

Havinitishi hopes for this loan so that she can buy a TV and also start selling spirits. Her dream is to buy a car that she can use to carry her grocery products.

Havinitishi will share this loan with her loan group, Khanga, which totals fifteen members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.

In the photo, Havinitishi is at the back, second from the right.

loans.use: To buy a TV and start selling spirits

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Mrs. Long L., age 35, is married with seven children: two are married and five are single. She has been a domestic rice planter since she was single. Sometimes she receives help growing crops from her husband. In addition, her husband works as a building laborer, moving from construction site to construction site around the province. 

Long L. has been planning to buy a plot of her neighbor’s farmland in a good place for growing, but her goal is not coming true due to lack of funds. To achieve the goal, Long L. would like a loan to buy the land where she will grow various crops for extra profit.

loans.use: To buy land to grow various crops

loans.name: Makhoul

texts.en: Makhoul is a 47 years old married man, father of four children, living in Bint Jbeil with his beloved family. Makhoul owns a generator, through which he provides electricity to multiple houses in his village and in the neighborhood.  Since 1990 he has also been doing construction work since he’s an electrician . Makhoul is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the second time, in order to pay for his kids’ school fees and supplies. The previous loan was for his business, through which he bought the generator he is working on now, and was very effective.  He hopes to expand his business and relax in the future.

loans.use: To pay for his kids' school fees

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi est une femme de 34 ans, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de pagnes, voulant augmenter son revenu, elle a ajouté plus tard à ce commerce la vente d’assiettes. Pour toucher une plus grande clientèle, elle fait son commerce de façon ambulante. Elle a commencé ce commerce en 2006. Elle fait face à une rupture de stock et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 15 paires de pagnes et divers assiettes. Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants.
texts.en: Afi is a 34-year old woman who has an income-generating activity selling "pagnes" (a West African term for colourful pieces of fabric). In order to boost her income, she has subsequently complemented this business with the sale of plates. To reach a wider customer base, she carries out her business on a door-to-door basis. She began her business in 2006. She is experiencing a stock shortage and is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 15 pairs of "pagnes" and a variety of plates. She is married and mother to two children.

loans.use: Purchase of "pagnes"

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal  “CORAZON DE JESUS DE CCATCCAPAMPA ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Ocongate perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Jesus;   él tiene 53 años de edad, es casado y tiene 5 hijos,  El socio es natural de Ocongate,  Él socio trabajaba como obrero en la carretera interoceánica,  y también es carpintero de oficio, el socio ahora solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales de carpintería como son madera, el viajará a la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado a comprar madera al por mayor. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar madera.

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This parnter belongs to the community bank “CORAZON DE JESUS DE CCATCCAPAMPA ” which translates to "Heart of Jesus of Ccatccapampa".  The bank is located in the Ocongate district which belongs to the Quispicanchis province in the department of Cusco.

The partner is Mr. Jesus, he is 53 years old, married and has 5 children. He is a native of Ocongate. He worked as a laborer on the inter-oceanic highway and is also a carpenter. He is requesting a loan to purchase carpentry materials such as wood. He will travel to the city of Puerto Maldonado to buy wood in bulk. 

He appreciates and values the loan provided through this medium and also agrees to comply with the payment of his dues on time.

loans.use: Purchase wood.

loans.name: Terciopelo De Santa Rosa Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Terciopelo de Santa Rosa. Está ubicado en la comunidad de Santa Rosa de Lima en el Estado de México. El grupo está conformado por 11 integrantes y es la primera vez que solicita un crédito a CrediComún.Maria Luisa García es integrante de este grupo. Tiene 47 años estudio hasta el cuarto año de primaria,  es ama de casa principalmente pero tambien se dedica al comercio y tiene en total 2 hijos (varones). Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de borregos que inicio hace 3 años. Solicita el prestamo para comprar alimento y borregos. Sus clientes son sus propios vecinos de Santa Rosa de Lima.Al momento de solicitar este prestamo se siente contenta y comprometida con la responsabilidad que conlleva solicitar el credito. Quiere este prestamo para fortalecer y hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en: This group is called Terciopelo de Santa Rosa (Velvet of Santa Rosa). It is located in the community of Santa Rosa de Lima in the state of México. The group consists of 11 members, and this is the first time that they have applied for a loan at CrediComún. Maria Luisa G. is one of the members. She is 47 years old, and she attended school up to the fourth year of primary school. She has two sons. She is mainly a housewife, but she also has a business. She buys and sells lambs, a business that she began two years ago. She is applying for the loan to buy feed and lambs. Her customers are her own neighbors in Santa Rosa de Lima. On applying for this loan, she felt happy and committed to the responsibility that goes with applying for the loan.She wants this loan to strengthen and grow her business.

loans.use: Buy feed and lambs.

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Dominic N. is 32 years old and married to Ngina, who is 28 years old and a farmer. They have been blessed with three children aged ten, nine and eight years old. Dominic has been in the shoemaking business for seven years, from which he earns a profit of 8,000 KES monthly. The fact that his wife contributes to meeting their daily expenses through her farming makes him succeed.

This is Dominic’s first loan from KADET LTD, to which he was introduced by a friend. He plans to use his expected profits to educate his children to the highest level possible. He hopes and dreams of owning a house for his family.

loans.use: To purchase shoes, leather and other accessories

loans.name: Nohemi Rosalia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA LUZ DEL MAÑANA NRO II”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nohemi Rosalia; ella tiene 30 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de materiales de construcción socia vende cemento, piedras, arena y ladrillos, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de materiales de construcción. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "NEW LIGHT OF TOMORROW NRO II".  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member is Mrs. Nohemi Rosalia.  She is 30 years old and is married with 2 children.  She combines her daily activities with the business of selling building materials.  The member sells cement, stone, sand and bricks.  She works from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm, and wants to expand the business of selling building materials. The member is requesting a loan to buy construction materials.

The member is happy for the loan and agrees to comply with the repayment.

loans.use: The member wants a loan to buy building materials

loans.name: Soo

texts.en:
Soo F. is 48 and married with 6 children. She owns a business venture selling fried foods in the local community. Soo has 2 years of experience in this business. Soo needs a loan of 1000 WST to purchase raw ingredients needed to make food such as soy-sauce, tomato sauce, mutton flaps, chicken leg quarter, onions and rice. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or US $250 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Soo joined SPBD. This is her first loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Soo's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Erwin Daniel

texts.es:
Erwin Daniel V. M. Es soltero Vive con los padres En el cantón Ventanas provincia de los ríos. No tiene hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. JESUS NOS AMA se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto los Amarillos, Perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Erwin Daniel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, cacao desde hace 5 años. Compra sus productos en Agripac Eicopa, y  vende en la feria en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz, arroz, Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es culminar sus estudios, comprarse una casa y una finca.

Le gusta practicar el deporte.
texts.en:
Erwin Daniel V. M. is single and lives with his parents in Ventanas canton, in Los Rios province.  He doesn't have any children.

The JESUS NOS AMA community bank is located in Los Amarillos neighborhood, in Ventanas canton.  The members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.  They have been in this line of work for a long time.

Erwin Daniel is a farmer who has been growing corn, rice and cacao for 5 years.  He buys his products in Agripac Eicopa and sells his products in Ventanas market.

Erwin Daniel is requesting this loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers for his corn and rice crops.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs.  He faces challenges in his work such as pests, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  His dream is to finish his studies and to buy his own home and farm.

Erwin Daniel likes taking part in sports.

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Sehliyali

texts.ru:
Sehliyali M. 40 let. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey  odin iz kotorix uchitsya v shkole a druqoy v kolledje. Sehliyali yavlyayetsya IDP personom , on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda i seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey lubimoy semyoy. On uje 10 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom.
Ranshe on razvodil baranom no teper on uje razvodit korov. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chto bi kupit korovi dlya razvitiya svoyeqo biznessa i uvelicheniya kolichestva proizvoditelnoqo produkta. Sehliyali prodayet u sebya doma yogurt, moloko i maslo.
texts.en:
Sehliyali M. is 40 years old. He is married and has 2 children, one of whom is in school and the other in college. Sehliayli is an Internally Displaced Person, relocated from the town of Fuzuli and now living in the Region of Fuzuli together with his beloved family. He has been raising livestock for 10 years.

He used to raise sheep but now he raises cows. At present he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy  cows so as to develop his business further and increase his production. Sehliayli sells yogurt, milk and butter out of his home.

loans.use: Purchasing  cows

loans.name: Shirley's Group

texts.en:
Shirley I. is from the village of Villa Peña Cabarroguis Quirino. She is 36 years old. Shirley is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Shirley I..

Shirley is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Shirley owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Shirley has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Shirley joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Shirley has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Shirley is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Shirley from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a member of Maridadi group in Faulu Kenya.  To earn a living, she does tailoring.  She has been in the business for five years. In addition, she also does farming.  

She was previously selling second-hand clothes.  Being a mother of five, she works hard in her business to provide for her children.  Through Faulu Kenya, she has been economically empowered.  She hopes to expand her business in the future.  She has requested a second loan of 80,000 KES to buy fabric and thread.

loans.use: To buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fabric and thread for embroidering.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz tiene 42 años, es una mujer muy servicial. Es separada de su esposo, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 2 hijos de los 4 que tiene en total. Por más de 4 años viene alquilando su moto taxi a sus familiares cercanos, quienes le pagan por día, y parte de este dinero las va ahorrando para los requerimientos de su moto. De modo cuenta con dinero, para reparar las averías que sufriera su vehículo, y con la otra parte educa a sus hijos, con la esperanza que sean profesionales en el futuro y mejoren sus oportunidades en la vida. En vista de ello, se puso a vender productos de belleza a sus familiares y amistades de su barrio, y le esta resultando bien; solo que por el momento no cuenta con capita para poder invertir, por ello le urge tener un stock de productos, para dinamizar su negocio y le resulte más rentable. Asimismo en adelante anhela alquilar un puesto, y en ella vender golosinas con el apoyo de su hija. Es sus 16avo crédito que tiene con MFP, y ratifica su compromiso de seguir pagando puntualmente sus cuotas, para acceder a posteriores ayudas. De obtener el crédito que solicita, comprará productos de belleza y también arreglará el motor de su motocarro.
texts.en:
Luz is 42 years old and a very helpful woman.  She is separated from her husband and lives in her own home together with two of her four children.  For more than four years she has been renting out her motorcycle taxi to close family members who pay her by the day to use it.  Luz has been saving part of this money so that she can cover any repairs the motorcycle might need.  She uses some of her money to deal with any problems the vehicle might have and uses the rest to educate her children in the hope that they will become professionals in the future and thereby improve their opportunities in life.  In order to achieve this goal, she also started selling beauty products to her family members and friends in her neighborhood.  This business is doing well.  However, at the moment she doesn't have enough money to invest in it.  She needs to have products in stock so that she can energize her business and make it more profitable.  In the future, she would also like to rent a stall and sell sweet treats from it with her daughter's support.

This is Luz's 16th loan with MFP and she reaffirms her pledge to continue making her repayments on time so that she can access further loans in the future.  Luz will use the loan that she is requesting to buy beauty products.  She will also fix her vehicle's engine.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and to fix her vehicle's engine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Terezia

texts.en:
Terezia is a married woman with three children, one attends school while the other two are employed. They live at their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees and clothing.

For the past 20 years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. In addition she also sells shoes which contributes to her other source of income. Terezia faces a major challenge of competition from other shoes operators and high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 loan request she wants to purchase bundles of shoes and clothes for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of shoes and clothes for sale.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es: Raúl tiene 52 años, vive con su esposa y uno de sus 3 hijos  en su casa propia. Hace más de 30 años y medio elabora faldas típicas de su región que se llaman “faldas plisadas” y “falda de milrayas” y son hechas en su propio taller que se encuentra en su casa. Que junto a su esposa y uno de sus familiares, juntos trabajan en dicho taller, pues requiere de muchas manos para agilizar el trabajo y cumplir la demanda de varios pedidos que tiene, por lo que a veces requiere contratar dos personas más para cumplir con tal propósito. Disfruta mucho la actividad que realiza, ya que desde niña aprendió a valorar el apoyo de la familia, permitiéndole además de disfrutar agradables momentos con ellos. Por los años de experiencia  en este trabajo ya tiene clientes fijos que siempre solicitan estas faldas, además de ganar nuevos clientes, por ello espera comprar una maquina de coser. Es su crédito número 3 que tiene con MFP, y le agrada saber que es parte de un grupo de personas a las que considera como parte de su familia y puede aprender mucho de ellas por lo que ha decidió seguir trabando en estos próximos meses con su crédito grupal. En esta ocasión el crédito le servirá en la compra de telas y en el mantenimiento de su maquina de coser.
texts.en: Raul is 52 years old and he lives with his wife and one of their 3 children in a house they own. For more than 30 and a half years he has been making skirts that are traditional to their region, named "pleated skirts" and "striped skirts". They are made in his shop, located in his house. He and his wife work together with a family member in the shop. He needs many helpers to speed up the work and to meet the demand and the various orders that have been placed. Sometimes he wants to hire two more people to help him with his project. He enjoys his business. As a boy he learned to value family support and it has given him the opportunity to enjoy happy moments with them. For the years of experience in the business he has fixed clients who always request these skirts and he also earns new clients. He hopes to purchase a new sewing machine. This is his third loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and he is happy to know that he is part of a group of people who consider him to be part of their family. He can learn much from them which is why he has decided to keep working these next months with his communal bank. This loan will help him to purchase fabrics and to do maintenance repairs on his sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and to have his sewing machien repaired.

loans.name: Manuel Isabel

texts.pt:
Manuel Isabel nasceu na Cidade de Maputo, Provincia do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, casado pai de 2 filhos de 6 anos e outro de 7 meses de idade. Frequenta 12ª classe e nunca parou de estudar. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia,e não sustenta mais ninguem.

Nunca saiu de Maputo, apenas transferiu se para Boane depois de seu matrimonio. Trabalha como policial permanente ha 6 anos e tem como salario 5.500.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa, construção da sua residencia,e poupa algum..

Nunca fez emprestimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atraves da mãe.Este é o seu quarto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 12.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (pedra, ferro, areia, blocos e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa.

Compromete-se a pagar devidamente para aceder a outros créditos no futuro. Pretende solicitar novos  empréstimos para concluir a casa um dos seus grandes sonhos.
texts.en:
Manuel Isabel was born in the city of Maputo, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. He is married and has two children who are 6 years old and another who is 7 months old. Manuel attends 12th grade and never stopped studying. He lives in his own house with his family and supports no one else.

Manuel has never left Maputo District and only moved to Boane after he was married. He has worked as a police officer for six years and has a salary of 5,500 meticais per month, which he uses for household expenses and construction on his home. He also saves some money.

He has never had loans from other banks, and learned about Hluvuku through his mother. This is Manuel's fourth loan with Hluvuku. He is asking for 12,000 meticais to buy construction materials (stone, iron, sand, blocks and other items) to continue construction on his house.

He promises to make his payments promptly so he can get other loans in the future. He intends to ask for more loans to finish his house, which is one of his biggest dreams.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (stone, iron, sand, blocks, etc.).

loans.name: Kotognogontala 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe KOTOGNOGONTALA 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43ans, 4enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à FACHORIBOUGOU, un des villages de la commune de KABOILA dans la préfecture de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont : la tomate et le jakatou avec MAIMOUNATA 1ère à droite position debout.
 Avec son prêt, elle compte payer les frais de labour, acheter des intrants et les semences pour entretenir : 2hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 145.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
Elle souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’ exploiter un espace cultural encore plus grand pour mieux en tirer plus de gains.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Kotognogontala 4 group are married women averaging  43 years of age with four children and living mainly in polygamous families in Fachoribougou, a village in the commune of Kaboila in the prefecture of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to ensure the success of their agricultural activities during the winter season.
They are on their eighth loan with the institution. The previous loans have been duly repaid.

They cultivate tomatoes and “jakatou” [a vegetable from the eggplant] family. This is, for example, what  Maimounata  ( standing on the far right in the photo) does. With her loan, she plans to pay the costs of labor, buy agricultural inputs and seeds to work 2 hectares [5 acres] of land.

After harvesting, the produce is sold at the village and at the Sikasso market, to a customer base composed of both women and men.
She plans to earn an average monthly income of 145,500 per agricultural cycle. This income will allow her to pay off her loan and also help her husband with everyday expenses. She would like to continue her collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to work a greater plot of land and increase her income.

loans.use: to pay for the cost of manual labor, agricultural inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
Prisca Is 41 years old and supports a family of five members.  Her children are aged between twenty-four and eight years old.  She keeps livestock in her farm in Itigo and has been in operation for a period of ten years, earning a monthly income of ksh 10,000.

She has been given a loan from KADET of ksh.40,000, this being her third loan after she repaid her previous loans successfully.  She wishes to use the money to purchase one dairy cow and dairy feed. The profit earned  will be used to improve the livestock farm.

She dreams of being the leading entrepreneur in the area and creating job opportunities for others in her farm.

loans.use: To purchase one dairy cow and feed.

loans.name: Blanca Hortencia

texts.es:
Blanca Hortecia tiene 21 años, Es soltera vive con los padres, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. No tiene  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. EL PROGRESO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías de Mocache, perteneciente al Cantón Mocache, esta ventanilla se dedica a laborea de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz

Blanca se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz . Compra sus productos en Comercial Peña y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes .   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafios como la falta de dinero para seguir invirtiendo. Su sueño es hacer mi carro.

Le gusta tranajar en la agricultura y hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Blanca Hortecia is 21 years old.  She is single and lives with her parents in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  She doesn't have any children.

The 'El Progreso' community bank is located in Aguas Frías de Mocache, in Mocache canton.  The members of this bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.

Blanca is a farmer who grows corn and rice.  She buys her products in Comercial Peña and makes her sales in the wholesale market in Ventanas.

Blanca is requesting this loan to grown corn and rice.  She will buy supplies and fertilizers.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges in her business such as a lack of money to invest.  Her dream is to own a car.

Blanca enjoys farming and taking part in sports.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Maynelly

texts.es:
La ciudad de Echarate es la ciudad capital del distrito de Echarate de la Provincia de La Convención e importante centro de comercio de las valles de Lares y La Convención, las actividades principales son la producción de coca, café, cacao y frutales.

Maynelly tiene 22 años edad, tiene dos hijas y nació en la ciudad de Quillabamba (La Convención, Cusco). Actualmente, Maynelly vive en la ciudad Echarate y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas. Maynelly es una mujer trabajadora, emprendedora, responsable y amable se dedica a la venta de refrigerios, frutas, gelatinas de forma ambulatoria. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. La socia trabaja desde las 9 a 11 de la  mañana todos los días. En esta oportunidad Maynelly requiere el préstamo para comprar sandillas. Su sueño de Maynelly comprarse un carrito salchipapero y pollipapero.
texts.en: Echarate is the capital city of Echarate district in the province of La Convención. It is an important commercial center for the Lares and La Convención valleys. The main economic activities there are coca, coffee, cocoa, and fruit production. Maynelly is 22 years old, has two daughters, and was born in the city of Quillabamba (La Convención, Cusco). Currently, Maynelly lives and works in the city of Echarate. She is a hard-working woman who is enterprising, responsible, and friendly. She sells snacks, fruits, and gelatin in an ambulatory manner. She has been doing this work for several years and it is going well. Maynelly works from 9 to 11 in the morning every day. At this time, Maynelly needs a loan to buy watermelons. Her dream is to buy a cart for selling salchipapas and pollopapas [Peruvian fast food].

loans.use: to buy watermelons

loans.name: Ulmashon's Group

texts.en:
Ulmashon is the leader of this group. She is 23 and married to a constructor, whose monthly salary is about 5,000 KGS. She and her husband have a newborn baby. Two years ago with an initial investment of 6,000 KGS, Ulmashon started to sell fruits and vegetables. From this business she earns about 250 KGS per day. This profit enabled her to improve the living conditions of her family; she repaired the house and purchased furniture. With money received from this loan she wants to purchase more fruits and vegetables for trade. With the profits gained from her business, Ulmashon wants to purchase a cow for breeding in the near future.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy is 48 years old and married. She has two children and lives with them and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Thuy’s husband works as a laborer and porter.

Thuy earns an income to support her family by selling clothing, which she has done for the past six years. She plans to use this loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of clothes to sell. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her current customers and attract additional customers.  

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Morris

texts.en:
Morris is a married man with two children, both of whom are still too young for school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past year, he has operated a retail shop business, selling goods to his neighbors and passersby. His major business challenges include the seasonality of his business and delayed payments from customers who purchase goods on credit. He dreams of expanding his business in the future.

With the 20,000 KES loan he is requesting, he would like to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and washing detergents. He decided to join Yehu so that he could have greater access to loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase various retail items (e.g., bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and washing detergents).

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 53-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and four young children. He has 35 years of experience working in the mechanics field. In 1976, he opened a car repair shop. His work is specialized in repairing all American cars.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1500 from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to purchase needed mechanical equipment. He is optimistic about his business development and hopes that the coming year will continue to bring him positive growth.

loans.use: To purchase needed mechanical equipment.

loans.name: Crestituto

texts.en:
Crestituto is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with two children. 
Crestituto has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. He has run this business for one year. He has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy more canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Crestituto has been a member of Kiva partner, HSPFI, since 2011. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is 62 years old and lives in Caluya, Sapang Dalaga. He is married with four children. 
Jose works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. He has been doing this for 20 years. He has requested a loan of 20,000 to purchase 10 boxes of fish to sell. 
Jose has been a member of PMPC for 5 years.

loans.use: To purchase 10 boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es:
Luis, se dedica a la agricultura y albañilería, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, todos trabajan, su ocupación es en la tierra sembrando maíz y frijol, desde joven inicio este oficio, fue su padre quien se lo enseño, no tiene un horario fijo, porque atiende también la albañilería, construyendo y mejorando viviendas.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono, ya que tiene una siembra pequeña de maíz, y necesita fortalecerla con este material, para que resista y pueda producir abundantemente.
La aspiración de Luis es que su cosecha sea abundante y sana, que con este resultado le pueda garantizar alimentación a su familia.
texts.en:
Luis is a farmer and builder.  He lives with his wife and two children.  They all work.  Luis works the land, sowing corn and beans.  He started this work when he was young as his father taught him.  He does not work regular hours because he also works in the building trade, building and improving houses.

Luis is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer as he has a small corn crop which he needs to strengthen with this material so that it survives and can produce abundantly.

Luis' aspiration is to enjoy an abundant and healthy harvest.  This result will enable him to guarantee food for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his corn crop

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a 26-year-old single man. For the last three years he has been selling electronic goods such as computers, radios and televisions to make a living. Previously he was selling second-hand clothes. Stephen has been able to retain his business because of his good reputation with his customers. In the next five years, he wants to become more financially stable. Since Stephen joined Faulu Kenya he has been able to access loan funds to boost his business. He has requested for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy more computers, radios and televisions for resale.

loans.use: to buy computers, radios and televisions.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 46 years old, married, and an enterprising businesswoman. She and her husband are blessed with three children, ages 21, 19 and 15, respectively. Martha has been running a retail shop for the past 21 years with the monthly income KES 34,750, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her second loan term with KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. Martha will use the loan to buy a stock of sugar and maize meal to add to her shop. 

With the anticipated profits from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy a stock of sugar and maize meal to add to her shop.

loans.name: Jehova Jireh 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Ysabel is the coordinator of her group, Jehova Jireh 1 & 2, a group made up of 10 hard-working women. She makes her home in a simple structure in the rural area of Samana, a lush, rugged peninsula with a nascent tourism industry. She is a married woman with a child, and her only son has already grown and doesn't live with his parents.

Ysabel has had her business for approximately 10 years, which she started after saving enough capital to open the business from clothing sales at first. Now she is also selling catalog products from a very popular brand, and she is buying to resell.

She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing cosmetic and household products. She might buy body lotion, hair and body wash, and others from the same catalog. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business, especially this Christmas season. 

Ysabel says that her most difficult challenges are to build her house and plan for better living conditions. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying her work and she is hoping to visit a hotel at the beach to rest. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti.

loans.use: to buy different cosmetic products

loans.name: Zonia

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Zonia, La socia tiene 48 años D. edad, la socia tiene 2 hijos , la socia se sigue dedicando al negocio D. bar restaurant,ella prepara desayunos,almuerzos y cenas,la socia trabaja desD. las 9:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m,la socia tambien se sigue dedicando al negocio D. venta D. antiguedades,ella venD. mesas,sillas y cuadros,por medio D. este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio bar restaurant y negocio D. venta D. antiguedades . La socia solicita el crédito para implementar su negocio con la compra D.  platos, vasos, copas, cubiertos, mesas, sillas y tambien solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. muebles y cuadros para el negocio D. antiguedades.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir D. manera disciplinada con los pagos D. las cuotas.
texts.en:
Zonia is 48 years old and has two children.  She has a restaurant-bar where she prepares breakfast, lunch, and dinner and works from 9:00 am to 8:00 pm.  She also sells antiques and sells tables, chairs, and picture frames.  This business allows her to move her children ahead in life.

She would like to expand and improve her restaurant-bar and antiques businesses and is asking for this loan to buy plates, glasses, cups, silverware, tables, and chairs.   She will also use some of the money to buy furniture and frames for her antique business. 

She appreciates the support she is getting and is committed to being disciplined about making her payments.

loans.use: to buy restaurant supplies and furniture.

loans.name: Rukiya

texts.en:
Rukiya owns a beauty shop which has been in operation for the last three years. She lives in Likoni, Kenya. Rukiya is married and has four children. She began the business from her own personal savings and a "merry go round" scheme where people contribute and lend to one person in turns/rounds.

She is applying for a loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to purchase clothing, shoes, hand bags and cosmetics in preparation for the Christmas festivities.

Rukiya's main challenge is seasonality in her business and inflation. She looks forward to owning a wholesale and a car to transport her stock. She will use the additional income from this loan to renovate her shop.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, shoes, handbags and cosmetics.

loans.name: Tania

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  ”JOSE CARLOS MARIATEGUI”;  El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el mismo corazón del valle sagrado de los inkas, en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Tania;  La socia tiene 29 años de edad, La socia es conviviente, la socia tiene 2 hijos de 7, 3 años de edad; La socia se dedica a la agricultura como actividad principal, la socia siembra y cosecha verduras como lechugas, maíz, la socia en esta ocasión desea invertir el crédito en la compra  de semillas para lechuga, ella sembrara ahora dentro la primera semana de enero y para esto requiere el préstamo para la compra de semillas de lechuga.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Jose Carlos Mariategui community bank. The community bank is located in the heart of the Sacred Valley of the Incas, in the province of Urubamba and department of Cusco.

The member is Tania. She is 29 years old. She lives with her partner and has two children who are 7 and 3 years old. She is dedicated to agricultural as her principle activity. She sows and harvests vegetables like lettuce and maize. The member, on this occasion, wishes to invest the loan in the purchase of lettuce seeds. She will plant during the first week of January and, for this, she requires the loan in order to purchase the lettuce seeds.

The member is thankful for the loan and agrees to comply with the payment of her dues according to the schedule of payments.

loans.use: to purchase lettuce seeds.

loans.name: Carolina Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Carolina vive con su compañero de vida y sus dos pequeños hijos de cinco años y el otro de tres años. Ella se dedica a la panadería desde los doce años, ya que su mamá tenía este negocio en su casa. Pero desde hace seis meses le dijo a su mamá que le diera la oportunidad de instalar su propio negocio utilizando el equipo de su mamá y por las tardes trabaja elaborando donas que son las de su negocio.

La señora Carolina, compra la materia prima para elaborar el pan, junto con su mamá, ya que ella compra poco, porque esta comenzando. Para llegar al lugar donde compran los insumos abordan un autobús que tarda una hora en llegar.

Ella solicita el préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar dos bolsas de harina, 50 libras de azúcar, una caja de manteca y un galón de aceite. De esta manera ella obtendrá los insumos que necesita para elaborar el pan y poder ampliar la demanda, obtener mayores ganancias, para mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos.

El sueño de Carolina es comprar su propio horno, ya que ella utiliza el de su mamá e instalar su propia panadería. Además desea construir su propia casa de ladrillo, ya que en la que vive es de varitas de coco. Ella espera  alcanzar esos sueños con esfuerzo, trabajo y con ayuda de Fundación Campo.
texts.en:
Carolina lives with her partner and their two small children, who are five and three years old. She has been making bread for the past twelve years; her mother had this business in her house. Six months ago she asked her mother to give her the opportunity to start her own business using her mother’s equipment, so in the afternoons she works making donuts, which is her business.

Carolina buys the ingredients to make the bread along with her mother, since she buys little because she is just starting out. To go to the place where they buy the ingredients, they take a bus that takes an hour to get there.

She is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo to buy two bags of flour, 50 pounds of sugar, a case of shortening, and a gallon of cooking oil. This way she will get the ingredients she needs for making her bread and she will be able to increase demand, obtain better earnings, and improve the quality of life for her children. 

Carolina’s dream is to buy her own oven, because she uses her mother’s, and to open her own bread shop. She also wishes to build her own house with brick because the one she currently lives in is made from coconut tree fronds. She hopes to achieve her dreams through hard work and with the help of Fundación Campo.

loans.use: to buy two bags of flour, 50 pounds of sugar, a case of shortening, and a gallon of cooking oil.

loans.name: Elvia Rosa

texts.es: El cliente reside en la ciudad de Machala.  Comenzó con esta actividad tiempo atrás cuando su esposo la abandonó, entonces emprendió en la venta de gaseosas y el alquiler de baños.  Trabaja junto a su hijo de lunes a sábado.  Es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos, de los cuales uno estudia en escuela fiscal.  Desea a futuro construír su propia casa y mantener esta actividad junto a sus hijos.  Necesita el crédito para a la compra de bebidas (colas, aguas, hidratantes, etc.) para su venta.
texts.en:
This borrower resides in the city of Machala.  She started her business some time ago when her husband abandoned her.  At that point, she began selling sodas and managing pay toilets.  She and her son work together Monday through Saturday.  The borrower is a single mother with two children, one of whom attends a state school.  In the future, she would like to build a house of her own and maintain her business along with her children.  

The borrower needs a loan in order to buy beverages (colas, water, energy drinks, and other products) that she can sell.

loans.use: to buy colas, water, energy drinks, and other beverages.

loans.name: Nisopah A Group

texts.en:
Lhingboi is 39 years old married woman and is a mother to 3 sons and all her sons are still pursuing their studies. She is the representative of the group” NISOPAH A “and is also the featured borrower with her hand raise in the picture. Her husband is involves in cultivation and they reside in Saikul.
Lhingboi is hardworking woman and engage herself in small business to earns her living and support her family. Her income comes from selling vegetables at her shop. Since the income she get is not sufficient to meet the daily expenses of her family and also for paying her children educational fees, she wanted to keep more items in her shop so that she could make more profit.
Lhingboi applies for the loan so that she could keep more items like eatables, biscuits and other necessary items in her shop so that she could earn more for her family. She is eagerly waiting for the loan. Likewise the rest of the members are engage in other activities like cultivation, weaving and selling rice and are eagerly waiting for the loan to start their respective income generating activities.

loans.use: to buy stock of items like eatables, biscuits, soft drinks and other necessary items for her shop.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Madame A. Amina is a woman around 45 years old. Very dedicated to identifying and analyzing business opportunities, she chose selling smoked fish in the Gapé market as her principal commercial activity, which is quite successful. Yet because of very limited financial means, she is unable to meet demand. She has already successfully repaid four loans without difficulty.

Today she is asking for $800 which will allow her to put up new, larger ovens and to buy more boxes of fish. She will then be able to increase output and turnover. This will allow Madame A. Amina to enjoy the fruits of her labor and to better support her family.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Amina est une femme âgée de 45 ans environ. Très douée dans l’identification et dans l’analyse des opportunités d’affaires, elle s’est choisie pour activité principale la vente du poisson fumé au marché de Gapé qui lui réussit assez bien. Cependant, par ses moyens financiers très limités, elle est confrontée à beaucoup de demandes qu’elle est incapable de satisfaire. Elle a à son actif quatre (4) crédits soldés sans difficulté.

Elle sollicite aujourd’hui $800 qui serviront à installer de nouveaux fourneaux plus grands et à acheter plus de cartons de poissons. Ainsi elle augmentera sa production et son chiffre d’affaire. Ceci permettra à Madame A. Amina de vivre du fruit de son travail et de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: Install new ovens and buy more boxes of fish

loans.name: Doris Patricia

texts.en: Hello, my name is Doris, and my primary activity is the small grocery store I run from my house. I have been working at this type for job for several years, and the income it generates helps me be able to cover my household expenses. Most importantly, working at home allows me to take care of my children. Recently, sales have increased, and I need to stock my inventory so that I can offer a variety of products to my customers.

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, butter, rice, ice, soap, disposable diapers, dairy products and deli meats, etc.

loans.name: Chim Vuth

texts.en: Mr. Chim Vuth R. is 35 years old and works as a construction foreman in Phnom Penh.  He earns $5/day at this job. One of his three children supplements the family income by working as a barber.  Chim Vuth also helps support his two brothers that live with his family.  He will use this loan for his construction business--buying tools and helping to pay the wages of his employees until project fees are collected.  He would like to earn enough from his business to send all three of his children to state schools.

loans.use: to buy construction tools and pay his workers' advanced wages

loans.name: Carina Flora

texts.es:
Carina is 29 years old, married with six children. She opened a business from her house where she sells all types of women's and men's garments. For more than three years she has worked in this area. Her business is located right in the center of Piribebuy, which is one of the busiest areas and allows for a good amount of sales.

Apart from watching over her business, Carina is responsible for raising her six children. She states that it's not an easy job; you have to keep watch over the kids' education and check up on their homework in high school.

Carina is a dynamic, active and creative woman, as she is always looking to add more products to sell in her business. She recently started to sell shoes, which has generated good profits for her since the first month, she tells us. She invested her previous loans from Fundación Paraguaya in winter clothes and shoes. Now she would like to continue adding more products and variety to her business, thus she is asking for a loan to obtain school supplies to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Carina tiene 29 años, es casada y tiene 6 hijos. Ella abrió un negocio en su casa donde vende todo tipo de prendas para damas y caballeros, se dedica a este ramo hace mas de 3 años y su negocio está ubicado en el centro mismo de la ciudad de Piribebuy que es una de las zonas de mayor concurrencia, y que le permite tener un buen movimiento de ventas. La señora Carina además de atender el negocio tiene la responsabilidad de cuidar de sus seis hijos, ella manifiesta que es una tarea difícil, pues debe velar por los estudios de sus hijos y controlar las tareas del colegio. Carina, es una señora muy dinámica, activa y creativa, ya que en todo momento busca incorporar más productos para la venta en su negocio, hace poco empezó a vender zapatos, que según nos cuenta ya le ha generado buenas ganancias desde el primer mes. Los préstamos obtenidos de la Fundación Paraguaya con anterioridad los invirtió en la compra de ropas para invierno y zapatos; hoy día desea seguir incorporando nuevos productos y seguir variando su negocio, por lo que solicita un crédito para adquirir útiles escolares para vender.

loans.use: To buy school supplies like notebooks, pencils, pens, erasers, etc.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: “I started this business of pop corn years ago and it has helped me take care of my family. I know how to manage my capital to ensure continuity in the business.”  These are the words of Mrs. Esther O.. She is a married mother of 7 children, and is 46 years old. She is a member of LAPO, and is requesting a loan of US$550 to buy another machine and more maize to improve sales.

loans.use: To buy an additional machine and maize for production

loans.name: Gisela Edith

texts.es:
Gisela has shown a great interest in cooking since she was a little girl. Thanks to the knowledge imparted in her by her mother, she has been able to perfect this talent with time and has been able to contribute economically to her family. She diligently attends her clients and offers them a variety of dishes daily. She also dedicates herself to the production of plantains on her small farm, hard work which has let her open a store to increase her income even more. She lives in the native community of Mariscal Cáceres in Perene and her wish is to be able to liven up her store properly and to air-condition her food locale to be able to attend her clients efficiently. For this wish, she needs your help. Please contribute to helping Gisela better her businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer.

Gisela, desde niña siempre mostró un gran interés por la cocina, es así que gracias a los conocimientos impartidos por su madre, ha podido perfeccionar este talento con el tiempo y de esta manera ahora puede contribuir económicamente con su familia.Ella atiende diligentemente a sus clientes y les ofrece diversidad de platos diariamente; así mismo se dedica a la producción de plátanos en su pequeña chacra, trabajo arduo que le ha permitido abrir una tienda para incrementar aún más sus ingresos. Ella vive en una comunidad nativa de Mariscal Cáceres en Perene y su deseo es lograr ambientar su tienda debidamente y acondicionar su local de comida para atender a sus clientes eficientemente; para este anhelo necesita la ayuda de vosotros.Contribuya con la superación de Gisela

loans.use: To strengthen the small businesses that she owns.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa is 46 years old, married and has three small children. She and her husband have fought to keep the family moving forward. She has worked as a primary education teacher at a public school for 18 years. She wants to put up dividers in the rooms in her home to make it more livable.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Teresa tiene 46 años de edad, casada y con 3 hijos menores de edad, quien junto con el apoyo de su esposo han luchado dignamente para sacar adelante a sus pequeños hijos. ella se desempeña como profesora de primaria en un colegio público, lleva 18 años transmitiendo sus conocimientos a los niños. Requiere construir las divisiones de cada cuarto para así poder darles una vivienda más digna

loans.use: Purchase dividers for the rooms in her home.

loans.name: Zena's Jumuiya Group

texts.en:
Zena, age 30, is married with a 5 year old child. She has a business of selling charcoal in the Buguruni neighborhood in Dar es Salaam. It began in 2000. She works from 7am to 6pm daily, and in a month can earn a profit of about $90 from this business.

Zena hopes for a loan to increase her charcoal stock. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Mwanaidi, who sells soup for a living.

loans.use: To buy charcoal stock

loans.name: Elza

texts.en: Elza E. and her husband (her husband is pictured) own and operate a mechanics shop in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Devechi. Elza and her husband have two children, who also occasionally help with the day-to-day activities of the business. They have been operating the shop for the last 12 years and they are currently seeking funding so that they can continue to develop their business.

loans.use: To further develop their business

loans.name: Bahati's Tupendane Group

texts.en:
Bahati is 26 years old and is married woman with one child, aged two years old. Bahati owns a small food vendor store and kiosk, which she started in 2005. Everyday, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $15 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Joyce, who has a business dealing in food vending.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Kuku

texts.en:
Mrs. Kuku H. lives in Sainbu-Bhaishapati, Lalitpur. It is one of the developing villages of Lalitpur. Most of the people in this region are engaged in seasonal farming. Mrs. H. lives with her husband and two sons. Her husband Mr. Kul Bahadur H. works in a private office. Her sons are studying in grades 10 and 5 respectively.

Mrs. H. is a wholesaler in the potato business. She sells potatoes cheaply in the local market. She buys potatoes from the Kalimati bazaar which is one of the famous wholesale vegetable bazaars of the Kathmandu valley. Now Mrs. H. is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 475 to buy potatoes for her business.

loans.use: To buy potatoes for her little business

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther I. is 42 years old, married and has three children. She owns an apothecary where she sells drugs.  She has been a member of LAPO Microfinance for three years. She is requesting for a loan of $1,200 to enable her buy more drugs to sell. With this she said she would be able to serve her customer better. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more drugs for sale

loans.name: Nicolaza

texts.es:
Over 25 years ago Nicolaza and her hard-working husband, Juan, decided to leave their home town of Orurillo-Ayaviri in search of better work opportunities. While they were living in their small town they worked as farmers and raised cattle but those businesses couldn't cover their household expenses. As their family grew, need and hunger motivated them to leave their small town. Now they live in the city of Juliaca and Nicolaza sells food outdoors and also sells beautiful fabrics. Her hard-working husband works as a taxi driver. With much effort, they have been able to build a home and they are provided their beloved children with a good education. Everything was going well for the family and their businesses, but unfortunately a week ago Juan had a horrible traffic accident that left him in bad health. For this reason Nicolaza and her children are working hard and persevering in their businesses in order to have more income and to be able to cover the head of their family's medical costs. Your essential support will be a great help for Nicolaza and her family.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Hace más de 25 años Doña Nicolaza y su laborioso esposo Juan decidieron salir de su pueblo natal Orurillo- Ayaviri en busca de mejores oportunidades de trabajo, durante el tiempo que estuvieron viviendo en su pueblito se dedicaron a la agricultura y ganadería pero estas actividades no lograban cubrir los gastos de su hogar así que conforme llegaban más miembros la necesidad y el hambre los impulsó a abandonar su pueblito.Y actualmente radican en la ciudad de Juliaca, Doña Nicolaza con su noble labor de venta de comida en forma ambulatoria y sus bellos tejidos y su laborioso esposo con su trabajo de taxista, ambos con esfuerzo han logrado construir su casita y le están brindando educación a sus amados hijos.Todo marchaba bien en su familia y en sus negocios pero desafortunadamente hace sólo una semana Juan sufrió un terrible accidente de tránsito que lo dejó en un mal estado de salud, este hecho hace que Doña Nicolaza y sus hijos se esfuercen y perseveren en sus actividades con el fin de obtener mayores beneficios y cubrir con tranquilidad los gastos de medicamentos del jefe de familia.Tu indispensable aporte será una gran ayuda para doña Nicolaza y su familia.

loans.use: Increase her capital to expand Nicolaza's business to benefit her beloved husband.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth has been dedicated to selling clothing for 3 years. A friend encouraged her to start this business. She receives a larger quantity of orders during the holidays and the start of the school year. The loans that she has requested have helped her purchase clothing that she offers to her friends and acquaintances. Elizbeth would like to have a store where she can sell her clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Elizabeth se dedica a la venta de ropa por pedidos desde hace 3 años. Una amiga la animó a incursionar en este negocio. Ella recibe mayor cantidad de pedidos en temporadas de fiestas navideñas y campaña escolar. Los préstamos que ha solicitado le han ayudado para comprar la ropa que ofrece a sus amigos y conocidos. A Elizabeth le gustaría tener una tienda y vender ropa.

loans.use: To purchase the clothing that she sells to her friends and acquaintances

loans.name: Marie Louise

texts.fr:
This woman has a restaurant located close to the center of town, not far form the SONACOS factory. Every day, she welcomes several customers. Now, she would like to increase her stock of rice and other products (oil, tomato) in order to make an additional profit and to provide for the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Cette femme a un restaurant situe pres du centre ville non loin l'usine SONACOS. elle accueille plusieurs clients chaque jour ; maintemant, elle vaudrait renforcer son stock en riz et autres produits ( huile, tomate..) pour recevoir davantage de benefice afin subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To strengthen restaurant

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa tiene 38 años, vive con 3 de sus 4 hijos y su esposo.  Ella sabe que trabajar en equipo es más loable, por ello, junto a su esposo decidieron abrir un taller de cerrajería desde hace 15 años, el cual les ha servido para poder sostener a sus 4 hijos, realizan todo tipo de fabricaciones metálicas, tanto muebles, como estructuras para el hogar, como ventanas,  puertas, escaleras caracol, techos metálicos, entre otros.Por la calidad de producción, con el paso de los años Elsa y su esposo pueden ver el incremento  de sus clientes, para los cuales a veces es se ha necesario trabajar hasta los días sábados, su esposo se encarga de cortar y soldar, por su parte, Elsa da los acabados de pintando. 
Esta pareja de esposo se esfuerza para mejorar cada día la situación de la familia, para que sus hijos puedan superarse cada día más, a través de la educación que puedan solventar.
Elsa solicita este préstamo con el que podrá adquirir fierros, materia prima básica para  la elaboración de las construcciones metálicas.
texts.en:
Elsa is 38 years old, lives with 3 of her 4 children and her husband. She knows that working in a team is more commendable, and therefore, together with her husband they decided to open an ironworks shop 15 years ago, which has served to support their 4 children. They make all kinds of metal items, such as furniture, items for the home such as windows, doors, spiral stairs, metal roofs, and more. Because of the quality of their production, over the years Elsa and her husband can see the growth of their customers, and at times they have had to even work on Saturdays. Her husband is in charge of cutting and soldering, and Elsa does the finishing touches and painting. This husband and wife strive to improve their family’s situation every day, so that their children may be successful, and through education they can be free of debt. Elsa asks for a loan with which she will be able to acquire iron, the raw material needed to make the metal items.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire iron, the basic material to make furniture and metal structures

loans.name: Anvarali

texts.en: A. Anvarali is 47 years old. He lives in Isfara town. He is married and has three children. Anvarali is processing and selling dried apricots in the central local market. He is experienced in the business of making dried apricots. Anvarali is a hard-working man who has fought to provide for his family and educate his children, who today are working adults thanks to his example. He purchases dried fruits in the market and processes them together with his wife and his younger son. Because he buys dried apricot wholesale, his prices are lower than regular market prices. He offers a wide assortment of goods for clients of different means. All this allows Anvarali to make his business quite successful and it brings in a stable income for the family. Today he is requesting a loan to purchase more dried apricots to process and sell. He expresses his gratitude to everyone who supports him.

loans.use: Increasing inventory

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es: La Sra. Maria habita en un barrio que se llama Batahola Norte, tiene 53 años de edad, con una hija de 15 años de edad y tres hijos varones que ya trabajan y le ayudan, es madre soltera y ha logrado sacar a sus hijos adelante, vende golosinas y helados, inicio vendiendo ropa, pero decidió vender golosinas ya que se consume bastante por los estudiantes y le genera mas ingresos. Con la solicitud de préstamo es para infraestructura en la compra de cerámica para ponerle a un porche que tiene es de tierra y desea tener mas comodidad con su familia. A futuro es tener un cafetín de comidas rápidas para no enfocarse en un solo producto.nn
texts.en:
Maria lives in a neighborhood called Batahola Norte. She is 53 years old with one daughter, who is fifteen, and three sons who are already working and helping her. She is a single mother and has succeeded in improving the lives of her children. She sells candies and ice creams. She started out selling clothes but decided to sell candies since the students eat a rather lot of these and it generates a better income for her. The requested loan is for purchasing ceramic to apply to her porch, which is currently made of dirt and she wants to give her family more comfort. In the future she wants to have a small cafe of fast foods so she's not focused on just one product.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ceramic to put on her porch

loans.name: Pierette

texts.en:
Married to Maurice Noutai and the mother of two children in school, Pierette Noutai was born on June 25, 1971 in Porto-Novo in the south of Benin. Pierette has sold her wares in the Degakon intersection for the last six years. She specializes in beauty products, liquor, and assorted products such as milk and spaghetti. She would like to buy more liquor and cartons of cream to satisfy the coming holiday demand.

Alidé means “another path always exists for the most poor” in Fon, the principal tribal language of Cotonou, Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa sandwiched between Togo and Nigeria. GDP per capita stands at $1,500 and poverty is endemic to the capital city of Cotonou. Alidé operates seven different locations in and around Cotonou to ensure that those who need help can help themselves through small loans.

Mariée à NOUATIN Maurice et mère de deux enfants tous scolarisé, Dame NOUTAÏ Pierrette est néé le 25 juin 1971 à Porto-Novo au Sud du Bénin dans le département de l'Ouémé, Dame Pierrette pour écouler ses produits s'est depuits près de six ans installée au carrefour de Dégakon pour la vente de ses articles , Elle s'est spécialisée dans la vents des produits de beautés, des liqueurs et des articles divers tels que le lait,les spaguettis,,, Dame pierrette ayant quelques problèmes financière à réçu de sa ses clients des commandes pour les fêtes de fin d'année;ainsi, elle demande son premier crédit.

loans.use: Purchase of 2 boxes of liquor and 2 cartons of pommade

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
El Comité denominado Oñondivepa se conformó por la iniciativa emprendedora de la actual secretaria María Clotilde A., la misma había contactado con la asesora del programa para conformar el grupo. Se iniciaron en el mes de abril del 2.008.
Actualmente el comité está conformado por 17 integrantes las cuales se dedican a diversas actividades comerciales y cada una de ellas ha invertido el préstamo en: compra de gallinas ya que la zona en la cual se encuentra localizado el grupo la población se dedica en exclusiva a la venta de gallinas y huevos, compra de accesorios para la elaboración de bijouterie, compra de yerba mate, bebidas, cosméticos, mercería, etc.

El detalle de actividades por señora es como sigue:
1	Aurelia Báez	Venta de gallinas
2	Eliodora G.	Despensa 
3	María Estela M.	Venta de carbón
4	Graciela M.	Venta de huevos
5	Mirian M.	Despensa 
6	Diana C.	Venta de gallinas
7	María Clotilde A.	Venta de gallinas
8	María Del RosarioA.	Venta de gallinas
9	María Stela P.	Venta de remedios refrescantes
10	Hermelinda L.	Venta de gallinas y productos de limpieza
11	Gladis Ruíz Díaz	Venta de bebidas
12	Elodia M.	Venta de gallinas
13	Martha B.	Venta de gallinas
14	María Cristina A.	Venta de bijouterie
15	Alba C.	Venta de mercería
16	Marcelina Fernández	Venta de mercería
17	Modesta E.	Venta de gallinas

Los fondos serán invertidos en: compra leche, azúcar,  yerba mate, cosméticos, gallinas ya que la mayoría de las integrantes se dedican a la venta de gallinas, compra de accesorios para la elaboración bijouterie como canutillos, etc., compra de mercería, artículos básicos para el hogar para su posterior venta como: yerba mate, azúcar, carne, panificados, bebidas, etc..-
texts.en:
The Oñondivepa Committee was put together thanks to the entrepreneurial initiative of Maria Clotilde A., who is now the group's secretary. Maria Clotilde got in touch with one of Fundación Paraguaya's loan officer in order to put together the group, which began in April 2008.

The Oñodivepa Committee currently has 17 member, who are involved in a variety of commercial activities and will use their loans for different purposes.

Here is a list of the group members and their businesses:
1 Aurelia Báez, Chicken sales
2 Eliodora G., Grocery store
3 María Estela M., Charcoal sales
4 Graciela M., Egg sales
5 Mirian M., Grocery store
6 Diana C., Chicken sales
7 María Clotilde A., Chicken sales
8 María Del RosarioA., Chicken sales
9 María Stela P., Medicinal drinks sales
10 Hermelinda L., Sales of chickens and cleaning products
11 Gladis Ruíz Díaz Venta de bebidas
12 Elodia M., Chicken sales
13 Martha B., Chicken sales
14 María Cristina A., Jewelry sales
15 Alba C., Hardware sales
16 Marcelina Fernández, Hardware sales
17 Modesta E., Chicken sales

The group members will use their loans to buy: milk, sugar, yerba mate, cosmetics, chickens (since the community where the group lives is made up primarily of chicken farmers, who subsist on chicken and egg sales), beads for jewelry-making, hardware items, and other basic household items which will be bought and resold (like meat, bread and drinks).


Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy milk, sugar, yerba mate, cosmetics, chickens, beads for jewelry-making, hardware items and basic household goods

loans.name: Koy

texts.en:
Koy S., 32, lives in Kompong Tom Province. She has been working as a rice cultivator since 2000. As another source of income, she sews clothes for her villagers. She is married to Chin Hort, age 39. He works with his wife at rice growing. He also catches fish to sell, using his own nets and traps to fish in and around Tunle Sap Lake. They have one child, who is still young and attends school.

With the rice farming business, S. can grow rice twice a year, in the rainy season and the dry season. Rice farming is S.'s main way to earn income to cover her family's living expenses. S. needs a loan to purchase fertilizer, gasoline, and a pump to use for rice farming. She and her mother are pictured on their farmland.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, gasoline, and a pump

loans.name: Matei

texts.en: L. Matei is a very popular person in her village. She gives farming advice to the villagers about the best time for sowing seeds and when to harvest. In sharing her knowledge, L. has mentored some strong competitors on the local wholesale market in the Cimislia district. Using her vast experience, she would like to expand her own farming business.
