With a loan from MicroInvest, she will be able to offer a greater supply than her competitors.

loans.use: To increase her farm production and sales

loans.name: Thi Thoa's Group

texts.vi:
Đỗ Thị Thoa sinh năm 1978, ( Mã số: 010103040024 ), Chị thường mua bán gạo phục vụ người dân. Chị tham gia vay mức: 2.436.000 VND để mua thóc về xay xát thành gạo đem bán.
 Nguyễn Thị Thủy sinh năm 1983, ( Mã số: 010103040020 ). Chị làm thợ may, có thu nhập theo ngày khoảng 100.000 VND / ngày. Chị vay: 2.436.000 VND để chăn nuôi gà.
texts.en:
• Mrs. D. T. Thoa (ID No: 010103040024), born in 1978, buys and sells rice to other villagers. She would like to borrow 2,436,000VND to purchase rice to husk and sell.
  • Mrs. Nguyen T. T. (ID No: 010103040020), born in 1983, is a seamstress. Her average daily income is 100,000VND. She would like to borrow 2,436,000VND to raise chickens.

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Yen Thanh Pham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing rice

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy sells second hand shoes. The demand for her second hand shoes is high and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She hopes for a loan of N100,000 to purchase more second hand shoes to sell. She is 30 years old and single. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more second hand shoes to sell

loans.name: Jitahidini Group

texts.en:
Saumu has been a bites (chapati and maandazi--sweet fried breads) seller in the Darajabovu neighborhood of Zanzibar for 7 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 50. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.

She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more food items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Saumu is 32 years old, married, and has a seventeen-year-old child. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Fatma, who has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Olaberdi

texts.ru: Олаберди Сотиболдиев  1955 годарождения , женат имеет  7 детей. Все дети обустроены хорошо. Старшие сыновья имеют свои семьи, время от времени  помогают ему. Олаберди имеет 2  высшых образования , одно педагогическиое и второе бухгалтерский учет.  Работает он в школе бухгалтером. Но заработную плату с после новго года неполучал.  Поэтому дома  содержит большое стадо коров и коз. Сейчас стадо взрослых коров и коз пасуться на пастбище. Молодняк остается дома , потому что им трудно идти в дальную дорогу. Кредит получил на покупку скота, на эти деньги он купил 6 коров. Благодарен КИВА за поддержку и планирует  сотрудничать с Микроинвест и в будущем.
texts.en:
Olaberdi S. was born in 1955. He is married and has seven children. All of his children are doing well. The older sons have their own families, and from time to time assist him. Olaberdi studied both teaching and bookkeeping in college. He works in a school as a bookkeeper, but he has not received his salary since the beginning of the year. Therefore, at home he keeps a large herd of cows and goats, which he puts out to pasture; however, the young ones stay close to home, as it is difficult for them to travel a long ways. The loan he took out was for the purchase of cattle, and with this money he bought six cows. Olaberdi is grateful to Kiva for the support, and plans to remain a client of MicroInvest in the future.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella, 35 and married with five children, owns a boutique where she sells bags and clothes. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more bags to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags to sell.

loans.name: Levi

texts.en:
Levi D. is currently in the business of selling dresses, bedsheets and shoes and is requesting a loan to open up a store. Levi is 35 years old and is widowed. She has two children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to purchase land for the future of her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open up a store

loans.name: Hope

texts.en: Hope lives in Badagry, Lagos state. She sells medicines at retail and wholesale. Hope is married with 4 children, and she is 42 years old. Hope is requesting a loan for the amount of 150,000 NGN to purchase more medicines to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
"N. Nguyễn Thị (20201030041) is a 52 year-old woman living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. N. is the group leader of a 5-member loan group offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Phố chờ 07 (7).

N. is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, N. owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling school products such pencils, pens, and notebooks in the local community. N. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4.500.000 VND a month from these activities.

N. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. N. is requesting a loan from SEDA for the first time. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 5.152.000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA. N. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1. Nguyễn Thị Lý (20201030042) is a 50 year-old woman who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector, raising livestock.

2. Nguyễn Thị T. Thả (20201030043) is a 19 year-old woman who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector.

3. Chu Thị H. (20201030044) is a 28 year-old woman who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector.

4. Nguyễn Thị H. (20201030045) is a 29 year-old woman who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector, operating a clothing business.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of VietN..

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

N. Nguyễn Thị (20201030041) là 52 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. N. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Phố chờ 07 (7). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các đồ dùng học tập như bút chì, bút viết & tập vở trong cộng đồng địa phương. N. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, N. kiếm được khoảng 4.500.000 VND. N. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. N. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ SEDA. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Nguyễn Thị Lý (20201030042) là 50 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 2. Nguyễn Thị T. Thả (20201030043) là 19 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ. 3. Chu Thị H. (20201030044) là 28 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ. 4. Nguyễn Thị H. (20201030045) là 29 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh quần áo. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt N. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. ."

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Emerita is a 48-year-old mother to two; a boy and a girl. She is happily married to Din-Din who is a jeepney driver and is 48 years old. She lives in the town of Angono, Rizal province in the Philippines. She has strong determination to bring her family out from poverty.

In 2008, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.),an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, with hope to have access to capital for her business: a sari-sari store (general store). Her previous loan was prudently invested in her sari-sari store and it brings her enough proceeds for her family.

Now on her 2nd loan, she proposes the amount of 10,000 pesos to pay for sacks of rice, gallons of cooking oil, liquors, beverages and groceries for her store. She is hopeful that her business will continue to grow and she is looking forward to saving for the future of her two kids. She intends to be able to send her children to school until college and also to expand her store into a much bigger one.

loans.use: To pay for sacks of rice, gallons of cooking oil, liquors, beverages, and groceries for her store

loans.name: Cusibamba Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Cusibamba inicia su primer ciclo con 14 socias. L. mayor parte D. las socias son D. L. comunidad D. Cusibamba, Distrito D. Morochucos, Provincia D. Cangallo, L. comunidad se ubica a 2 horas D. L. ciudad D. Ayacucho. L. actividad principal D. L. zona es L. producción D. productos lácteos.
	
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como L. crianza D. ganado vacuno, producción D. leche, y L. venta D. abarrotes en general.
	
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles  haciendo un total D. 6,900 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en L. compra D. arroz, azúcar, insumos para L. elaboración D. quesos.

Los sueños D. las socias son mejorar sus negocios y brindar una buena educación a sus hijo.
texts.en:
The Community Bank "Cusibamba" has loaned out their first loans to 14 members. Most of the members live in the community of Cusibamba in the Morochucos District, in Cangallo province. The community is located 2 hours from the city of Ayacucho. The major occupation in the region is milk farming.

The members all carry out different occupations, such as raising livestock, milk production, and running grocery stores.

The members requires different loan amounts, such as 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles, altogether adding up to loans of 6900 soles through the community bank.

The loans will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, and ingredients for cheese making.

Their dream is to improve their businesses and to proviD. a good education for their children.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, and ingredients for cheese making.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza D. is known by her nickname, “ Iza”, in their barangay (village): Brgy. Malasin, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She finished secondary education and is happily married to Mr. Alfonso D.. They are blessed with three children. Despite the hardships and difficulties of life, they still aim to be successful some day since they believed that, “Nothing is impossible to the person who [has] the strong faith and determination to achieve.” They help each other to earn and save for their survival and for the education of their children.

As a source of income, Mr. D. cultivates their farm by planting rice and vegetables, while Iza engages in the buying and selling of vegetables in their barangay. She uses her small working capital to acquire vegetables from Nueva Vizcaya Agricultural Terminal (NVAT) which she sells retail. With her patience and sacrifices, she is able to earn a net income of 700 PHP per week, which they use to satisfy their needs and to support the education of their three children.

Iza aims to improve her business, but she has inadequate capital. When one of the lending institutions offered their programs in their barangay, Iza voluntarily joined and applied for a loan of 5,000 PHP to have additional capital to acquire more fruits and vegetables to sell in their barangay. She is so thankful to join the organization, because it gives her the opportunity to strengthen her business.

loans.use: Additional capital for vegetable business

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther tiene 27 años, es una joven madre de familia muy alegre, vive en la casa de sus padres junto a sus dos hijos: Joel de 7  y Omar de 6 años, a quienes desea dar unos buenos estudios. Su negocio de golosinas está ubicado en la Explanada Laguna Temporal (lugar donde se realizan ferias en la ciudad de Juliaca), su puesto es muy concurrido por las personas que asisten a la feria, ya que prefieren comprarle a ella debido a la amabilidad y alegría con que atiende a sus clientes. Lo que más le gusta a Esther de su trabajo es que tiene la libertad para cuidar a sus hijos mientras vende sus golosinas, lleva 2 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto, pues tiene que cuidar y vender sus productos todo el tiempo. Para el futuro espera tener una tienda de abarrotes con la cual pueda mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
Este es el cuarto préstamo de Esther con MFP y se siente muy confiada de poder pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causar problemas en su banco comunal, donde es muy querida, pues es la socia más joven y alegre. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más golosinas y otros productos comestibles para ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Aura

texts.es:
Aura tiene 57 años, es viuda y vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 20 años se dedica a la venta de un plato de comida típico de su zona llamado “chicharrón”, que es carne de cerdo frita y tiene gran demanda entre los pobladores. Para ello, Aura implementó un espacio en su casa para su negocio, el cual atiende todos los días, por la tarde hasta la noche, y al día siguiente en la mañana realiza las compras necesarias para la preparación. Con estos años de experiencia Aura ha visto el fruto de su esfuerzo y los frutos de su negocio y esto la anima continuar trabajando para el incremento de sus ventas.
Este es su crédito número 16 con MFP, ella es parte de un banco comunal y además es una de las fundadoras, por lo que persevera en mantener activo su grupo y renueva su compromiso de pagar con puntualidad sus cuotas de pago. El dinero que ahora solicita será utilizado en la compra de cerdos y bebidas para acompañar sus comidas.
texts.en:
Aura is 57 years old. She is a widow and lives with her two children in her own home. For the last 20 years she has sold "chicharrón", a food typical to the area she lives in. Chicharrón is fried pork which is in high demand. To work in this way, Aura works in every afternoon to night in the part of her home set-aside for her business. The following morning she spends her time buying the things she needs to prepare the meat. With her years of experience, Aura has seen the fruits of her labor and the fruits of her business and is motivated to continue working and improving her sales. This is her 16th loan with MFP. She is one of the founding members of her village bank and works hard to keep her group active and renew their commitment to repaying on time. The money she is asking for now will be used to buy pork and drinks to accompany her food.

Translated from Spanish by Sierra Visher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pork and drinks for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Pharmaceutical products

loans.name: Noli Christopher

texts.en:
Noli Christopher V. and his wife are striving hard to overcome the hardships and difficulties in life. Noli is engaged in selling different scrap materials like plastic bottles, old newspapers, metals, plastics and other recyclable materials.

On the other hand, his wife sells different food snacks like rice cake, pancit (noodles), banana and camote cue (fried potato with sugar).

As fruit of their patience and sacrifice, they can earn a net income of 1000 PHP a week which they use for their daily needs and to save for the future of their two year old son. They want him to be successful someday in his chosen profession and have a bright future.

In this regard, they want to improve their small business to earn a higher income. Due to lack of financial capital, Noli is now asking to borrow a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to 8000 PHP to improve their small business.

They hope that lenders will grant their request so they can have a stable source of income.

loans.use: As additional capital in selling scrap materials.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 55 años, es viuda, vive con sus dos hijos que ya son mayores D. edad, trabajan y la apoyan en todo. DesD. hace 7 años se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza, empezó como agente vendedora y ahora, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación, es una ejecutiva D. ventas y la encargada D. comprar en cantidad estos productos para abastecer a sus agentes vendedoras.
Juana trabaja durante todo el día, ya que tiene que monitorear a 118 vendedoras y le gusta hacerlo con mucha paciencia, para poder dirigirlas eficientemente. 
Lo que le gusta D. su trabajo es que se relaciona con muchas personas y a raíz D. ello ha hecho muchos clientes y amistades, además es un negocio rentable y seguro.

Este es su 5to crédito con MFP, y lo que le gusta D. su banco comunal es que entre todos sus compañeros se entienden y trabajan muy bien. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más productos D. belleza para seguir incrementando su stock.
texts.en:
Juana is 55 years old, a widow, and lives with her two children. They are already adults who work and help her in every way. For the last 7 years, she has dedicated herself to selling beauty products. Juana began as a sales agent and now, thanks to her efforts and dedication, she is a sales executive, in charge of purchasing in quantity the products to supply her sales agents.

Juana works all day long, since she has to monitor 118 sales agents. She likes to do this patiently, in order to direct them efficiently.

What she likes best about her work is that in puts her in touch with many people. As a result, it has given her many clients and friendships. Besides, it is a profitable and secure business.

This is her 5th loan through MFP, and what she likes best about her community bank is that she and her companions get along and work together very well. With the money that Juana now solicits, she will buy more beauty products to continue augmenting her stock.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO INCREASE HER MERCHANDISE

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothing in bulk for reselling

loans.name: Suubi Lyamukama Group 2, Lugazi

texts.en:
J. Milly, 50 years old, is a hardworking and friendly lady. She is married with eight children, some of whom have gone to the University while the others are in secondary school. She also takes care of orphans who are also in school.

Milly has been a businesswoman with a poultry and farming business in Kitigoma for eighteen years and her major challenge for her poultry business is the scarcity of water for her chickens. For the farming business, she has had experience since childhood. She is able to make 200,000/= as weekly profits and she attributes this to her good customer care and the loans that increase her capital.

In future, Milly would like to become a wholesale supplier of chickens and eggs to big hotels, eating places, schools and universities plus build rentals for her children’s education in future while she is gone.

Milly needs a loan to be able to buy insecticides for her farming and feed for her chickens for better growth.

loans.use: To buy insecticides for her plantation and feed for her chickens

loans.name: Phall

texts.en: Mrs. Phall K. is a villager in Daeum Pou village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land where she cultivates rice. In this plantation, she faces an obstacle because her field is infertile and it is far from an irrigation system. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Phall K. decided to ask for a third loan to buy fertilizers and fuel to support the rice field and water machine, and the rest of the loan will be used to buy rice seeds and plow the rice field. Her husband, Mr. Reat Pan, has a rice mill so he can earn a little money to support the family. This couple has two children, one of whom is a laborer in a garment factory and the other is studying at a local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Angie

texts.en:
Angie G., 41 is married to Jaime G., a jail officer, are are blessed with three children. She makes sure she helps her husband earn enough money so their family can have a better life.  She has been selling prepaid mobile phone credits for more than a year.

Angie has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow six times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed by buying load credits for prepaid subscribers.   Her business lets her earn an additional profit of PHP 4,500 per month.  

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 14,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying mobile phone prepaid load credits.

She dreams that her business will help her save enough moneyfor the future schooling of her children. 


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buying mobile phone prepaid load credits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy goats
